Reviews.Title: “Really Surprised”
Reviews.Author: Christine92
Reviews.Content: We booked the Flatotel for 5 nights, and only read the reviews on Tripadvisor after we booked so we were a bit worried about what lay ahead in this hotel. I emailed the hotel and asked for a refurbished room. All i can say is we were really surprised, the room was large, modern and clean,the bathroom was on the small side, but it was lovely, and that too was modern and spotless. The Lifts are a bit on the slow side, but we used the service lift a few times as did a lot of people. The breakfast consists of fruit and pastries tea or coffee, its ok and fills a gap before you head out. As regards the staff the restaurant staff are friendly and as is the bell boy and door man, although one or two of the reception staff could do with a week or two in a charm school.Overall we enjoyed our stay at the Flatotel and would stay there again. The Location of this hotel is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Good location in Need of Some Updating”
Reviews.Author: BallparkBob
Reviews.Content: Hear representing 84444.com at a conference. Great location near Radio City Music Hall, 30 Rock, and Times Square. Rooms were ok, but in need of some upgrades. My window opened (which is a little odd on the 20th floor of a NYC high rise hotel), the shower had a half door which made water coming on the floor unavoidable. The bed was clean, but a bit hard. The TV was circa 1990. Long waits for elevators. Continental breakfast was free and a nice touch, but not much to choose from. Positives was cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in the heart of New York, not sure about service...”
Reviews.Author: busymothertoronto
Reviews.Content: This is 5 min away from Times Square, Central Park, Broadway, so very good location. I got the room through one of the discount sites, don't know if the staff knows and treats us accordingly, I'll come back to that. Room included continental breakfast, it was excellent - fresh pastries, good orange juice and coffee, fruit salad, bagels. You could also pay for "a la carte" if you wanted a hot breakfast. There was also free coffee early in the morning. I used the business office every day, good internet access, free printing, that was nice. We had a room with a king bed, there was 3 of us, so I asked for a rollaway bed, $35/ night. Much more expensive than anywhere else I have been in the States, but perhaps that's the going price in New York. What I considered a ripoff however was the $13/ day we had to pay for internet, when these days most places now offer it for free. Not only that, but it was only good for one device! We had two laptops, so only one could access the internet on any given day. They say the room comes with DVD player, well you have to ask for one, because they are not in the room. Also, the tvs are very old. I asked for a DVD player 3 different days before I got one, they have a limited number. There is no ice machine, and the vending machines are only on the ground floor. I called twice to get an extra pillow and gave up, never got one. We got two face cloths the first couple of days, one the 3rd day, then none for the remainder of our stay. I didn't bother calling them after my other attempts. I just used their towels to wash my face. And finally, I asked for a wake up call for the morning we were leaving for the airport, I was right in front of the guy at reception when I asked and saw him write it down. Thankfully I woke up on my own because they never called. So again I don't know if we were treated poorly because we were in a discounted room, or that's just the way they are. We were gone all day, never made any noise at night and kept the room tidy so it's not like we were disruptive or sloppy guests. So really great location, room was ok, breakfast was great, don't count on the service...

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: LauraLouW
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Flatotel between 15th and 19th March 2012. Due to our flight from the UK we arrived just after 10pm and went straight to our room. The radiator in our room had been left on and it was like walking into a sauna. There was no obvious way of turning the radiator down, so we called reception and they sent someone up straight away to turn it off. This was the only major problem we had at the hotel and it was fixed very quickly. I would recommend that the hotel change the shower heads though they use in the bathrooms, not only was it complicated to turn on, but it also sprayed water all over the bathroom. We were on the 10th floor and had a wonderful view out onto the Bank of America building (the lights change colour on the top of the building). The only other little niggles were that the bed was a bit too hard and that the walls between the rooms appeared to be very thin. The occupier of the next room had a cold and we were even able to hear him blow his nose, as well as use the bathroom. Not great if you want a bit of privacy! The hotel is a between Times Square and Central Park and is a fantastic location. We found we were able to walk the distance from the hotel to the Empire State building (14 blocks) but there are also brilliant bus tours that you can pick up from Times Square that take you all over the city.

Reviews.Title: “OK”
Reviews.Author: BillInSomerville
Reviews.Content: Location is great near a bunch of theaters and Times Square, not to far from the park. Room was not so great. The walls were oddly bare, not a single painting or photo, nothing. My room had no view, just the Hotel facing my window. Bed was comfortable. Bathroom was odd, big jetted tub with no jets, low shower head had to duck to use. Bathtub was dingy at best. TV was the old tube variety, obviously not HD and takes up tons of space in the room. Service was fine. Elevators take forever to get to your floor.

Reviews.Title: “well kept secret”
Reviews.Author: TheHerb
Reviews.Content: Great location and value. This is our 3rd or 4th stay and we have never been disappointed. Rooms are large and quiet. Whirlpool tub a nice touch. Stayed night before St Patricks day and hotel was quiet. Free continental breakfast a plus especially since you are actually seated by a host and avoid the free for all at most free breakfasts. Also offer full menu for breakfast. Only downside was bar closing at 11 on Friday night. But Rosy O'.Grady's is a half block away. Hotel is convenient to Broadway and 7th Ave subway.

Reviews.Title: “An average hotel with a great location”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Guy39
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Flatotel with my girlfriend on a recent trip to New York City. This is not our first visit to New York and we have stayed in Manhattan before. We booked the room on Hotwire, that is blindly, so we got a great rate and the hotel seemed to get good reviews on Trip Advisor. Upon arriving at our room, the first thing we notice was that there was a strong smell of cigarette smoke. We had booked a non-smoking room, so I contacted the front desk and was told very curtly that the room and floor were in fact non-smoking. The person at the front desk seemed to be unaffected by the fact that the room smelled strongly of smoke and offered no solutions to the problem. Following this the sink in the bathroom broke and we found that the in room safe was locked. Now each of these problems were resolved by hotel staff in relatively short periods of time but on top of the smoke smell it left a very bad first impression. The hotel room itself was basic but functional. The bathroom was a little run down and small. The bathtub/shower combination only had a piece of class that covered half of the tubâ€™s length, the result of which was that water would splash onto the floor every time you showered. This was inconvenient and annoying. The living area of the room was reasonably large but the arrangement of the furniture caused roughly a quarter of the room not to be useable. The mattress on the bed was older and also smelt of smoke. Overall the room worked fine to come home and sleep but offered no charm or draw. One thing that Flatotel does have going for it is its location. It is just south of Central Park meaning it is in walking distance of most of the midtown sights. The hotel staff were very friendly and were able to fix most of the problems that came up very easily. For the price that we paid Flatotel offered a clean room with a good location. That having been said, I would not pay full price to stay at this hotel, nor would I book here again or recommend it to friends because of the condition of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: J M
Reviews.Content: I used Hotwire for my recent stay in NYC and was a little concerned after I read reviews on this hotel after I found out I would be staying at the Flatotel....but the price was amazing for NYC ($103) and the perfect location. I arrived around 12:30 and was happy to find that my room was ready for me. I was nervous to open the door but was pleasantly surprised at the size of the room (Queen Bed) and it was updated as far as flat screen TV (fuzzy reception), full length mirror and nice linens. The bathroom was also large and seemed to have been updated more than others I read about in reviews and was OK with a newer glass shower door. The room seemed a bit warm and the heating/cooling controls didn't seem to work so I cracked the window....not a good move as I couldn't get it closed, but I saw a maid as I was leaving the room and she said she would make sure it was closed and it was when I returned to my room later. And after that the room temperature was comfortable. The room was very quiet at night...I did think that after everyone got up in the morning there seemed to be a lot of loud noise...showers? Not sure. I didn't have problems with the elevators. I occassionaly had to wait a few minutes, but nothing like some of the other hotels in NYC. I only had juice and coffee in the morning but there seemed to be plenty of tables. There is a free business center with computers available to print out boarding passes. No wait at check in or check out. I have stayed at many hotels in NYC from 2 star to 5 star and felt that this hotel was a great value for what I paid for it and really enjoyed my trip. (I think that in generaly NYC hotels are over rated...not sure I would consider this more than a 3 star hotel). Great location and comfortable bed. I would stay again at the same rate but doubt I would rebook there if I had to pay much more for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place!”
Reviews.Author: Brittany D
Reviews.Content: Was at Flatotel for a 1-night stay while visiting NYC for my fiance's birthday. Hotel is in a great location, very close to central park and the subway. We were on the 17th floor, there were only 2 elevators for over 30 floors but generally they came quickly. Our room was a great size, clean and updated. Bed was very cozy. Bathroom was nice and clean, but water look a very long time to get hot. In the middle of a shower the water turned ice cold for a few minutes. Hotel staff was decent, some were more friendly than others. Lobby was modern and cozy. There was a bit of a line for check-out. There was a free continental breakfast offered but we didn't try that. We were able to safely check our bag at the hotel before check in and after checkout at no charge which was a great plus as we arrived by train and wanted to walk around without bringing our luggage with us. We would definitely stay here next time we visit NYC!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Alicia T
Reviews.Content: I booked this room for a night away while my boyfriend came to visit for a weekend. I found an amazing deal on Booking.com for $146 for a Premium King Suite. We were not disappointed! We both agreed that the room was larger than my studio apartment in Westchester County. We really did not spend much time in the hotel, but everyone we talked to were very nice and accommodating. They held our bags free of charge both before check-in and after check-out. The location is perfect if you don't mind walking (that's part of the fun of the city!). We also absolutely loved the bathroom--very modern. I called a few days ahead to request a corner room and they obliged. Even though we were only on the 9th floor, the view was quite appealing. The windows lined two sides of the room. I give this hotel a very high recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “great size rooms, esp for Manhattan!”
Reviews.Author: carmylondon
Reviews.Content: although this does not have all the luxuries of a hotel, the concierge was not as good as other hotels in NY i have experienced such as Hudson. the rooms here are so much bigger that it more than makes up for this. esp in Manhattan where space is a luxury most places do not offer. the bed was big and comfortable. the location is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Good Midtown location but dated rooms”
Reviews.Author: Kevin M
Reviews.Content: Some positives: - Good location - 5 minutes from Times Square and ideal for Broadway shows - Plenty of restaurants in the neigbourhood - Free continental breakfast (although limited to OJ, tea, coffee, bagels, muffins and fruit) but you can pay for other things - Compared with some hotels in NYC, the size of rooms are good - Free newspaper (NY Times) - Iron and ironing board Some negatives: - The rooms are really dated. I had a TV that I think was last spotted in the 1990's and picture was snowy. They could not fix it. Repair guy said, "it is just an old TV" - Bathroom in need of repair - Shower only has one pressure - hard! - Windows let a draft through

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Fabulous lobby, okay rooms”
Reviews.Author: TravelFamily2012
Reviews.Content: In town for a conference and booked through Hotwire. Got a fabulous rate of $135 for a small, double bed room. Lots of good points to this hotel. Staff was friendly, lobby/entrance well appointed and location is exceptionally convenient. But lots of bad points too. Elevators were dead slow and stopped at floors where no people were there. The room itself was tiny, tiny, tiny. I was glad my colleague had to cancel at the last minute as it was way too small for two people. I liked the in-room fridge and the bathroom had all the necessities. Overall, the room and bath were a little grubby but acceptable. My main problem was that someone nearby was smoking (10 floors away from the nearest smoking floor) and it was venting INTO my bathroom. After a couple of days, I finally convinced someone to duct tape a piece of cardboard over the bathroom vent and that seemed to solve the problem. Breakfast had a great fruit salad and selection of okay pastries and bagels. There is no in-room coffee supplies and coffee is not available in the lobby until 7am weekdays and 7:30 weekdays. This was frustrating when I had to be at 8am meetings (no time to eat). I don't see why coffee can't be put out in the lobby at 6 or 6:30 when staff was clearly walking around with cups of coffee themselves. I also found the signs 'begging' for tips at breakfast rather offensive. Either pay your staff appropriately or do not have a maitre'd and server for a self-serve buffet. Why should I tip to be seated and to receive a bill that says "0.00"? Seems totally unnecessary. Overall, this was good value for NYC. Don't know if I would have paid the listed rates, but for the Hotwire rate, I was willing to put up with the inconveniences.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible size!”
Reviews.Author: LEWiloner
Reviews.Content: In town with 2 family members for War Horse at Lincoln Center. The Flatotel 2 bedroom suite was unbelievably large -- it looked to be over 1,000 square feet! The hotel is an interesting mix. The best parts are the room size, very comfy beds, no noticable street noise, location, complementary continental breakfast, friendly staff, in-lobby bar with a neighborhood feel to it, and Gregory -- the most Broadway knowledgeable concierge I've found in all my years visiting NYC. The worst parts are too few elevators, not all rooms are renovated, and finishes/furnishings that are not of the highest quality.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel. With good location”
Reviews.Author: SRTACARLA
Reviews.Content: Small lobby. Ok service. Good location. Fair price. Good to stay for short time. Rooms are small but not bad when u are out all day and just need the room to go back and sleep at night.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: EveOrtega
Reviews.Content: I had an excellente stay. My room was always clean, the staff was pleasant and allow me to check in earlier . Everything was very close plus I got to go everywhere I wanted. The consierge was excellente.

Reviews.Title: “We Would Return”
Reviews.Author: tj198013
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I celebrated my birthday in NYC in February and stayed at the Flatotel. The hotel is conveniently located close to Times Square - but far enough away from the noise. While the hotel staff are not overly friendly, they are very helpful. The baggage handlers in the lobby who will hold your luggage before and after check-in/out are very friendly - even asking if we needed a taxi to the train station. The room was large and most importantly, clean. Free continental breakfast. Elevators are a little slow. :( We would return to the Flatotel on our next trip to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Felix R
Reviews.Content: I went to NYC w/ my girlfriend for the night, so we were really just looking for somewhere to lay our head down at the end of the night. The staff was pleasant and allowed us to check in early (10am) when check in is normally not until 4pm!. The parking lot we used was one block over but there was a crossing that allowed us to cut through when we walked back to the hotel. The room itself was average, large bathroom, but the bed was just about as hard as sleeping on the floor. I'm not a huge complainer so it didn't bother me that much, but it really was hard. The bar in the lobby was somewhat expensive, but that's how all the bars are in NYC. As far as location, it was close to shopping, a little bit away from Times Square(the center), but overall, it was very close to everything we did. I rely heavily on reviews whenever making any type of purchase, so in reading previous reviews on this hotel, i expected no more than an average experience; however, i think the hotel was above average and i would recommend it to anyone that doesn't mind a hard bed and is on a budget looking to stay at a nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Please read before booking your stay at Flatotel, NYC. (This review was based on a one night stay at the hotel.)”
Reviews.Author: Melissae5784
Reviews.Content: Flatotel was the hotel my boyfriend decided to book based on the location. The price seemed reasonable ($250 a night) especially since the hotel was right near Time Square. When we arrived there was a $50 fee to park in one of the parking garages near the hotel. When checking in one of the associates at the front desk suggested to use the parking garage around the block which charges only $30 for an over night. Could not find it.. We checked a few parking garages near the hotel and they seemed to be the same price - around $50. Eventually we arrived to our room. A little bit of a disappointment. Not all the channels on the television worked (came in static) and the television was very old. The bath tub was dirty. The apartment was very dreary. For the amount of money was expecting the hotel to be more "up to date." Later that evening the two of us sat at the bar. We order 2 shots of Jamerson, a glass of Sangria, and a glass of Sam Adams. The bill came out to $42 not including tip. I completely understand that any bar in NYC will be a little higher in price in a drink compared to somewhere else, but I would think if someone was a guest at the hotel they would get a little bit of a discount. The bartender who helped seemed to be nice, not very social compared to another bartender that helped us earlier that evening (at Joe G's). The hotel also offered a free continental breakfast between 7am to 10am. A big disappointment. There was table of hard crusted bagels, stale muffins, fruit, orange juice, condiments, and another sweet breakfast item (not quite sure what it was). There was another table with a pot of coffee and tea. There was another option to order breakfast such as eggs, but there was a charge. My boyfriend and I were seated by one of the associates. We were not given a menu. There was just a sign on the table stating the free continental breakfast and then a few breakfast items at a rediculous amount to purchase. Fifteen to twenty minutes into eating breakfast one of the waiters walked over to the table put down what seemed to be a bill it just stated that we had the free continental breakfast and then two arrows one pointing to the word tip and one pointing to signature. I found that a little rude since the waiters didn't do anything for us. They did not remove the dirty plates from our table. They didn't ask us if we wanted or needed anything. The waiters were just walking around. The overall staff we were NOT very impressed with. Most of the associates of the hotel seemed rude in my opinion. Extremely disappointed in the hotel and I WILL NOT STAY THERE AGAIN.

Reviews.Title: “Central location”
Reviews.Author: Jespas
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the best location to get to almost any part of the city. Turn left out of the front door, your 5 minutes from 5th Avenue, turn right, your 5 minutes from Broadway and Times Square. Our corner room, 803, was huge, tidy, with a 7' square bed. Bathroom a decent size, Hotel staff were pleasant, buffet continental breakfast was tasty with a good choice of fruit and pastries, A must do for anyone visiting is to go to the gym on the 46th floor, forget using the equipment, just great views. Would recommend highly unless someone wants to spend $925 a night at the NY Plaza.

Reviews.Title: “Great surprise!”
Reviews.Author: 76sunflower
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything you need in NYC. The rooms are huge and has an excellent location. It is a few blocks away from Time Square and Central Park. Easy to get to Broadway shows, up scale restaurants or just regular restaurants. Convenience of cafe and Carnegie Deli close by which is open late. The hotel staff was friendly and accommodating. Continental breakfast was not bad at all. Rooms need some TLC - but you really don't spend time in the room anyways.

Reviews.Title: “rooms are huge”
Reviews.Author: Susan J
Reviews.Content: nyc hotel rooms are notoriously small, this hotel has huge rooms. appointments are simple but adequate. I will trade the luxurious for the spacious any day. good location for midtown theater, shopping, restaurants, museums.

Reviews.Title: “Flatotel (February 2012)”
Reviews.Author: cldasher
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a room for 3 nights at Flatotel through priceline for $177 per night. We wanted something near Times Square but not one of the huge properties. We arrived early on the morning of our check-in and, although a non-smoking room was not ready, the front desk was very helpful and friendly in checking us in and storing our bags so we could hit the streets. The room we were given was spacious by any standards, but certainly nicer than most standard rooms in NYC. The bathroom in particular was roomy, probably 8x15. We had no trouble at all operating the shower, as some previous reviews have suggested. Room was clean and well appointed, perhaps only thing lacking was the standard ice-bucket and a coffee maker. The lobby was rarely crowded and always seem peaceful and quiet. We did not dine at the restaurant. If this is the part of town you want to stay in, I don't believe you could go wrong with this hotel and this price.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay and great location for theatres”
Reviews.Author: shagundala
Reviews.Content: I was very pleased with the hotel after our 3 night stay for part business and a base for Broadway shows, wandering and shopping. Close to everything, lots of good restaurants and subway nearby. Complimentary continental breakfast and more available at inhouse restaurant. Bar and lounge lively at night. Staff friendly and helpful. Room and bathroom spacious, clean and comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Flatotel is the perfect sightseer's location!”
Reviews.Author: 500JeanieRN
Reviews.Content: My 21 year old son and I recently stayed at Flatotel on 52nd street in Manhatten. We were very pleased with the central location, which was an easy walk to Time Square, Central Park and Rockefellar Center. This was our first time seeing the city and we couldn't be happier with our room and accomodations. The beds were comfortable with nice linens, our room was very clean and the free continental breakfast in the morning was very convenient. We would definitely stay there again. Jean W. Pittsburgh, PA

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel...except for the "free breakfast"”
Reviews.Author: forensicteeth
Reviews.Content: I stayed on the 15th floor and had a good room. Nothing over the top, but a fairly nice place. I will say that the "free breakfast" is very lacking. They have some danishes, bagels, and fruit which is fine but there was no protein. Also, the server will bring you a check with a zero balance but the tip part will be circled. This is weird to me. I am not going to tip someone to do their job. You get your food and drinks yourself so what exactly deserves a tip? Plus he was rude!!!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT STAY!”
Reviews.Author: LOVESVACATIONING
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night at this wonderful hotel! We had the corner room, which was the largest we have had in NYC. Windows all around giving us a panoramic view of the city. Large and clean bathroom. Friendly staff. Couldn't ask for a better hotel. We frequently stay in the city and will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: thomas v
Reviews.Content: Flying back from Cancun, I decided to go to New York to see a concert at Radio City Music Hall. I choose Flatotel because of it's location. Man! I was so pleasantly surprised! nothing fancy, but that room was huge!! 2 bathrooms, kitchen, dining room, huge living room, walk in closet, huge bedroom with tons and tons of windows, and a great master bathroom. I wish I had stayed for a week! Again, nothing fancy, but very clean and the staff was very pleasant. The hotel is located on 52nd street, 1 1/2 block from Radio City Music Hall. FOR THE PRICE, I WOULD STAY HERE AGAIN!!!

Reviews.Title: “no free WiFi”
Reviews.Author: Bj K
Reviews.Content: We booked the Flatotel for 3 nights (135$) incl. breakfast (only till 10am !). Although they say it is free WiFi, it is not! "Sorry, we changed that. Now it's 12$/day" was the answer after we showed them our booking confirmation which clearly said "free WiFi". Tell you what, Sheraton just next door has free WiFi with 110$/night (no breakfast)!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, big and silent rooms”
Reviews.Author: Faris010
Reviews.Content: The flatotel is just behind the NY Hilton hotel where I had a meeting. The location is perfect. The concierge is very helpful. My room was very big with a nice and clean bathroom. No complains real during my 3 nights stay. I think it is a very good hotel with a good standard perfect for short stays and business.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious room for NYC!”
Reviews.Author: FTopGirl
Reviews.Content: Large room by any standards. The king-sized bed was confortable, the bathroom was very large with a separate water closet for the toilet. The amenities in the room were excellent and the bathroom and slippers were a great touch! Check-in was pleasant and the staff was helpful at the front desk, the business center and at the front door. The dinner I had at the hotel restaurant could have been better. I had the tuna sandwich which had a bad after-taste for several days.

Reviews.Title: “just "okay"”
Reviews.Author: emmaline n
Reviews.Content: I arrived at 3:35 hoping to check in a bit early (4 pm posted check in)on a Sat. The clerk said no rooms were available yet. This was despite the sign in the window advertising a vacany rate for that very weekend! There was a baggage hold and so that worked out fine for us. Upon seeing the room, I had a disappointing experience. While the room seemed mostly clean, it was VERY run down. Paint was scuffed and chipping off in places, the carpet was dirty, bed platforms were chipped, furniture legs wre chipped and bent, the sheer curtains that were under the EXTREMELY dusty drapes (i mean major fuzz at the top) had holes in them. The lamps in the room were very loose and very dim (presumable so you wouldn't notice the paint!) A very old tube style TV, which normally I wouldn't care about in NYC - who has time for TV? But we did watch the golden globes one evening and the TV picture and sound was not too good. One of the most unsafe of the run down features was the large mirror that was just resting against the wall. - The cable to hang it to the wall at some point snapped I guess. Also, the window - on the 25th floor that opened a good 11-12 inches and had no screen! You could drop anything (or anyone!) out of it!! Beds were comfortable and bug free, and the water pressure was good although the half shower door allowed watehr to spill all over the bathroom tiles. I clerk for checkout at 11:00, on a holiday Monday (Jan 16th MLK day)the other woman present was on the phone and then left altogether. Good location and for 115 a night prepaid, I got what I paid for!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT LOCATION AND WONDERFUL STAFF Jan15-17”
Reviews.Author: Faith M
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews of some people, I was a little worried. But, after just returning home from a fun-filled weekend at Flatotel, I think some people just like to complain. My daughter and I were visiting the city alone for the first time. We wanted to stay in a conveneint location. WE GOT IT! We wanted a nice place that was clean and warm. WE GOT IT! We were skeptical about hoping to have friendly service. WE GOT THAT TOO! We were upgraded and thrilled! All the staff at the front desk were super friendly! Our train arrived early, but the staff offered to store our luggage while we went shopping. HOW NICE! Same thing on our last day: we had a few hours to spend in the city between check out and our train arrival. The super nice guys at the front desk stored our luggage. We had an excellent stay and definitely will stay at Flatotel again.

Reviews.Title: “I really liked this hotel”
Reviews.Author: lafcomike
Reviews.Content: I booked Flatotel at a really great price $125 on a cold night in January. After reading some of the reviews on this site, I was a bit wary of what I would find. However, this was a great stay. The hotel is perfectly located within a short walk to Times Square, Central Park and Carnegie Hall and accessible to major subway lines. Plenty of great restaurants are within walking distance as well and particularly partial to the Halal food carts on 6th Ave. As for the actual hotel, the gentleman at the front desk was very friendly and professional. The lobby is small with the bar located in the middle of it. But its dark lighting gave it a trendy vibe. As for the room, it was huge by NYC standards-not quite a suite but with a mini fridge, sofa and a very comfortable king size bed. The bathroom was also large and well stocked with toiletries and thick towels. I was quite happy with my stay.

Reviews.Title: “A serviceable property in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: John K
Reviews.Content: The Flatotel is not going to win anybody over with its charm but it does provide a clean, serviceable room with excellent speed on the wireless and windows you can open. This may seem like a small detail however I am from the west coast and have spent too many days in overheated New York hotel rooms and this was a pleasant change. I was on the 9th floor and the room was quite dark - cut off from the sky or the sun by the surrounding tall buildings - standard for NYC. The lobby is quite trendy although I tend to not hang out in hotel lobbies! Especially in New York. The location on 52nd on the west side is also a plus - right in midtown and easy access to the subway and the whole upper and lower west side. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “False advertisement on Priceline and dusty rooms! Jerry-rigging housekeepers”
Reviews.Author: Joshua S
Reviews.Content: There was literally balls of dust on top of the mirror in the bathroom. There were black things on the light decor in the bathroom. There were lime or calcium deposits on some accessories of the bathtub. Walls could be painted some soft color other than white. Booked my reservation on priceline and the hotel's details said that there would be free wi-fi, (which there was not)I found this out just after I checked in. Breakfast was to be included and this was not the case-I found this out after I gave my credit card on priceline and got my confirmation letter stating specifically that my room did not include breakfast...funny though because after I booked on priceline I found out that I could have booked the room via flatotel's website and gotten the complimentary breakfast for the same price!!! There's over 400 hotels in NYC. I'm not trying to say that this facility is a rip-off, but merely false advertisement and jerry-rigging housekeepers. I work for a hotel and I do random quality assurance inspections on rooms, none of my house keepers leave dust on top of mirrors or vents, especially not to the point where the dust becomes dust bunnies. Plus I don't like the false advertisement, I'm pretty sure this isn't priceline's fault since flatotel is probably the one whom submits the hotel information to them. Hotel flatotel is more for tourists, I've been to NYC many times but this time I was there for the gay scene and gay bar hopping, I should have staid closer to Chelsea. I coulda woulda shoulda taken a picture of the dust piled up on the top of the mirror, I practically laughed it was so ridiculous.

Reviews.Title: “Large Room, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: SageWalk
Reviews.Content: This review is late in coming... we stayed for two nights four years ago, but if it's still a favorable memory, I'd say the hotel has left an impression. I booked the hotel based on good reviews and location. My husband and I were in the city for our anniversary and we wanted a hotel that was safe, clean, and in a great location, and after reading previous reviews mentioning the large size of the hotel rooms, Flatotel seemed a reasonable choice. Since my husband and I spend most of our time outside the hotel hitting the pavement and sightseeing, room size wasn't a huge factor, nor were the glitzy trappings and prices of places like the Waldorf, etc. We booked it online directly through the hotel and I mentioned that it was our anniversary in the notes section. When we arrived to our room, there was a complimentary bottle of wine and chocolates. Very nice touch. The room looked exactly like the photos - I could swear ours was the one featured on their website. It was huge! It was quiet! We were in the back of the building, so no street noise. The only downside was that there wasn't much of a view other than watching office workers doing their job in the office buildings across the way. But, as I said before, we were not in our room that much to even be distracted by the view. Overall a very good experience. Great if you're not into the big, glitzy lobbies and pretension. It's just a nice, competitively-priced hotel tucked away on a side street that is very convenient to mid-town Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Buttersflower
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the flatotel from 27th dec - 3rd jan 2012 for birthday and new year. We booked through Virgin. On the plus side, the location is fab - close to everything you want to do especially Times Square for walking back after new years eve. We didn't hear noise (on 22nd floor) which was good. Room was clean and big enough for us. On the negative side, the room and lobby were quite dated as others have said. The were two lifts to service 40+ floors so you had to queue sometimes. The air con didn't work (middle of winter, granted, but room was really hot at night). The bar didn't open until 4pm! Even on new years eve!! The big problem I had with the hotel was the member of staff that insisted of helping us with bags into taxi on last day - we told him we had no change for a tip and we could get our own taxi, but he did it anyway then took $5 off the taxi man for a tip and told us to pay the taxi man back using our credit card!!!!!! I was fuming. I quickly explained to the taxi man that we literally only had $50 for the taxi ($45 for the fare to JFK and $5 for tip) as long as he knew... Got to JFK and taxi man kicked off because we couldn't give him a tip! The member of staff at the hotel had no right to do this and it really ruined a great holiday.

Reviews.Title: “New Year in New York”
Reviews.Author: tedinlund
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the Times Square area so everything is easily accessible. The hotel is clean and all the employees are friendly and ready to answer any questions, I don't understand some of the previous comments. Our room was spacious and clean. Free internet access was provided in the Business Centre downstairs, 24 hours a day. When we booked with Virgin we did not expect the complimentary continental breakfast (fruit, pastries, coffee, Orange Juice) or a free daily copy of the New York Times - this was an added bonus. Overall, we had a great experience and would definitely stay there again. We are already looking forward to planning our next visit to New York staying at the Flatotel.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's Eve”
Reviews.Author: Jesscrll
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in the heart of NYC. Everything is either within walking distance or subway accessible. The hotel is clean and all the employees are friendly and ready to answer any questions. The rooms are also very spacious and clean. My only complaint is that they do not provide free Wi-Fi. It was also a nice surprise to find out that they have complimentary continental breakfast (fruit, pastries, coffee, OJ). The only thing I did not like was that the waiters go around the tables asking for the number of people in the room and then bring you a check for tip. Overall, my experience was excellent! I would definitely stay there again :)

Reviews.Title: “Filty and Uncomfortable Hotel in Great Location:”
Reviews.Author: Pat J
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel during the New Year's weekend (12/31/11 thru 1/01/2012) . The hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating during our stay. It is in the center of everything; no need for a cab or a your vehicle....walking distance to all the attractions and shopping. I did find that the lobby area was very clean and neat in apperance BUT once you left the lobby, I was in for a shocking experience..The elevator was dirty and smelly; the carpet was filty, the room was dirty, the lamps was broken but in working order....The heat did not work in the bedrooms....The gym on the top floor was dirty as were the equipment. Clearly the photos was taken years ago and is no reflection of the current condition; With the looks of this there were certainly no need of me ordering any type of food in this place - I would shudder to see what the kithchen look like. They did agree to drop the room rate but lied and told me that the 2 bedroom rate is normally $800 per night....Bathroom was dirty and I was afraid to take a bath so I opted for a shower instead.After 2 night of staying there We checked out and checked into the Sheraton Hotel around the corner - where we had a better/cleaner room with lower prices and no complaints; fully stock of condiments, snack and drinks...

Reviews.Title: “Location good but hotel very tired”
Reviews.Author: Jan S
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with hotel quality and I really did,nt want to sound picky, however it really does need some interior work done. The furniture in the lobby is worn and breakfast room had bare plasterboard in places. Our room had good sized bed and fresh towels but bathroom was not cleaned despite me asking for it to be done...taps needed repairing and toilet seat was broken, bathroom door, floor and walls very dirty and windows looked like they were just about to fall out as plaster rotten from inside. Some staff were very pleasant whilst others grumpy and rude.This was a special birthday booking with Virgin and I am now very wary of booking with them again as the brochure pictures were clearly taken when the hotel was new and in no way reflects what it currently looks like. I advise to book elsewhere in NYC although location was very good. Given comments made by other guests I suggest management do a walkthrough and stop denying that there is anything wong with this hotel.?

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “Dirty and uncomfortable”
Reviews.Author: AutumnK
Reviews.Content: Standards in NY are different but really, you don't have to stay in a dirty and uncomfortable hotel, you can easily find a hotel at similar cost that is much nicer. No where close to a 4 star hotel, don't believe the reviews! When we checked in there was a long line to the elevator which landed us on the service elevator, which was disgusting, not sure why they would let guest us such a nasty elevator. Knowing this was the service elevator I thought it would get better... It got a bit better but I wasn't comfortable, I was pretty convinced we would bring home Bed Bugs, the door to the bathroom was partially rotten, and there was no coffee maker. The room was large but the setup of the room was just stupid- with the TV (old standard tube) taking up a very large amount of space, making it difficult to sit at the desk without bumping your head.

Reviews.Title: “Find something better”
Reviews.Author: ylz
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night. Building was originally apartments that were converted to hotel room. Bed was comfortable but room was all -that- clean and bathroom wasn't really dirty but looked like it needed a good scrubbing. Carpet was stained/worn. For the price (we paid 179 + tax for a king) there are much better choices for a night in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: N_V_adventurers
Reviews.Content: The location is great- walking distance from Times Square, Rockefeller Center, Central Park, 5th Avenue shops and most major landmarks. That is the USP of this place. The room was spacious and bathroom was clean. The staff was friendly, though the complimentary breakfast service was understaffed. Their parking service was useful and self parking option was cost effective (24 hours @ $30). Cons: You could hear people and sounds from the nearby rooms. The elevators are really slow.

Reviews.Title: “Flatotel is as good as it gets”
Reviews.Author: Emily H
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure why people have such negative things to say here - perhaps they have not traveled much in NYC. Staying in NYC is not like staying in any other city in the world. Standards are ENTIRELY different in a city that hosts over 48 million tourists a year on a 22 square mile landmass. If you've never stayed here before I understand the disappointment, but it truly is a great value for this city. I challenge you to go anywhere else and find better location, service and room size for this price. That being said I have stayed in VERY modest accommodations with barely enough room to do a sit-up at the foot of the bed (not that you'd even want to lay on the nasty floor) and paid a pretty penny for even that. I've also stayed at $250+ per night hotels in NYC and I honestly rate the Flatotel in-line with the standards and service I've received at these locations. The Flatotel is a WONDERFUL place to stay when visiting the City for pleasure. I haven't stayed there as a business traveler so can't speak about the wireless or business amenities, but the room size is unparalleled anywhere on the island for the price. Huge with nice, large windows. The staff was not overly knowledgeable about City options, but par for most NYC hotels. Gregory, the chef concierge however, makes up for it! He is a wealth of knowledge, service and hospitality. Ask him and it shall be done. Anything to make your stay more enjoyable - call ahead and he will help you plan your trip. The continental breakfast isn't anything special, but it's WHAT IT IS --- a CONTINENTAL breakfast. If you expect more than that in this city for this price you'll be disappointed most other places throughout your trip aswell. There's enough to get you going for the day and free fruit to stash in your pocket for a daily snack. It is one of the most convenient locations to anything you want to do - Times Square, 5th Ave, Central Park, Hell's Kitchen, Rockafellar Center --- you really don't even have to get on the Subway unless you want to go way down or uptown which saves you money. The shower is kinda weirdly designed, but it's a design thing, not a sub-par shower. Elevator can take a little while, but again, welcome to NYC high-rise buildings - EVERY hotel no matter what star-rating (except perhaps the Marquis) has this challenge. Overall, EXCEPTIONAL value and the key to our great trip! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Jodiedoll
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a one bedroom suite on the 38th floor. First impression was that it was a little tired but actually was a really spacious, warm, comfortable room. The room was clean and the hotel staff very helpful and friendly. The lifts did seem to be broken every day and took forever to come when called for but really a minor issue. Fantastic location, 5 minutes walk from Time Square, a couple of minutes walk from 5th Ave, The Rockefeller centre and Radio city the next street and Central Park was a 10 minute maximum walk. The complimentary breakfast was ok, however we only had it 1 of the 4 mornings we were there. I would say excellent value purely for the location but we did get it half price through a 'deal of the day'. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: newjerseyfriends
Reviews.Content: First let me say I booked through priceline, name your price. You don't choose hotel, you pick your price. I got a great deal. I was very pleased. Holiday season, blocks from Rockefeller Center, Time Square, Central Park. Can't beat the location. Room was large for NYC standards, bathroom was clean and updated. Room was a little warn, but clean, quite and comfortable. We were on the 12th floor so we had no issues with the elevator. We stay in the city several times a year. This was the most bang for my buck.Continental breakfast included always a big plus for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: trvlngrl14
Reviews.Content: We just got back from our trip to New York and we had a great experience at Flatotel. I have no idea why people are writing such bad things about the hotel. The front lobby was very nice and they had very comfortable couches. We took the red eye into NYC so we got to the hotel well before check in but they were able to get us into a room earlier witch was great and very accommodating for us. Checking in and out was very easy. We had no problems with the elevators like some people said on here. The room was very clean and modern. The beds were on the harder side but for some that is a plus. The hotel staff that we talked to were very friendly and helpful. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends that want to stay in the city. It's walking distance to most everything.

Reviews.Title: “SHOCKING DISAPPOINTMENT”
Reviews.Author: Simon S
Reviews.Content: This place advertises itself as offering Deluxe rooms with stylish decor, tea/coffee facitlities and aromatherapy products in ever Deluxe room and supports its claim with wonderful photos of a truly stylish venue. In reality, the paint was flaking off all over the walls in the lift lobby and the lifts only worked intermitently and more often than not we had to use the service elevator. The first room we were offered had mould around the taps, the curtains were hanging off and it smelt of stale smoke and mould. the second room was supposedly the same grade but was significantly smaller. The place also claims huge walk-in wardrobes. In the second room these were even more accessible because the doors were hanging off. We accepted the third room only because we had beent ravelling for 22 hours and were knackered. As for the views, they were wonderful. Unfortunately, they were wonderful views of the offic block next door. Tea nd Coffee makings are only available if you ring down and ask for them adn the continental breakfast was stale. The Duty Manager could not have cared less about our concerns. Finally, the Bell Boy was incapable of finding a Yellow Cab, even though the place is only 50 yards from 6th Avenue and Broadway but offered us the use of the hotel car service. despite his assurances to the contrary, the hotel car fee was $10 higher than the standard tarrif offered by the Yellow Cabs. Be aware. All that glistens on the internet is not always gold in reality. This was our honeymoon too!!

Reviews.Title: “Good for the money”
Reviews.Author: grandmariner01
Reviews.Content: Stayed here to meet friends in the city. Got a good deal on the room, it was clean. Nothing exciting, but a decent place to sleep

Reviews.Title: “Was fine for an overnight stay”
Reviews.Author: cupcake777
Reviews.Content: I was a little nervous considering the "not so great" reviews, but we were pleasantly surprised! The room was clean and in good condition with all working ammenites. Its not the "Ritz" but I would stay there again. Staff and Lobby were both pleasant but the carpeting could have been cleaner on the 9th floor. Great location to all the sights! We did have fun with the closeness of the occupants of the office building next to us, they are really, really close!! but then everything is on top of each other in Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Four Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: nmiller_11
Reviews.Content: Our reservation was booked through Travelscape and the Flatotel was described as a 4 star property. We reserved two rooms for two nights. The Flatotel is not a 4 star hotel and probably should be rated as an upper end 2 star or very low 3 star property. The Flatotel is a tired and not well maintained hotel. The rooms while large were dingy and poorly lit. The furnishings lacked any measurable quality and could have been second hand distressed very cheap furniture at best. The rooms, common hall ways, and public lobby and dining area lacked the polish, class, and appointments of a 4 star hotel. The location was excellent and the hotel staff tried to focus on service but did not achieve the service of a 4 star hotel. I would not trust Travelscape's hotel ratings and would not again stay at the Flatotel at 4 star prices. Nor should anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced, disappointing and bad customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Carmen A
Reviews.Content: First misleading website pictures - see pic attached! Second, the website claimed that guests would be treated like Broadway Stars but the reality was very far from this. After pre-paying for the room, 600 dollars per night, I had higher expectations than what I experienced. The front desk staff seemed to be put out by dealing with me and were rude. I arrived on the first day of my holiday at the front desk at Flatotel, around 4pm. Â I showed the printed email with the booking I had made through the phone via a hotel website. The booking name was made on my friends name who had prepaid with her credit card, so he didnt let me check in because the booking was on my friend's name. Â Even though the booking said 3 adults, it was pre-paid and we were staying in an apartment and I had the printed email as evidence. I was not advised by the hotel or venere that all guest names had to be on the booking in order to gain entry to the room. Â The receptionist seemed poorly trained, and I did not feel at all at ease. I would have cancelled my booking immediately, if it had not been pre-paid. I was finally allowed to go to the room when my friend arrived. The receptionist asked me to hand in my passport, so I did, and I thought that he had added my name to the booking as a guest BECAUSE OF WHAT HAD HAPPENED!. BUT, on the last day of my stay in this hotel, I went sightseeing in the morning and returned at noon to get my luggage from my room. There was no â€œactualâ€� check out for my friends, because they were staying on for 3 more nights in the same room (2 different bookings). When I tried to go in the room my key wouldnâ€™t function. I went to reception for help and was met by the same receptionist who had dealt with me on the first day - he knew exactly who I was. He refused to let me in the room FOR THE SECOND TIME!!! Then he turned his face away from me, and said he needed to call the manager as he was not going to deal with me. So the Manager came, I explained the misunderstanding of the first day and that I was being refused to entry to my room for the second time. She apologised and gave me a new key. I donâ€™t understand why the two other guests names were not added to this booking on the first day? What if there had been a fire? How would guests be accounted for? This procedure of check-in resulted in a very poor holiday experience for me. Third, during my stay there was a huge leak inside the closet in the bedroom!! that was so bad that we had to change rooms. I do not recommend this hotel at all.

Reviews.Title: “Grubby have stayed in better travel lodges!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MissB79
Reviews.Content: We were reccomended this by Virgin Holidays i should of learnt my lesson the last time i got reccomended a horel by them. The only good thing i can say about this is the location, the location is amazing you are 5 minutes from 5th avenue, 10 minutes from time square and 10 minutes from central park. The room was large but dirty, there was blood on the door frame which i thought o.k maybe they will clean this when cleaning room it never got cleaned off. i had to run a bath using the shower hose as the bath tapo would not come on and when i eventually filled the bath where it has holes in for i am assuming it is meant to work as a jacuzzi type bath dirt had come out so on top of my bath was floating pieces of dirt not nice after this i really did not wnat to use the bath/shower. The door looked like it had been kicked in and punched. The staff i found unfriendly and it was not inviting to eat in for dinner as no one was ever in the restaurant. There was no tea and coffee facilities in the room, a letter for someone else telling them they would also have robes in room none of these wither and the letter was over a week old so im not sure if the room was ever cleaned before us!!! They do serve a complimentary breakfast of minature pastries and bagles with tea and coffee which was unexpected and nice although you did have to ask for them replenish the breakfast table if they had run out. New york in itself was great again i felt safe at night as it is so busy. Went to empire state building, central park which was stunning as it was fall and the colours of the trees were amazing, went to central park zoo also on the horse and cart around central park for $50. Ground zero memorial you havge to pay an entrance fee now which i feel is quite sick to have to pay to pay your respects there is a wall outside this with all the firefighters names on that you do not have to pay for, we then got the statten island ferry which is free so we could see the statue of liberty as they are currently renovating so you cannot go inside so got the ferry to go past you do have to depart the ferry then wait for the next one to go back buts is free so gives you an opportunity to fuel up with a mug of hot chocolate then when you come back if you walk round to the right and up you can see the brooklyn bridge.Times square was great and popped into hard rcok cafe here to eat which was very reasonable. 5th avenue full of shops many designer so fairly ka ching on your purse. Other then the hotel we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “noisy and filthy. avoid!”
Reviews.Author: Memberrs
Reviews.Content: one of the worst hotels I've ever been in. so loud and noisy and filthy. you can hear your neighbors shutting doors and talking AND also doing all their bathroom business through the air vent in the bathroom. housekeeping is atrocious. I asked to move rooms after finding fecal matter and cigarette butts all over my original room. my new room has a tub backflows dirty disgusting water from other people's bathrooms every morning. this backflow leaves a black filmy residue with hair in it all over the tub. the noise outside the hotel room is constant and lasts all night long with industrial noise. the free breakfast is a joke. stale pastries and staff that practically accost you for a tip. the front desk staff are rude and act like they are inconvienced with any question. the hotel rooms are large and the location is central to many attractions but it is NOT worth the outrageous price they charge for this 2 star dump.

Reviews.Title: “Location, good sized room, but not much else.”
Reviews.Author: Bill S
Reviews.Content: I still can't get over the fact that the majority of Trip Advisor reviewers rate this hotel above average and many have rated it excellent. Did they stay at the same hotel or is there some kind of parallel universe with some other Flatotel that people really like? The Flatotel we experienced was much in keeping with a number of the preceeding reviews: dimly lit, poorly maintained and much in need of renovation. Although the room was a decent size, it was sparsely furnished and the configuration made it uncomfortable to sit anywhere but on the bed. The room was too dim, even with all of the lights on. Our bathroom shower leaked onto the floor and the tile floors were dull, dirty-looking and paint stained. Missing wall tiles had been replaced with sloppily applied mosaic tiles (or was this an artistic touch?). The best thing to say about the free continental breakfast was that it was free. You do have the option of ordering breakfast off the menu but at ridiculous hotel prices. We too, experienced the breakfast wait staff hustling tips even when providing no direct service - not even bringing coffee to the table. Granted, they do service what little there is of the free breakfast bar, but as another reviewer mentioned, we assume they get paid for that. Management should stop this practice. This reviewer will not choose to return to the hotel. Although the location and price are real plusses, there are many hotels in Manhattan with great locations and I'd rather pay a bit more and have a better overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulw58261
Reviews.Content: Flatotel is in a superb location. 10 blocks from Times Square, 2 blocks from the nearest subway station and close to the park too. They serve a complimentary continental breakfast every morning which is nice.The staff are friendly and always happy to help. The general finish of the rooms is questionable though - could do with a lick of paint, new light fittings and new carpets. The bar prices are also very high. I know hotels tend to charge more for drinks but $5 for a cup of tea is a joke. The barmaid was not at all friendly either so don't bother leaving her a tip. Overall I would recommend this hotel, and because of the location and price I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “rundown”
Reviews.Author: PipoJ
Reviews.Content: Room is large and has modern furniture. The bed is comfortable. However, the room is quite dark - bulbs in the lamps are just too dim. There is no soap dish in the bathroom. The tub is an old jacuzzi that no longer has working jets and so it just weirdly large and difficult to climb in and out of. Tile in bath needs to be refreshed and water temperature in the shower is difficult to adjust. The room heater is unreliable (worked one day but not the next). There is no hotel guide in the room to list guest services such as gym, room service etc. Elevators are very slow. Although they advertise free continental breakfast, they charged $4.75 for a small coffee to go. No premium channels on the tv and no system for ordering additional programming. We will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Please read, before you book this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Sporto1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is filthy! From the carpets, to the kitchen, to the bathroom, whoever owns this property has totally neglected it. I stayed in one of their top suites and it was massive but it was so unkept we were shocked. I am without a doubt notifying the Board of Health to inspect this place! It is that bad. Our original room was so bad we were on our way to check out when they upgraded us. I honestly want to know who is recommending this place because they should not be allowed to write reviews any more. I travel at least twice a week and sample hotels all across this country, from the best to some very average places. The Flatotel is the most unkept hotel I have ever stayed at. Add on the fact that it features worn, dirty outdated furniture and fixtures and you have the makings of a disaster. The only bright spot is the staff who were helpful, kind, and attentive, but that can not overcome the disaster and the absolute filth of this hotel. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED!

Reviews.Title: “The best is the location”
Reviews.Author: ShazQc
Reviews.Content: I was there for only one night, I paid 263 USD for a not so good room, the TV was a huge 29" one, I felt like in the 90s ! the bed was OK, there was no wifi in the rooms so I was lucky I took a 'network' cable with me so I could get internet in my room. When I called to the reception to ask about the way internet worked there, they were a little bit rude 'You need a cable! or go to the lobby' .... In general everything it's dated: the elevators, the reception, the TV, the furniture, etc.... The bathroom is OK and the location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Flat Out Awful...Elevator Panel Fell on My Head...”
Reviews.Author: bnj2377
Reviews.Content: I wanted to like this hotel, really I did. My husband has stayed here a few times on business trips and often complains about it. However heâ€™s, in my opinion, sometimes overly picky about hotels so I was fully prepared to think differently than he. Boy was I wrongâ€¦ Letâ€™s start with the night we arrived. We pulled up in our rental car and waited for the valet to come pick it up. And waitedâ€¦.and waitedâ€¦. We finally had to go inside to the hotel (where, by the way, the valet stand had a clear view of the outside of the hotel) and ask the valet to park our car. Okay, one hurdle down. Next we checked in uneventfully and were given our room keys. The dÃ©cor in the lobby was attractive, even if it did look like it was trying a little too hard to be trendy. We went to the elevator bank and waited for the somewhat slow elevators to our room. As we were walking down the hall to our room I noticed that the door to the room across from us looked broken into. Iâ€™m not exaggerating, I even took a picture of it. It looked like someone had taken a crowbar and attempted to wedge the door open. That didnâ€™t exactly make me feel comfortable and safe. As an aside, during our stay we had to go to the front desk twice to get new keys because the keys they gave us just stopped working for no apparent reason. When we walked into our room we were greeted by a room that, on first glance, was just OK, if somewhat dated. There was no flat screen TV (it was one of those old boxy ones) and the lampshade had what looked like water damage on it. The cover to the air conditioning unit was broken and fell off as soon as my husband opened it to adjust the room temperature. The bed was on this wooden platform which had the wood sticking out about 5-6 inches from the side of the bed on the side I was on (it only stuck out about 3 inches on the other side). The wood actually looked pretty but I must have nailed my knee on that damn thing about 6 times during our 3 night stay. The bed itself was pretty uncomfortable. I actually prefer firmer beds, like this one, but I woke up with back pain for the first time in a long time after sleeping in that bed. There was no shower curtain in the bathroom (just a half glass partition) which would have been okay except the water sprayed directly on the bathroom door when showering which over time had apparently created unattractive warping around the edges. On the plus side, the shower head had fantastic water pressure. The next morning we got up early enough to enjoy their continental breakfast in the dining room off the lobby. The offerings were some cold pastries, bagels, coffee, tea and a mixed fruit cocktail like thing. The pastries were dry and boring and, primarily tasteless. The coffee was pretty darn bad as well. I didnâ€™t finish my breakfast and upon leaving the breakfast area noticed that their dining room had a â€˜Bâ€™ posted on the door. For those of you that donâ€™t know, the health department in New York provides letter based ratings (A, B, C, etc) to restaurants based on their sanitation and health practices. Apparently, this restaurant was not good enough to get an â€˜Aâ€™. The McDonaldâ€™s a few blocks away has an â€˜Aâ€™ for peteâ€™s sake!! How hard could it be?? Had I seen it before we went in, I wouldnâ€™t have gone in. Interestingly enough, the last day of our stay, I went to take a picture of the sign and noticed that the health department sign had been removed. On the second evening of our stay, I was smacked on the head by a falling item. Yes, really. My husband and I were waiting for the slow elevators with another guest when a staff member came out and got in the service elevator. Seeing us waiting, he asked if we were going up and motioned us to join him. We all got in with him. In retrospect, perhaps we should have waited for the non-service elevator but given that the staff member was encouraging us to get in, it seemed okay. I was in the elevator for about 2 minutes when I looked up to see one of the plastic ceiling panels falling toward me. My husband tried to deflect it unsuccessfully and it landed smack dab on my head. Now luckily, it was made of thin plastic and I wasnâ€™t injured but what the heck???? Okay, my last gripe about this hotel is the internet access situation. They only have wired internet access available in the guestrooms and itâ€™s very slow. Wireless is available in the lobby but itâ€™s a bit of a pain to go down there for faster service. This hotel has a fantastic location near Times Squareâ€¦.and thatâ€™s about it. I would highly encourage potential guests to look elsewhere for a hotel in the Manhattan area.

Reviews.Title: “You can have better choice”
Reviews.Author: Jason L
Reviews.Content: Great location. So close to MoMa, Time Square, and 5th Ave. Cleanliness and comfort of room is good. Hotel front lobby is very dark. I don't feel friendly and helpful door men during 4 days stay. Front desk receptionists never say hello when in and out in such a small 4 stars hotel lobby. In a big city like New York, I did not expect that also. Can't tell how hotel got rated as 4 stars from the service. Something is not right with management team of this hotel. Very bad impression from Hotel complimentary breakfast. There are about 5~6 items cold food on a tiny table. On 1st day of stay, I rushed to grab a piece of pound cake and a cup of orange juice to go without sitting. Then waiter come up to ask for tipping... I did not go back for the free breakfast during rest of stay. The positive point is that Flatotel might be the only one of hotels providing complimentary breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but hotel needs work”
Reviews.Author: mkmcatsfan
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a two night stay at this hotel. First the positives: as everyone else has mentioned, the location can't be beat. It's right at the upper edge of Times Square and within a block from the subway. We arrived very early and were able to check into our room at 11am! This was fantastic! The concierge is great-he's very knowledgeable and kind. Our room was also large for NYC standards. We had a corner, non smoking room. It had everything we needed with great toiletries, too. And the garden tub was a plus! The location was also very quiet for being so close to Times Square. The hotel is on a quiet street. Also we had a refrigerator in our room, which was great! Now, for the things that need work: the furnace! We never really got the heat right. It was either full blast heat or cold air. The maintenance came and reset it twice, but that didn't really fix the problem. The bed was hard as a rock. For that reason alone I would not return. I just didn't sleep well b/c it was so uncomfortable. If you are young and don't care, then no problem. In my 20s I wouldn't have cared. Now, in my mid-30s-I care! Finally, as so many others have said, the breakfast staff needs to go. They are rude and they hover around waiting for a tip for nothing. They did nothing for me-did not take a drink order or anything. It's a "help yourself breakfast". They are just doing their jobs putting the food out. That doesn't deserve a tip. Maybe that's just the food industry in NYC b/c most everywhere we ate the staff was rude and abrupt. But this hotel needs to cut out the guilt-trip tip scam. Just don't feel that you have to tip for nothing. I didn't. Overall I enjoyed my trip and my stay, but again, b/c of the hard mattress and uncomfortable sleep, I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “All about the location”
Reviews.Author: wineismylife
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a quick weekend trip to NYC. You can't beat the location. Not even half a block to Broadway, breezeways to MOMA, restaurants like Le Bernardin and Bar Americain, etc... Staff is friendly and helpful, especially the door men and housekeeping. No complaints there. My biggest complaint is the room itself. Apparently I had one of the rooms that had only been partially updated if that. Needs further updating. Hole in the wall in the kitchenette. Many scuffs in the paint, especially around the closet. Outdated VCR and TV. Toilet looked like something circa 1980s out the TV Show Dynasty. I will give them one thing though: it was very spacious by NYC standards. Continental breakfast was pathetic even if it was free. Rate versus location versus overall cleanliness is the winner here.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we needed!”
Reviews.Author: Louise251
Reviews.Content: Just arrived back from a 5 night stay at Flatotel. Room was fine, lighting could have been a bit better but it wouldn't stop me from staying here again! Excellent huge comfy bed. Had a slight problem with the shower which was fixed in minutes as soon as I rang reception. Had no problems with the staff all very courteous and polite. Didn't eat at the hotel as we wanted to explore and try different places. Fantastic location right near Broadway, Times Square and subway stops. Happy travelling!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: rianae
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Flatotel, spacious room and very clean. Continental breakfast every morning was included. The concierge/reception staff were excellent. The location for sight seeing and shopping was great, Times Square just a short walk... would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is tired and badly needs a refresh”
Reviews.Author: amalis
Reviews.Content: When I got to my room, the door wouldn't open due to a mechanical problem with the latch. It took about 1/2 hour with repeated calls to the front desk to get security and a mechanic to the room to get me in. It finally got fixed, but took much too long. Overall, the hotel is in bad need of a facelift. I'm sure that it was great when it first opened, but they need to keep it up better. Small things like the elevator lights are burned out, one of the lights over my bed was broken, room was pretty dark, TV was an old old 4x3 box, and so on.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected pros and cons”
Reviews.Author: Mangustena
Reviews.Content: I spent only one night at the hotel and basically only just slept in the hotel, so my experience is limited, but for what it is worth here goes. When I came into the room I was pleasantly surprised by the size of the room. By NY standards it is very spacious (for a midrange hotel at least). The bed was comfortable. There were a lot of channels, including HBO, on TV. The "bad" surprise came from the bathroom. The water in the shower was lukewarm and slightly more than a trickle. The faucet in the sink outright wiggled when you tried to turn the hot/cold knobs. For one night I didn't mind. For a couple of nights or if it was cold and I needed a warm shower - I imagine I would be annoyed.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, clean and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mumofone1
Reviews.Content: Second time visiting Flatotel. This time there was 7 in our party and we had 2 double double rooms. Rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable very very happy. Hotel is ideally situated between 5th and Times Square, great for sight seeing and shopping. Gregory the concierge is excellent, very knowledgable and if he doesn't know he will find out a real asset. Two negatives - "Free" continental breakfast - bit of a waste of time the fresh fruit was good but the pastries and dry (toasted) bagels were pretty poor. Unlimited tea and coffee is a bonus however not available in the afternoons and this coupled with a closed bar leaves you a little dry! The big arrow pointing to the tip section on breakfast slip when it was all self service was a bit unnecessary too. Reception team are a bit hit and miss, we were told that Macy's opened at 7am on the Monday morning it actually opened at 10am so quite a bit of time to kill and I was paying both bills on my card at checkout I handed over my card but they had already charged the cards we presented on check in, bit of a pain, they appear to do what they want rather than what you ask for. Despite the negatives I would most definitely stay again you would struggle to get a better location for the price. Beds are extremely comfortable with good quality linen. Bathrooms are a great standard. Eat at the diner attached to the Wellington Hotel it is great value for money but I would avoid Planet Hollywood food was not very hot, but was very expensive.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel good value for money”
Reviews.Author: csboyle
Reviews.Content: modern rooms free WiFi and a nice surprise as there was complementary Continental breakfast the bathroom was stylish and clean well we were on the 10th floor and waiting for the lifts was long

Reviews.Title: “Great location great hotel”
Reviews.Author: GBCarl
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at flatotel in our 4 night stay this September, front of house staff very helpful, room exactly as expected, huge powerful shower and super large comfortable beds. Only gripe was as mentioned on a previous review about breakfast staff, we were presented with a cheque folder to put our 'gratuities' in before we even sat down to our first breakfast and bluntly told 'gratuities not included'. Needless to say the folder stayed empty and we ate breakfast out for the whole stay. Would return in the future, thanks guys.

Reviews.Title: “great location - no amenities (no hot water either)”
Reviews.Author: mariasot
Reviews.Content: great location, no coffee, no full length mirror oh and no hot water on our last day i chose not to shower instead and its not like they had run out of hot water because it was 6:30 am. the shower head stunk anyway it was more like a metal hose spout. the bar area looks like a cool place to hang out but i didn't get to and there was no room service menu in the room either. but if you get a good deal the location is great. oh and the bed is rock hard. was happy to leave after 2 days.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: DPope2011
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated very well, 5th ave, central park, and times square all within a few minutes walk. Room was very large, only thing lacking was a coffee maker! Clean, tidy and good views of the city. Elevators very slow considering the number of floors it was covering. Would happily stay here again in the future

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice staffs but no Wifi in the rooms”
Reviews.Author: Jon W
Reviews.Content: The hotel is just several blocks away from the time square. The stuffs are very friendly. The room is quite large. The breakfast is a bit poor but ok. The only problem for me is the internet connection.There is no WiFi in the rooms so I can not get internet through my Ipad. I could use my AT&T phone to get internet. There are office buildings around that the AT&T data traffic is horrible when all the office workers use their smartphones. I can not even send messages out during the day in my room. At night the phone internet is working fine. There is a startbucks across the street where I get my morning coffee and uses the Wifi internet. The hotel lobby has Wifi but the speed is very slow.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms”
Reviews.Author: JGranborg
Reviews.Content: Great rooms for a family -placed central to Times Square but they all have to learn some service

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: fifi344
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 9 nights in mid August. Fantastic room on 31st floor, heaps of space and a huge bathroom, easy access to the Business Centre and always a free computer. I never had a problem with the lifts, but I don't think I ever used them at check out time. I had a problem with my TV, rang the concierge, Gregory and it was promptly fixed. I got this hotel for a fantastic rate on hotels.com. The location is perfect, two minutes to the subway, five minutes to Times Square, ten minutes to Central Park, a few minutes to 5th Avenue, and a fantastic Deli on 51st. I had another hotel booked for a further 10 nights stay as I was unsure what this one would be like.... I wish I had booked this hotel for the 19 nights. I could not have been happier. My room and the location....perfect. I would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, OK hotel, get your breakfast elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: BarryJ_Aust
Reviews.Content: The best aspect of this hotel is its terrific location, just a few blocks from Times Square, the subway, and short walks to may other attractions such as Central Park, 5th Ave, Grand Central Station etc. The rooms are OK, nothing to rave about - certainly not for the price charged. The staff are helpful, (some are more helpful than others). The lifts are slow, especially in the mornings so allow extra time to travel between floors. The included continental breakfast was barely adequate with the bagels cold and dry, i.e. tasked and felt like trying to eat cardboard - there are plenty of good restaurants close by so I suggest getting your breakfast outside of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Longine
Reviews.Content: Hotel is old and worn (lights hanging off the wall old!) but clean. What is really bad is the service.
