The staff don't engage you at all even when struggling with luggage, they just watch you fall. I have not been to a hotel before where ALL of the staff are bad, but I have now. The only reason to stay there is the location, which is brilliant. Anyone who rates this hotel more than a 2 star has never stayed in a decent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ugh, Flatotel”
Reviews.Author: NorthernVirginiaMomo
Reviews.Content: Loved the location, and the staff was helpful, but that's about it. Stayed on the 23rd floor. Room was drab, didn't feel clean, bath was barely passable. Beds are HARD. The elevators are SLOW--we had to wait for a second one to come because the first one was full. By the time we got down to the 7th floor, those people had to wait, because we were full. Now 10 days later, I have funny little bites on my body. I am hoping they are not from BED BUGS. The bites appear 7 to 10 days out from the bite. I am pretty worried and will call an externinator.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: BeachDreamer
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Alex (So Great) which I thought was somehow related to Flatotel (which isn't so great), so the whole experience was a disappointment. However, the manager, Steve, is the best thing about the hotel as he really tried to accommodate, but you can only do so much with what you have. First, we were given a "no smoking" room on a smoking floor. That just doesn't work. My husband usually doesn't notice the smell or if a room is dirty, and he was really unhappy. The room was dirty and needed refurbishing, smelled like an ashtray, and had an uncomfortable bed. It took room service so long to bring us a menu to the room that we decided to go out. The next day we tried the restaurant - don't bother. All in all - not a good experience even after Steve moved us to another room.

Reviews.Title: “A girls trip with perks”
Reviews.Author: 615aim
Reviews.Content: This hotel is undergoing some growing pains but the Manager Steve is very accommodating and helpful. I believe everyday that issues in older post are being solved. As I am aware they have been hiring more staff and they are undergoing training. I was able to see the smaller double bed room which had the jetted shower. That room was lovely and even though the bathroom was small it was finished nicely. Our group of four girls ended up staying in the two queen bed room with the jetted tub/shower. This room had wonderful views and more space the beds were comfortable. As I read in other post about the noise of the subway I found that to be charming in a NYC here I am way. I can not wait to visit again when everything is finished. Thank you Steven you are wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Average Hotel but good location”
Reviews.Author: OgdenC
Reviews.Content: The hotel is Ok. The lobby is dimly lit and not very welcoming. The lifts are old and take some time to arrive. The room was again dimly lit but comfortable and clean. The location is the best aspect of the hotel. Its not worth the 200+ pounds a night, but again its harder to get a cheaper hotel in Manhatten, in that location. The free breakfast is nothing to rave about - pieces of melon and some cakes and bad coffee. Its old and tired and needs some money spent but I guess that won't happen whilst they continue to charge high prices for a very average room. Just dont expect very much from this hotel but its in a good location so thats the only plus point.

Reviews.Title: “very average not cheap,good location,dont expect the staff to lift a pen without a tip!!”
Reviews.Author: NewYork11Uk
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a good location, very near to Times Square. Room was ok good size but tired, the shower screen flooded the bathroom floor. and on the second night of our stay the toilet was leaking and flooded the floor also. (However in fairness this was fixed straight away) The staff in the restaurant were quite rude and daily expected a tip as the ("breakfast is complimentary and gratitude is not included!") How can this be complimentary when the hotel is in excess of $200 a night.. I think you will find that I am is paying for this??! I appreciate a tip is necessary, however it is solely self service coffee etc nothing is brought to the table.. so very rude when a waiter opens it sees there is no tip and places it back on your table in dismay! to encourage you! very unprofessional!! Also when checking out you have to tip the bell boy for putting your cases away and again for taking them out!! Be ready for a very disappointed look if it is not a minimum of $1 a bag even for a handbag.. Upon asking is there any chance you could put this in the trash (old luggage labels, baring in mind this is after tipping them twice he simply points across the room!!) Excellent service thanks.. and its ok I will haul the 5 bags to the trunk of the car!! However the front desk staff are very helpful so good feedback to them thanks

Reviews.Title: “Just horrible!”
Reviews.Author: 82Jenna1
Reviews.Content: How disappointing to see that this hotel was rated 4 stars. How could that possibly happen! My room was on the 26th floor. The bathroom had a filthy light fixture coated with dust. The fiberglass bathtub didn't even have a stopper if you wanted a bath. It has air-conditioning like you see in a motel not central air so it was grinding off and on all night. After a long day at work I arrived back that evening to a room that hadn't been cleaned. The next morning I had an early flight and went down at 6:30 to get coffee. They didn't have any coffee available until 7:00 or wait for room service to open at 7:30....no coffee...omg!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing experience”
Reviews.Author: Bob348
Reviews.Content: This hotel does not live up to 4 star rating. The room was a suite and was the size as advertised, however the hotel was extremly tired from foyer to suite. The suite had a full kitchen but had: No toaster, and over and hot plates which did not work correctly, a lck of utensils for cooking. Had plate setting for 3 and during our stay our wine glasses were removed from the cupboard. Pots and pans as provided, needed cleaning prior to use. The bath had a spa which did not work. The airconditioning needed regassing as it blew cool air at best. The staff worked hard to provide the best they could working with sub standard facilities

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: jim s
Reviews.Content: Nice, but the elevator was painfully slow - and crowded. No concierge on duty on a Sunday.

Reviews.Title: “No Issues....... The Good & The Bad”
Reviews.Author: JB1962
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for only three nights during the first part of our US trip. The Good...... Location - Great position - Walking distance to Central Park and close to two Subway lines Check-in - Quick & efficient Lobby - Comfortable with a nice bar Free Internet connection in the Business area downstairs Bed - Very comfortable Room overall - Nice but looking a little tired The Bad...... The obnoxious Waiter in the breakfast room who seemed to have an issue with guests taking a coffee and some fruit up to the room - even though reception says this is OK Safe in room - Not working and maintenance couldn't fix Lifts can take a long time during peak hours Overall enjoyed the stay and found no real issues, staff with the exception of the one breakfast Waiter were all really friendly and helpful. Would choose "The London" over the Flatotel every-time, but then the cost is significantly more!...... so a good compromise if on a tighter budget

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel! Great location!”
Reviews.Author: migo23
Reviews.Content: I was with my family in aprilÂ´09. Great rooms in 23rd and 25th floor, with great views to skycrapers. Breakfast a little limited when you stay for some days. People are so nice in the hotel. It is in the heart of the Midtown just between Times Sq and Central Park, a very good zone. Subway nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Sorry I stayed here”
Reviews.Author: redoaktree
Reviews.Content: This hotel is dark and dank and reminds me of a seedy motel in a B rated movie. Maybe they think that being dark and dank are for "atmosphere or ambience" but it's probably actually to hide all the ancient paint and deterioration and general disrepair of the place. We booked, pre paid for a room with 2 double beds, we got there early so they said our room would be ready at 4pm. We went back at 4 and they said ok, rooms ready. We we went up to 9th floor and the room was totally disgusting. It smelled like a hundred people had been in there chain smoking and doing who knows what else. we went back downstairs and told them I booked a no smoking room, they said that's the only double bed room available, that they could give us a king size bed and a roll away until the next day and then we could move again. We stayed in the king size bed room and it didn't smell as bad but the bed frame was made for a california king or something, there was a wood platform sticking out on both sides of the bed, I hit my leg on it I don't know how many times, I still have a bruise from 2 1/2 weeks ago. The bathroom looks like it is from a eastern european prison (from movies I've seen) the tile and workmanship put into to laying the tile was subpar and they must have gotten a closeout special on the ugliest tile in the world, the tile isn't sealed so whenever a drop of water falls on any surface it looks like a gray stain until it dries and then it's still awful. I was afraid to walk on the carpeting without shoes on, the elevator is slow and rickety, the free breakfast is a joke. they have little unidentifiable bakery goods that taste as good as they look. Hotel guests look like they crawl out of bed and go down there to eat, probably how they do it in hostels in eastern eruope. The wait staff at the free breakfast hover around you waiting for a tip while you try and choke down the grub. i couldn't eat whatever that was so went to Starbucks across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Great from a to z”
Reviews.Author: yacineawt
Reviews.Content: Very well located and the rooms were very nice. The only problem os that for New Year's you can't get close to Times Square because all the roads are barricaded. Apart from that all great.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, nice room with great views!”
Reviews.Author: Cwell76
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights to see our favorite band Zac Brown Band at the Today Show and it was only about 2 blocks away from Rockefeller Plaza. Access to the subway is only a block from the front door of the hotel which ever way you go. We took the train into Penn Station from NJ to save money on parking in the city($60day) then the subway E train to 53rdSt which is right around the corner. There are many restaurants to choose from in the area and some great street vendors right on 6th ave that are great too. The room was HUGE for NYC- the largest room we've ever had. We were in a corner room that stuck out further than the rest of the building on the 23rd floor so we had awesome views. The decor in the room is modern, a little bland with a desk, fridge, microwave and a sitting area at the big windows. The bathroom had a tub with a large window that overlooked the city which was really cool. The only thing I would have changed about the room was the TV - it was an old tube type which isn't a big deal. The continental breakfast was average- muffins, doughnuts, bagels, fruit and coffee. We would definitely stay here again- just as long as we get the huge corner room with a view.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious and Quiet”
Reviews.Author: consuela2
Reviews.Content: The Flatotel was very clean with nice comfy beds. The rooms were spacious but simple.It was centrally located without being on a super busy street- short walk to Times Square- Lincoln Center and Central Park.

Reviews.Title: “AVOID ROOM 618 IF YOU WANT TO SLEEP IN A QUIET ROOM!”
Reviews.Author: Blackroo
Reviews.Content: Central hotel, close to broadway. Complimentary breakfast which was a nice surprise as not expected. Clean hotel, however our air con sounded like there was a plane in the room (very old system, needed replacing). we did mention it 3 times, an engineer came 3 times but no change. Should have been moved really-just what you want for your honeymoon!!!!

Reviews.Title: “HUGE room. Rockefeller Center location.”
Reviews.Author: SRLloyd
Reviews.Content: 4th business stay at the Flatotel. Complimentary wi-fi in rooms. King-sized bed, small sofa, work desk, fridge... sizeable bathroom. Plenty of floor space for morning workouts as I find the gym to be ill-equipped and inadequate (particularly the free weights and weight machines). No disinfectant spray/wipes for the machines either. Enough about the gym! For the month of August FREE continental breakfast: pastries, bagels, muffins, and fruit. It was fine. I was in a non-smoking room, although there must have been smoking rooms on my floor. Ended up shutting the vent in my bathroom and that solved the lingering smoking fumes. I had no problem with the elevators, as a matter of fact I often found the elevator opened and waiting for me. Location is great! Couple of blocks from Rockefeller Center and Time Square, but located on a quiet street. Had dinner at Bobby Flay's Bar Americain.. it was good, not great, but very good. My 2nd visit to Victor's Cafe on 52nd. Fantastic Cuban Cusine. A little pricey, but worth it! GREAT waitstaff! Great, authentic Cuban food. Will stay again at Flatotel... and will eat again at Victor's!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Dani34607
Reviews.Content: This hotel will always be high on my list of favorites. Our room was beautifully soothing, very comfortable and had everything we needed - including windows that really open. The staff could not have been nicer and more helpful, from the front desk to the housekeepers. They not only took care of our needs but went beyond what we had asked for and did it graciously.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful Staff & a Cyclist Accommodating Hotel”
Reviews.Author: belltownonthemove
Reviews.Content: We came in from Vancouver on one of those famous Red Eye Flights the hotel offered us an early check in which was wonderful we able to sleep in to early afternoon was able to Show rested our first night the big city. The Best Part Flatotel was Location Location Location close to Theaters Museums good restaurants. I felt safe in the hotel and later in the week when I rented a bicycle for a evening ride they let me keep the bike in my room with problems (I did ask in advance). The Hotel also has good subway access out room was rather modest but it was fairly quiet for mid Manhattan. A quick tip there are cafes down the block walking east the workers eat breakfast and lunch is good way to fairly priced meals and get the feel of what it like to work in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Need Customer Service Training”
Reviews.Author: coolpower19
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff need customer service training. Specifically the front desk staff as they were unaccommodating and quite rude during our stay. Other than that, the hotel is nice, the rooms and washrooms are huge and the location is wonderful. Just be prepared for a wait for the elevators from time to time as the hotel is quite tall.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location, Amazing Hotel!! Will definitely be going back!”
Reviews.Author: ggw_11
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 9 day stay in NY and I have to say that the Flatotel has got to be the best hotel that I've ever stayed in. First of all the location is perfect. Most attractions are in walking distance and with Times Square so close it was amazing. Secondly the hotel was perfect. It was clean and the service was great. The staff were so helpful and were extremely friendly. Our room was great, there was no problems at all except for the air conditioning in one bedroom which wasn't working properly, but as soon as we called the concierge, an engineer was sent up within minutes and the problem was fixed very quickly. The Complimentary Breakfast was really good, a good selection of food to eat from juices, tea and coffee, lots of pastries and bread and fruit salad. All in all our stay in New York couldn't have been better. Extremely happy with our stay at the Flatotel and we will definitely be choosing the Flatotel when we return to New York!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Great Value”
Reviews.Author: devouttraveler
Reviews.Content: Secured a flight + hotel through Travelocity after reading positive Tripadvisor reviews. We were very pleased with location, very close to many attractions as well as subway. Our room was spacious for NYC, very clean and amazingly quiet. Concierge was terrific! Continental breakfast was just fine (ignore comments from the whiners). Would definitely recommend and return.

Reviews.Title: “We definately will be back.”
Reviews.Author: LianeFurtado
Reviews.Content: The only thing we didn't like was the shower. There wasn't enough water. To wash a long hair like mine, took a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Very large hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: MichelleFromOz
Reviews.Content: We were amazed at the room size in this hotel.. it was massive and the bathroom was even stupidly large - you could fit a whole other room in the bathroom! Obviously as it is in New York, we hardly spent any time in the room... so the space may have been wasted on us - but we did have plenty of room to sort out our shopping!! We didn't really test out any of the facilities (we were in New York!! We went out!) other than there is an ATM downstairs - handy! Location is literally one block from Broadway and we found it very easy to get around the city from here. It seemed pretty good value for the size and location.

Reviews.Title: “Great For The Price”
Reviews.Author: tina21m
Reviews.Content: We stayed the weekend at the Flatotel near Time Square and their isn't much to complain about. The hotel did have some wear and tear and the elevators where a little warm and slow, but for the price of the rooms we didn't care. The beds were comfortable and the hotel was close to everything we wanted to do.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: circle0flight
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a clean, safe place to sleep, in between running around the city, this is a great place for you. If you are used to the Hilton, probably not so much. We loved it and had no problems. The location is minutes away from Time Square, fifth ave. Everything is in walking distance, museums, shopping, food. We had a blast, and I would recommend this hotel and stay here again. The only thing I noticed was the hotel staff was not the friendliest but that's okay, everything we needed we got. Our room was spacious and comfy, slept great in the bed, everything worked. AC super cold. No flat screened TV but that's not what we went for. All in all, worth the money, and it's a more affordable place to stay, then most other hotels in NYC. We also requested a corner room and got it, and were also upgraded without asking. Oh and yes, I guess the elevator is a bit slow, but really people, you have to wait a couple minutes, what's the big deal? My and my boyfriend used the time to talk about what we were going to do that day!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, especially for the price”
Reviews.Author: yobo94
Reviews.Content: We were really impressed with Flatotel when we stayed there for 3 nights in December. Great location, but still quiet. Decent-sized room for the city. Nothing fancy, nothing out of the ordinary, but it was clean, staff friendly (allow didn't see a lot of them), and bed was comfortable. Would I stay here again? Maybe. There are so many other places to stay in New York, and there was nothing that really compelled me to want to come back. However, the price was great considering the cleanliness/location factors, which are the most important to us, especially since all we care about in NYC is having a place to sleep--it's not like we hang out in the room. Lobby lounge area looked quiet, and the restaurant looked big though no one was there when we walked by (I think it had close by that time).

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location....”
Reviews.Author: nibblefingers
Reviews.Content: First impression of the hotel foyer is that it is very dark and foreboding - it certainly could do with more lighting. Staff were friendly and check-in was quick. We booked a deluxe king room which was on the 22nd floor right opposite the lift, I wasn't very happy at first as I had read that these rooms were noisy but we didn't hear anything at night. The room was very large but think it could do with a lick of paint as everything looks old and threadbare (the curtains looked liked they had never seen a washing machine). We didn't have any drawer space whatsoever so I had to leave my clothes in the suitcase for 7 nights as the wardrobe only had hanging space and the safe took up most of the other space. The bed was out of this world though, so comfortable (a bonus in itself). I did read that the lifts were very slow but we only encountered this on our last day and had to wait 5 mins. There was complimentary breakfast but we didn't take this up as we wanted to sample NY diners so had our breakfast at a different one each day. Overall the hotel is in a fantastic location, so close to all the sights, bed was soooo comfortable, but don't think you could class it as a 4 star.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!!!”
Reviews.Author: JMKEJB
Reviews.Content: There were several problems with the hotel/service 1. The room was dirty and not well cleaned. 2. At night the cold water came out "hot" and couldn't brush teeth or use the water. 3. The security guard yelled at me for looking through a door. 4. Breakfast was only so so. For a four star hotel I would expect more. Only good thing about this is the location. NOT recommended to stay here. I give them a "D".

Reviews.Title: “If you only need a room for sleep, this place might work”
Reviews.Author: lebowski76
Reviews.Content: Currently staying here on a business trip. Here are my thoughts: Pros: Friendly staff - every encounter has been smiles lobby/bar area is nice, haven't been to the bar yet. bathroom amenities are better than average - Better than Sheraton & the Manhattan around the corner price: of available choices in the area, this was the lowest priced. Clean: I haven't noticed anything dirty, but the rooms do have a certain "lived-in" quality to them. Free Wifi: typical speed for hotels (1.56m download, 0.17 upload). Don't expect to run any streaming content, but you can do normal surfing/email. Free gym: haven't been, but a value. dvd/vcr/ipod dock in room: upon request Free continental b'fast: haven't had it, but free food is free food. Cons: Thin walls & adjoining rooms - If you like to hear the rooms next to you, then you'll love it here. It is LOUD. No desk - some rooms have them, some don't. As this is a business trip it is a major setback Smell - my first room reeked of cigarette smoke latching doors - both rooms I have been in do not automatically close behind you. This is a big security risk (and fire hazard?). no coffee maker in room - you have to ask for one. Seriously? This is the first hotel I've ever stayed at that does this. It's hard to say whether I'd stay here again. As of now, I'd much rather spend the extra money per night and stay across the street at the Hilton or Sheraton.

Reviews.Title: “A great find in midtown Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: CherylGLBoston
Reviews.Content: Located on W. 52nd Street, this hotel is in the perfect location for exploring Manhattan. While my husband was in business meetings (walking distance away), I was able to walk to a Broadway show and enjoy Central Park. Our room was huge and very clean, and the bathroom was contemporary and lovely. The decor in the lobby could use some updating and the front desk staff was a bit off-putting. We enjoyed the bartender as he served us a late night end of day cocktail. I would definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at the Flatotel!”
Reviews.Author: SueKeels
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Flatotel over the July 4th weekend. We had a wonderful experience! We were greeted by the doorman the second we stepped out of our taxi. The outstanding front desk attendant checked us in with a warm hospitable welcome and was extremely helpful. Our hotel room was very well appointed and the bed was lush, plush and super comfortable â€“ pure heaven! Our room was exceptionally clean and updated. The housekeeping staff was very friendly and paid close attention to detail. The Midtown location was perfect to check out the city scene and in walking distance to many NYC favorites. The service in the restaurant was very good and the lounge area was relaxing with a great vibe! I would highly recommend staying at the Flatotel if you are planning a trip to the Big Apple! We canâ€™t wait to return one day soon!

Reviews.Title: “God Awful!!!”
Reviews.Author: HonestAbe_16
Reviews.Content: Simply one of the worst hotels I have stayed at for the price they are charging. From wet carpets, to doors that don't open, to brown water flowing from the tap, and the slowest elevators known to man. Why someone would spend their hard earned money to stay here is beyond me. I could not close the shades in my room because the power cord to the television was in the way. At one point had to unplug and replug the TV in order to shut it off and on. The absolute worse thing is that they reference themselves as a luxury hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good Stand By”
Reviews.Author: Upintheairtoomuch
Reviews.Content: Honestly, there is nothing wrong with this hotel, but I am not sure if it is a 4 star hotel. It is getting a little old, and needs renovation to keep up with the competition. The staff is always friendly and helpful, but the elevators took FOREVER to come and the rooms are dark and the TV is WAY OLD - all the stations did not work either. The only way I stay here these days is if the other hotels are sold out or too expensive. (I used to love staying here!)

Reviews.Title: “The dead flowers stinking up the lobby say it all. Will not return.”
Reviews.Author: eyebehold
Reviews.Content: The room itself was spacious and quite nice, but it should have been for the price. The best thing about the room was the split bathroom. A toilet and sink behind one door, and a shower, bigger mirror, and sink with lots of counter space. That was the high point of the experience. Where do I begin with the Cons? Lets start with the elevators that take roughly 5 minutes to respond. That is not an exaggeration. I stood at the elevator with several other people for 6 minutes waiting for an elevator. There are 6 lifts in total, but it seems that only one is used for the hotel. One is labeled service elevator, and the others are behind a table with flowers. Guess that means they are not operating. Once in the room I noticed how poorly they had been maintained. The paint looked to be decades old, and the small "kitchen" area was filthy. No cups, plates, bowls, just silverware and a pot. The television was the size of a volkswagon with a screen barely larger than my Ipad. When the T.V. was on, it made a whistling sound that drowned out any sound from the channel I might be trying to watch. Onto the bed. There might have been springs in the bed, but they were below the plywood top that made the mattress. I compare it to sleeping on a diving board. The last experience with this hotel was checking out and finding a charge from the restaurant that was charged to my room for a significant amount. Having not eaten once in the hotel, I disputed it and was not able to have it resolved before I left New York. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: Debjane333
Reviews.Content: We booked the flatotel because it was really central. I did read some negative reviews though on tripadvisor so was a bit apprehensive. However, it was great. It was centrally placed, right near the Rockefeller Centre. We were told that our booking didn't include breakfast, but the hotel offers a continental breakfast anyway which was a really pleasant and money saving surprise. The rooms were really spacious, particularly for a New York hotel. Would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “It's OK.”
Reviews.Author: rich010273
Reviews.Content: It's a little dated in the bathroom and communal corridors once you get upstairs but everything is clean and functional. Some great views down 52nd Street if you get a corner room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location-”
Reviews.Author: drtravel47
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly good hotel. The location is outstanding. Near the Theatre District, Radio City, Le Bernedin. To echo other TA's, the lobby is gloomy and there are clearly not enough elevators, but the room was clean, the bathroom attractive, a comfortable bed and powerful shower. The continental breakfast is a nice touch in NYC, but it's somewhat disorganized. Gregory, the concierge, is as professional and knowledgeable as those in 5 star hotels. My room wasn't particularly huge (I hear others were) and was in the inside. While there was no view, except the windows of office buildings, it was nice and quiet at night.

Reviews.Title: “really pleased”
Reviews.Author: 7418amf
Reviews.Content: I had read comments on Trip advisor about this Hotel and I was rather concerned about some of the reviews; i actually e-mailed one of the contributors. However i was really really pleased with what this hotel had to offer and had a fantastic time in NYC . This Hotel does need a bit of "cosmetic surgery"; grout around windows in bathroom a bit mouldy, paint works touched up but other than that its fine. My room was 2506 a large airy room, comfortable bed, fridge and powerful a/c a huge bonus during our stay ( 31st may - 5th june wasrather warm!!!) Staff were very friendly, location excellant and no issue with elevators!!! We booked this trip with Virgin Atlantic and would recommend this hotel and would come back and stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but flawed”
Reviews.Author: aeisenberg
Reviews.Content: I think we've stayed in most of the hotels in this area. It's a great location for tourists and business types alike, thanks to subway access and easy walking to midtown attractions. We had a corner room (2405) which was quite large. I like the room. Lighting was adequate. We had a great little loveseat, plenty of space and a full length mirror. The bathroom is nice-ish. Great big tub with a window! You don't see that every day. But the grout was cruddy. And it's mad inconvenient that there are NO hooks to hang your towels. It's pretty unbelievable. We used the one little hook that the hotel robe hangs on for our towels and the maid then left the robe draped over the toilet. Ew. There was a spacious desk and a mini fridge to use. I love that. WiFi worked fine. The worst part of the hotel is the SLOW elevator. Other guests were complaining about it all the time, too. TWO elevators for 40 floors?? It's crazy and inconvenient. Nothing they can do about it, so just be aware. Still, it's a nice place with a nice enough lobby, even a bar where we saw some people hanging out for a drink.

Reviews.Title: “Location and rooms are great.”
Reviews.Author: TashaLin
Reviews.Content: We booked a suite and requested a view - and did we get it! The room was huge with windows on 2 sides. The door opened onto a large balcony high above the city. There is also a full kitchen - who wants to cook, but it's nice having a refrig and microwave and dishes. Have stayed here before in a room (not a suite) and it was also roomy and nice. The bathrooms are good sized also.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: AndysBridgend_UK
Reviews.Content: Hotel rooms and facilities a little tired and out dated, but clean and staff all very friendly and helpful. A great location as Times Square just at the end of the block. We spent very little time actually in the hotel so the facilities didn't really matter to us, as the location more than made up for it.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel in A beautiful City, New York...Wondeful!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jerseygirl6161
Reviews.Content: This hotel and the staff were delightful!!!! The accomadations were beautiful and very comfortable. We would highly recommend this hotel when in N.Y.C. We live in Switzerland and know terrific hotels when we see them!!!! Thisis a find! The Dykowski's

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a chic break on a budget”
Reviews.Author: MrsMuffin81
Reviews.Content: I visited this hotel with my husband for a romantic week away in New York. We were looking for all the comforts of a luxury hotel, but without the hefty price tag that comes with many of the top NYC hotels. And that's exactly what we got. From the moment we stepped through the door it was easy to forget that this is only a 3* hotel. The decor is classy and the lighting remincsent of a chic evening bar. The welcome was warm and the information full. The rooms were well sized and the bed uber-comfy. The romms and communal areas were well air-conditioned, which was hugely weelcomed considering the May heat outside! The bathroom was large, and the little extras were far more than you'd get in a hotel of simialar rating in the UK. I was particularly impressed with the his & hers bathrobes and slippers, and also the little bottles of conditioner (I expect shower gel, body lotion and shampoo as standard, but girls will understand that complimentary hotel shampoos often leave your hair feeling like straw so the little bottles of conditioner were a great touch!) The hotel provides a complimentary breakfast, which was a lovely surprise because it was advertised as room-only in our hotel brochure. Alright, it wasn't out-of-this-world but considering it was free it was pretty good. A range of bagels, pastries, muffins, donuts, plus tea and fresh orange juice. And if you fancied something more, there was a menu of cooked options for reasonable prices. The hotel also caters at lunch and evening, although it always looked pretty empty, and there are so many places to eat in New York that we never got round to sampling it. The bar area is lovely, but the prices are typically hotel (it cost us $21 plus tip for a beer and a Jack & coke). It was nice for a quick drink after a long night, but you can get two or three rounds for the same price elsewhere. If there was one thing that lets the hotel down a litttle it's the lifts/elevators. There are only two lifts (plus the service lift) and it just isn't enough for 46 floors. You could spend five minutes just waiting for the lift to arrive, and when it did it was jam packed. Locationally Flatotel is PERFECT. It's ten blocks (about five minutes) from the middle of Times Square and has the advantage of being just off the main street so is fairly quiet for a good night's sleep. Central park is five minutes away, as are Fifth Avenue for shopping and the Rockerfeller Centre. We loved our stay in New York and would stay at the Flatotel again in a snap.

Reviews.Title: “Good value - good experience”
Reviews.Author: RaggedClaws49
Reviews.Content: Reading past reviews, I was prepared for the Flatotel to disappoint me, but overall it was a good experience. We came to stay here after booking through Expedia without knowing what property or the location. The location, as it turned out, was exactly where we wanted it, and the price was good. The catch was that Flatotel (or somebody else?) claimed 4-star status for themselves, and I don't think that's accurate. So here are the property's pros and cons. The reception/checkout staff were excellent, providing quick and early check-in and help with luggage. The lobby is small for the number of units at the property - it functions well, but could use updates in lighting and furnishings. The three elevators were adequate but not speedy - they carry a heavy load considering the 40+ floors served. Some background: the building was residential apartments until it was converted to a hotel in about 2000. Our room was HUGE, a one-bedroom apartment, complete with 1.5 baths, kitchen, living room and BR. The basics - bedroom and bath - were just fine and quite satisfactory. Many of the furnishings detracted - in the living room, furniture was dated, lamps were sort of lopsided and ungainly, the coffee table had a stain. Shades throughout were difficult to raise and lower. There were many things that fell short of 4-star, yet overall, given the rate we paid, we enjoyed our stay and felt we got good value. Things to like - solid construction, no noise from neighbors, good views, nice TVs (2 of them), a bathtub with jacuzzi jets, a good bed, an extra 1/2 bath, LOTS of space. Things to not like - tired furnishings, no signage to indicate how to turn on the jacuzzi jets (the switch - discovered long after the bath - was 10 ft from the bathtub). Especially nice was the continental breakfast - good food, pleasant surroundings and service, although the space could get crowded at peak times. Another thing contributing value in a big way.

Reviews.Title: “Not a nice as prior trips.”
Reviews.Author: dmfavia
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel twice before (2004 and 2006) and wasn't as happy with my recent stay as I've been in the past. Although we booked back in Feb, we got a room right by an elevator which was disappointing. The location is really good. We were able to walk to Times Square in a few minutes. The complimentary continental breakfast is lame. It is poorly stocked and not all that filling. If you like a big breakfast to start your day, order from the menu or go out.

Reviews.Title: “Room not in best condition”
Reviews.Author: Paul T
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Flatotel for two nights for a conference in May of 2011. The location is very central, just outside of Times Sq, and the room was very large. Unfortunately, the condition of the room was not the best. The TV seemed to date from the 1990's, and the remote did not work. The bathtub had jucuzzi jets, but they appeared to be inoperable. Several light bulbs were burned out in the room upon arrival, and I could not get anyone from housekeeping to answer the phone. While it was fine for a few nights on business, I think the test is whether one would go back if you were paying for it yourself. I would not.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy Bed but the hotel needs a re-furb”
Reviews.Author: Leary46
Reviews.Content: The bed was the best part of the room, it was large and very comfy. The room was dark and in need of a re-furb. It didn't even have a central light you could switch on. The bathroom didn't work, the bath had a huge window by it & we had to shut the blind or everyone could see us spending a penny. There was no space to put your bathroom things. The hot water did not come on unless you ran both the bath and shower at the same time for ages. I did like the fact that the hotel asked if you wanted to have the sheets and towels changed to be environmentall friendly but I think this was negated by the amound of water we used just trying to get hot water. Our security card to open our room door did not work twice and we felt security objected to helping us get back in our room. The reception staff on arrival were not friendly or welcoming and that was a disappointment. The location is a good thing but I would not recommend this hotel or want to stay at it again. We literally slept and then went off for the day.

Reviews.Title: “good location tired hotel..”
Reviews.Author: mandalLeicestershire
Reviews.Content: We travelled to new york and arrived at our hotel all excited to be slightly disappointed as the room we were given on the 36th floor was tired with frayed carpets scratched walls old tired kitchen and no 3rd bed as requested when booking this hotel it was graded as a 4 star hotel but i would say it was more like a three at a push, we did however complain and were given another room as we paid quite a lot for this hotel the main reception was really nice tho and this didnt reflect the rest of the hotel it seemed like it was rushed to finish and looked incomplete and quite dirty, the staff were very friendly and really helpful and i cant complain about anything else, the view from the hotel was good as we could see all of manhattan and part of central park, the location is prefect for all area of new york, i probably wouldnt go back but that is no refelection on the staff or help just needs updating and a good clean although the room was cleaned well daily.

Reviews.Title: “Dreary place in an exciting neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: MHersh328
Reviews.Content: The biggest thing that sticks with me about this hotel is that the whole place seemed dull, dark, and uninviting. The street entrance is unremarkable, and the lobby was like a cave. The staff I dealt with were nice enough, but they couldn't brighten the mood of the place if they had flowers growing out of their ears. The room seemed dated, with several relatively minor items in need of repair, but more importantly there was no art on the walls and the room was a dull monochrome color scheme. The room was comfortable enough, but I couldn't get past the depressing feeling. I was also disappointed that I had to use wired internet, but at least I could connect. As many have said, the best part of this place is the location, a short walk to Times Square and all the excitement (and food) there. I'd recommend this place on the basis of location and price, just know what you're getting into.

Reviews.Title: “Great location (plus thank you to the manager)”
Reviews.Author: ILoveSkinnyDipping
Reviews.Content: I arrived to be told that my booking had been cancelled by the agent, however the hotel manager helped me out and upgraded me (I ended up in a suite, so no complaints there!!) The hotel is a bit dark as you go into the lobby but my room was enormous and the windows allowed the sunlight in all day long. I'd read complaints about waiting ages for elevators however I don't think I ever waited longer than 20 seconds, so I don't know where this came from?! The best feature (aside from my enormous, light room and my huge comfortable bed) was the location! A short walk from Times Square, shopping on 5th Avenue, the theatre district and not too far from the park.... If I had to give a negative I would say that some of the furniture in the room appears slightly aged, or needs brightening up, but then I wasn't paying to be in the W...!! All-in-all it was good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “What a view...”
Reviews.Author: Monpetit
Reviews.Content: Now our usual adress why coming in New York, it will stay our adress... The situation is optimal , near Times square, but not too near and so a small stop before broadway shows is always possible(+++ when you are with wife and young teenager after a day of shopping..) and you have not the noise of Times square. With a little of "courage" you can do all by feet or going by railway and coming back by feet... Rooms are large, clean and bathrooms too. We usually take a one bed room suite but have been surprisely(and in the good sens) been upgraded to the 45th. floor appartment : that was terrific : view, quiet, espace...Flatotel make our vacation a dream!!! Thanks to them...Complimentary coffees on the morning(in the lobby) add to the charm and USA today everyday a plus. Cocktails at the bar are excellent. Moda for a lunch or a dinner one time in the sejour is enough...We didn't try it for breakfast as we ususally do a small walk and take something in small cafetaria around.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing to worry about!”
Reviews.Author: MrsS83_11
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel as part of a package holiday and trusting the company we booked with, didn't see any reason to worry-until we read some of the reviews on here. I like to stay in nice hotels and for my first trip to New York, it wasn't sounding very promising. But it was absolutely fine! The location is absolutely fantastic; close to Times Square, The Rockefeller, The Empire State building, 5th Avenue, you couldn't get any better for sightseeing. The room we had was a corner room, it was big, with several windows providing a good view. The bed was really comfortable and the bathroom was a decent size too. We did notice at times that there was a queue for the lifts, but it didn't cause us any problems. Overall, it was fit for purpose and we would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: Nickkenn
Reviews.Content: Booked this place after recommendation from a friend who went there 5 years ago and read reviews. There were 4 of us, myself, my wife and two kids aged 15 & 7. We really wanted some space to relax in at the end of a busy day sightseeing in New York which is why the prospect of the suite accommodation appealed to us. We booked for 5 nights and after some negotiation agreed a rate of $700 per night + taxes for a 5 night stay. If you look at the website for the Flatotel it boasts 'fully equipped kitchens'. We found this not to be the case. We were told on arrival we had been upgraded and were shown an enormous 2bed suite with en-suite bathrooms, large living area and a seperate dining area as well as a kitchen. It was on the 43 rd floor and offered great views. We were tired after a long flight and went straight to bed but the next morning as we began to explore our room things were not quite what we'd hoped for. I began to compile a list of what I thought was wrong with the room which included - 1) Almost no kitchen equipment insufficient plates, utensils, no kettle, coffee maker etc. 2) TV not working in master bedroom. 3) Slow draining sink and bath in master en-suite 4) Bed frame broken in master en-suite (resulting in sagging) I presented this to reception the next morning and told them I was going out and wanted these items fixing or an alternative room when I got back. They fixed the sink and put some bits in the kitchen and to be fair showed me the room I'd booked (which seemed OK) but given the size of the 'upgraded suite' decided to stick with it and endure the faults. On balance I guess my expectations were a little high and I was disappointed when I got there. On the whole it's a great location and offers spacious accommodation albeit a little tired now. If they did this place up it would be fantastic. I think someones just not doing their job properly as the kitchen equipment we were left was really not up to it and the other faults could have easily been detected i.e. the maid should have seen the slow draining sink and bath when washing them down. I've posted some pics so you can see for yourselves. p.s. the high speed internet is a joke. I had a quicker connection back in 2000 with a 56kbps dial up!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: Bopples
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the fly and had no issues at all. Friendly staff, rooms clean, huge beds and perfect location. I read a lot of reviews that had poor things to say about the lift?.. It was fine....fast, no issues at all. Would stay here again. Hotels for me are just a base, as long as they are clean, quiet and comfortable then it gets my vote. The safe was perfect, large bathroom, plenty of storage space and daily room service...

Reviews.Title: “old, filthy, no wi-fi(ask for a cable), no water supply for the showers (it took so long)”
Reviews.Author: elaineMontrealQuebec
Reviews.Content: This is not a 4 star hotel at the least a 3 star even. We were kind of shocked at our arrival, every thing is so old and dirty, the design at the lobby is weird, when we asked the staff concerning the rating given by expedia they responded:for now it is a 3 star but this summer when the tourists arrive it is going to be a 4 star hotel, i wonder what is going to change? The concierge had to give us a cable to plug in so we can get the internet. Parking fees 45$ per day,very expensive compared to other great hotels .The carpets are old and dirty, the tv is about 10 years old, they tried remodeling the bathroom but it is still very old,difficulty taking a shower the water supply kept stopping, the beds are new and confortable that is the only good thing. The elevators took 15 to 20 minutes of waiting before arriving to our floor(not during peak hours). Breakfast was included but did not look good, we ate somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “dirty and "used"”
Reviews.Author: emu711
Reviews.Content: stayed here as part of a bachelorette weekend. while the 2bd suite was quite large and had excellent views, the furniture was spotted, soiled, and damaged, and there was virtually no decoration except for a yard sale picture of flowers. they have a good space to work with, but sadly have treated it like a cheap motel. the room didn't feel welcoming in any sense of the word, and the extra cots we ordered were stained, lacked appropriate linens, and had linens with obvious repairs -- not quality at all. one bedroom was too hot, and i ended up sleeping in my jacket since i couldn't turn off the A/C. the internet router was sloppily attached to the wall, and served as the decor for one feature wall. the ironing board wouldn't stay open.

Reviews.Title: “Do not give credit card details to reveption”
Reviews.Author: ladymuk42
Reviews.Content: Hi I returned from New York yesterday only to find that the hotel have taken money from my card. My holiday was booked as a package so everything was paid for up front, we never even used the complimentary coffee. I would strongly advise you not to give your card details, after a good trip with my daughter I now have the pleasure of trying to get my money back. Really not happy. Lobby over rated. Rooms spacious. Staff not helpful at all. The door men are but they would be as your tipping them. I am a Travel agent and I would not sell this hotel to any of my clients. I do not believe in letting them know who I am or who I work for. I like to be treated the same as my customers. Maybe next time I'll tell them.!!

Reviews.Title: “Great family suite for the price”
Reviews.Author: PaliGirl
Reviews.Content: You won't find anything in the city with so much space and convenience as the Flatotel's family suite. Not the most beautifully decorated room, but definitely the most convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Rundown and really grubby”
Reviews.Author: Clementine6
Reviews.Content: What a sad place. Everything is grubby and tatty. The room lighting is abysmal, but then I suppose it makes it harder to see the dirt. The staff are friendly enough, but the place is just so depressing. Yuck.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Front Desk not friendly”
Reviews.Author: Tammie217
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the reviews being mostly good, the location, and the price point. The Valet service was excellant and friendly, the front desk staff was OK for my husband, but when I asked questions, I felt like they were at best defensive. For example, we came in very early Saturday morning, and I knew we could not check in, but was relatively sure we could get valet parking and have our luggage stored. I approached the front desk, and explained I knew check in was at 4:00PM and could we store our luggage and get valet parking, a very short reply like "over there" pointing his finger. I inquired about check in (didn't know if we needed to take care of paperwork then or later) and was told nothing guarenteed until after 4:00PM, so I said "stop back after 4:00PM? and he said "Stop back anytime you like, but it won't be ready until after 4:00PM". In the morning another exchange about where to eat breakfast, there was a continental included with the stay, the tables when we arrived were littered with plates, and no service person available for more than 5 minutes as we stood there. We decided to go out. I appoached the front desk, with a smile and asked him (same guy) where we might get some breakfast, instead of speaking, he pointed to the breakfast room. I stated the above situation, he said "we're not affiliated with them" and I agaain stated we thought we would go out, (still with a smile on my face) and he said "I don't know where you would like to go"..... Rooms were clean, if Spartan, beds comfortable, no washcloths in the room, a robe to use. Very good location, and price, but for $50.00 more I think you might be able to do better in the same location. It doesn't cost anything to be polite.

Reviews.Title: “Big problems.... EXCellent Recovery”
Reviews.Author: PennsylvaniaPaki
Reviews.Content: We choose the Flatotel because of the excellent location and were not disappointed. It is within walking distance of everything. We booked the least expensive room which wasn't bad but not great for three days so we asked to upgrade. For $50 extra a night we got a room with 2 walls of windows and even a window in the bathroom. now the problems, room service stops at 10:30 in the am so you can't even get coffee. Their solution: they sent up a coffee maker with real cream. Next the hot water wouldn't turn off, we had to crawl under the sink and turn off the shut off valve. Their solution, take $100 off our room. The front desk day personnel were wonderful and very sensitive to our problems. So while we had some issues the recovery was wonderful and I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in midtown, close to most everything, reasonably priced.”
Reviews.Author: Stickyheels
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Flatotel! It's in walking distance to Central Park and Time Square (but not IN Times Square by any stretch of the imagination) and a great subway line that will take you right into the heart of the village. We had a corner room with a King bed (I think? It's been a while, might have been a Queen), and 2 of the 4 walls were windows, which was really great. We called the morning before we left for our trip and requested a corner room on a higher level, and the conceirge said he would, of course, take our request into consideration ...so I didn't have much hope but we did get the corner room on a higher level, so just color me delighted :) Bathroom was nice, tub was very large and there was a window in the shower, which I like. The toilet looks like it's straight out of the 1980s but it does the job :) My only complaint: the hair dryer put out cold air. Lots of fast, cold air. I called down and requested another hair dryer, and I got it! But sadly, it also put out cold air. Oh well! It's a great hotel at a great price (our rooms were $381/night) and close to lots of sight-seeing opportunities. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Needs modernising but good location”
Reviews.Author: Nicnac30
Reviews.Content: When we arrived someone had not booked us in on the computer on the dates we due to stay, so they had to find us a room and it was bad. To start it was interconnecting and to say it was a non smoking floor the room next to us smoked constantly and as non smokers it was really unpleasant. The mirror was lent against the wall not hung, the fridge was not fixed down so every time we opened it, it came off it's ledge landing on my foot the first time as I was not expecting it to. The curtains fell off the rails and the tv was old the Room was very out dated and in badly need of modernising but was clean, personally I would not stop in this hotel again. However the location was good but really name a hotel in manhattan that isnt. The lobby is decieving as it is new and modern and the restaurant is lovely and the staff are nice. Overall we didn't spend much time in the hotel room but It was depressing thinking we did have to go back to it.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location , massive rooms !”
Reviews.Author: raviandoli
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Virgin and got an excellent deal , went here for my 40th birthday !!!! We stayed on the 38th Floor I think it may have been a suit as it was huge . It had a small kitchen, decent size bathroom combined living and sleeping area with a good sized balcony (3806). We didnt eat or drink in the bar but it did seem quite popular. Reading some of the reviews I wasnt sure what to expect. But it seems people are just to picky !!!! We had no problem with the lifts ( the hotel did seem a little buisy ) yes some of the bathroom cupboard doors and kitchen doors are a little chipped , but so what. It was very clean and well layed out. Check in staff were pleasent and helpful. This hotel is in a excellent location , a few blocks from time square, Rock a fella centre , central park etc. We went ice skating in Central Park on Wolman Lake. Carnegies around the block is a great for breakfast a definate must. We had planned to eat at Lombardys, but the place was closed due to the oven bing cleaned, so we asked in a local bar in Little Italy where they could reccomend they suggested L'asso which was around the block from Lombardys. I t was one of the best pizzas me and my wife have ever had !!!!! Also the Burger Joint located in the foyer of the Le Park Meridian is a must , trust me it is in there. Best Burger ever. Statten Island free ferry is a good way to see the New York Skyline and the Staue of Liberty !!! The Top of The Roc sunset and sunrise ticket is the best view of New York , lift ride is pretty good too !! $32 each , but worth it . I didnt think the shopping was that cheap in New York , we travelled to Boston next via Pen Street staion, Boston was much cheaper. PS Central Station is a must see too. Overall excellent Hotel and a great place to visit ( cold though in Jan )

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the other reviews...Awesome”
Reviews.Author: deano18
Reviews.Content: First trip to NYC, stayed for 6 nights over NYE. Rooms were clean, large, bed comfy, elevators worked, concierge friendly and helpful, air con/heater worked, had hot water. Very close to everything. Was nervous as i had read the reviews, but had nothing to worry about - definately recomend - will be staying again next i'm in NYC. Thanks for making my stay so enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Good thing the location was good......”
Reviews.Author: MlleW
Reviews.Content: My trip to NYC was AMAZING!!! I had such a wonderful time and everything was just perfect! Well, almost everything....everything except FLATOTEL! While staying at Flatotel, I was electrocuted while trying to plug my mobile phone charger into the outlet. I filed a 'report' and a mainenance guy came to the room to check the plug and nothing happened to him so his response was that it was fine. I said well it may be for you right now, but I could not let go of the plug while getting volts sent through my entire body. Another gentleman came upstairs to see me about 10 hours later to ask if I needed a doctor. The next day my lap top, my lap top bag and a bunch of French resources (I am a French teacher), my friend's lap top cord and international plug converter were stolen from our hotel room when we left for NYE celebrations. I didn't feel that either of these situations were handled well by the hotel. Reports were made internally and I was told repeatedly that they were going to take care of everything for me and that they took these matters very seriously, but then once I left Manhattan, I never heard from them again. I left all of my contact information (with 2 different people in person and one other on the phone when I returned home) and whenever I called I got passed around to 2 or more people and never got straight answers. Once I finally got in touch with the director of security he told me I needed to file a report. This should have been told to me at the hotel when it happened not 2-3 weeks after the fact. The hotel said they were taking care of everything for me, so I assumed that everything....actually meant everything... Once in contact with this 'gentleman' I was made to feel like the robbery was my fault and that I must have left my door open. I was getting NO help from him so went ahead and called about 6 different numbers until I found the right one to make a robbery report with the NYPD. I was just extremely let down by this hotel. It was a really great corner room (minus the rock hard bed), and so close to Time Square and definitely would have been happy there, if it weren't for these 2 awful experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid this hotel”
Reviews.Author: paulbo
Reviews.Content: Below average hotel, indifferent staff. Only the location is good, but there are lots of other hotels nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Midtown location and unusual roominess”
Reviews.Author: Hitwoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Flatotel the week before Christmas 2010 and found the Midtown location great for holiday activities: Rockefeller Center, Radio City, Fifth Avenue shopping, etc. Access to the subway was right around the corner as well. The rooms are larger than you typically see in NYC, and include a mini-fridge, which is a plus after a long day in December weather. Amenities and the restaurant are average, but I don't see this as a bells-and-whistles hotel, anyway. Good value as well.

Reviews.Title: “jr. executive suite dirty and in disrepair”
Reviews.Author: vacationnutinil.
Reviews.Content: I can only comment on the executive jr. suite room 4006. I asked for a newly renovated room and the person at the front desk told me it was. I was disappointed with the dingy carpet (stains and buckles),the dust around the cabinets in the kitchen (black) and the dirty air returns. The cabinets in the bathroom and kitchen were chipped. The drawers at the end of the bed fell off the brackets when you pull them out. The stains and chips on the floors and countertops in the kitchen and bathroom were ugly. For over $500.00 a night, I expected a clean asthetic room. Otherwise the location is great, and the beds were very comfortable.However, I would stay somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “will try another place next time”
Reviews.Author: ripe64
Reviews.Content: Thin walls. very noisy, adjacent door to next room with kids playing with the door handle, back door frame ducked taped, intercom going off early morning and finally staff was alittle rude.

Reviews.Title: “Great location- average hotel”
Reviews.Author: onedumgoy
Reviews.Content: I'm not a big fan of the minimalist noveau trendy decor. Some of you hipsters might appreciate it, but i find it cold and unwelcoming. That being said, the hotel is in a great location. You are central to everything. The room size is also exceptional for NYC. Staff was friendly and efficient. My biggest negative is the ambience and no coffee maker in the room, although free coffee is available downstairs. They have free wi-fi as well. My room was a bit worn, but I understand that some have been refreshed, so you should ask for one of those rooms. You could do worse!

Reviews.Title: “Nice,Reasonable,Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kwtech
Reviews.Content: Stayed one Saturday night to attend a play. Great location a half block from Times Square and one and half blocks from Rockefeller Center (NBC, Radio City). Big rooms for NYC, deluxe king was over 400 square feet. Nice king bed and bathroom was very spacious. Decorations are sparse. Got great rate for Saturday night- approximately 375.00 + tax. Had a view of 52nd street. Hallway carpet was definitely well worn. The building is 42 stories (including apartments) but only 3 elevators (including service elevator. Be patient waiting for elevators. Hotel has a business center with free computers, printing and internet in the basement. I advised eating out as opposed to eating at the restaurant. The food was not the greatest and service is very very slow. It took an hour to get a simple burger and light salad (and there was very few people in the restaurant when we ordered). All in all, I'd stay there again if going to show in Times Square and price is right.

Reviews.Title: “Overall great location and nice place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: SanCarbo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel by myself from dec 4-6 due to the hotel I booked being full. I was upgraded to the Flatotel and had a good experience with staff who were friendly to me. Pros: you can't beat this location as it is in walking distance to everything you want to see as a tourist. It is a modern European style hotel so if grays and blacks are too much for you then don't stay here. Personally I like the dim lighting. I asked to be moved on my 2nd night to a smoking room and they took care off the move f or me without me having to lift a bag. They put me in a corner room with all windows and good views on the 21st floor. I was very impressed by the size of the room it was unbelievable how big it was for NYC ! I ate in moda the restaurant and had a pleasant experience there with good food. Some people are just too picky .... Just be happy your hotel doesn't have bed bugs ! I checked the room thoroughly and found now sign of them at all. Cons: the first morning I woke up to the cleaning crew cleaning the carpet in front of my room with some machine that was very loud.. Kind of annoying. And yes u can hear the traffic below sometimes but u are in midtown in one of the busiest sections in NYC what do u expect? My first room had no heat and it was cold so I just turned it off and it was fine. Second room the heat got too hot so I just turned it off every so often. Overall I had a great stay and would reccomend. I wasn't expecting to stay here and so I think it was a great upgrade! I tried to stay a third night but the guy at the front desk said it would be 389 to stay that third night because they were really busy and that is just too steep for me for one night. THIS IS NOT A FOUR STAR HOTEL .... if that is what you are looking for then go down the road and pay another 200 a night to stay. It's only a hotel room and u spend very little time in there while u r in NY so why be so picky! I also had no problems with the elevators at all. I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel I've ever been, even the bad hotels in North Communist Vietnam were better !”
Reviews.Author: Operacastafiore
Reviews.Content: The only positive thing is the location in midtown, near Time Square and eventually the size of the one bedroom suite when you're having fun shopping with girl friends and have a lots of shopping bags piling up everyday ... The list of the negative points is endless, here are a few... Dirty and torn carpet Elevator taking 15 mns to arrive Unpleasant staff at the reception Electrical wires hanging from the cupboards in the bedroom Dirty drawers in the bathroom Kitchen (we never used it) with broken cupboards Ugly grey colors all over the walls Cheap decor on the arrival Don't know about the meals, we never tried...too risky ! Don't go there .... try the new trendy Meat packing district instead

Reviews.Title: “Ok place but no where near 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: BCRS
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on Hotwire understanding that it would be a 4 star accommodation. In reality a Three star-- maybe. On the positive side it is very well located in midtown, the rooms and bathrooms are surprisingly large for Manhattan and fairly clean.We had a good experience with the staff who was courteous and efficient.When we first checked in we were given a room that we were told was non smoking, however when we opened the door it was most obviously a room that smokers had used. We called down to the desk and a staff member brought us a key to another room within 5 minutes. The new room was acceptable. As other reviewers have stated, for a 4 star property the rooms are in need of updating. The carpet is in fair shape at best and the doors and trim are paited a most depressing grey as well as the walls in another shade of gray. Bathroom countertops are worn, have some staining and are faded from cleaners. Trim pieces in the elevator that help to secure the wall panels are loose.Today we have come to expect flat screen TVs in contemporary hotels, however these rooms still have jarge concole units al la 1990.with an update this could be the graet ace one would expect!

Reviews.Title: “Fine”
Reviews.Author: lauragp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is fine.... The room is small but tidy, with a large bathroom. The bed was hard, but with newer linens. The bathroom was big with a big bathtub shower - but almost too big. The room was pretty clean - but needed a thorough cleaning overall. Each floor only seems to have about 6 rooms or so on it so each one is fairly close to the elevator if that should bother you at all. Fine for a short stay at a moderate price.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC location!”
Reviews.Author: MOBERIN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 7 nights during our first trip to New York. I'd sum up the hotel as being a business hotel with no frills (apart from the restaurant - the service & food was lovely!) in a FANTASTIC location! We were blown away by the fact that it's only a few blocks from anywhere you'd want to go. Was clean & well serviced. Room was large. Would definitely stay again - for the vegetable spring rolls in the restaurant alone! :)

Reviews.Title: “Good location but looking tired”
Reviews.Author: MainSt
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Flatotel for two nights on a business trip and the hotel was selected by my client. Pros: good central location; large rooms for a central NYC hotel; essential amenities in room (ironing board, fridge, hairdryer); speedy housekeeping response; delis/cafes nearby for breakfast Cons: dreary facade and minuscule check-in area -- you almost don't think you are in a hotel; adjacent buildings under scaffolding; only two elevators (plus service elevator that a member of staff encouraged me to use); no coffee/tea making option in bedroom or even on floor; excessive use of poorly applied gray paint creates institutional feel rather than the stylish look they were probably aiming for; elevator lobby area and inside of elevators need refreshing; no TV guide in room or via cable and poor reception; awkward layout of seating furniture and tables in room; paper cups rather than glasses in bedroom/bathroom -- all of the above are relatively minor complaints, but their cumulative effect made for a lackluster hotel stay.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of the action hotel”
Reviews.Author: davisandfox
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a four night stay over in the Flatotel, NY. Chose after a lot of studying brochures. Found it after getting off at the 7th Ave subway and dragging our suitcases around the block for a while. Friendly enough front-of-house staff. Room was on 22nd floor and you could still hear the traffic far below. Thought the room looked unfinished: No artwork on the walls and a full length mirror propped up against the wall, but later realised this was the actual style of the hotel. Chose to get breakfast in deli closer to Times Square, rather than eat in the hotel. Other reviews have mentioned the lifts. only two servicing 46 floors. Often taking ages to arrive then full already. Also we found the gym, and couldn't get entry with our room key. Also 'state of the art' is a bt of an exageration, as it looked (thrrought the window, at least) of about half a dozen, single station machines. Perhaps a good CV workout would have been walking up the 46 floors first! All in all, hotel was fine and location excellent for central Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth The Money”
Reviews.Author: uk2007tracy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights, family of four, needed a hotel in the Times Square area that would have enough room for all of us without costing $1K a night. Used an AmEx discount so the Suite priace at the Flatotel cost was reduced to $550 a night - it listed at over $700. Pros: Good location, about a block away from Radio City Music Hall and within walking distance to Rockefeller Center. Room was large - was put in what was basically a small apartment with one bedroom, small kitchen & dining area, and main area with a fold out couch. Cons: Everything else. Every time I asked the staff for something it took multiple calls to get resolved. Made reservations for 4 people. Called and confirmed that we were a party of FOUR. Arrived & checked in at 3:30pm to discover only two towels in the bathroom so called down to the Front Desk right away reminding them we had FOUR people and needed provisions for FOUR, including the sofa to be tuned into a bed with linens & pillows along with adequate towels. It took three more calls and two trips to the Front Desk before that night at ** 11pm ** someone finally came up to make up the sofa bed. And even then I had to call back to get towels and pillows. Who makes up a bed but doesn't bring pillows? And why on earth was this so hard? Every time we needed something we waited and waited for hours, and then called again. and waited.... Half the time no one answered the phone both at the Front Desk or at Room Service. The room was really musty and stale, like it had been sitting closed up with no ventilation for a very long time. The AC wasn't on so it was also very warm, and took about 45mins -1 hour to get the smell out and the place cooled off. They have a flier about how they are "green" and ask you to turn off everything including the air when you are not in the room - I appreciate wanting to save energy but I also need to be comfortable. Some ventilation on a regular basis is seriously required here. The room is shabby and in dire need of a thorough clean-up. The paint and wallpaper is peeling, the furniture is scuffed and scratched, the bathroom has rusty fixtures, the carpet is disgustingly ancient, half the blinds for the windows were broken and could not be opened.... and the bed frame was just nasty - old, raw wood that looked like someone had picked up off the street. The mattress was new, and I checked and found no signs of bedbugs on the mattress but jeez, that platform the mattress was on needed to be thrown away or at least covered up. The room didn't seem dirty - the couches and bed linens were clean and in good condition, everything else just seemed really old and tired. Yes, the bathroom is big with a whirlpool tub, but it took about an hour to drain completely after a shower, and that fancy whirlpool didn't work. And again, the tub was scuffed up and gouged. Used Hard and Put Away Wet. Room Service delivered breakfast one morning and dropped the tray, knocking off two tall glasses of orange juice shattering them so the carpet was covered in juice and glass. An accident, it wasn't her fault, she was horrified and apologized profusely. She called Housekeeping from the room to tell them we needed broken glass cleaned up right away and then went to replace the food items for me. Took 30 minutes for new glasses of juice to arrive. (Juice. 30 minutes. For Juice) and still no sign of housekeeping. Finally a woman did show up, came in to look at the mess, responded that this was a big mess and when were we checking out as she'd come back and clean it after we were gone. To which I replied I need the broken glass cleaned up right away, even though it was on carpet and not an easy clean up it was in a large area and I didn't want anyone stepping on glass. And I thought that would be their attitude as well. ** She left without doing anything**. About 45 minutes later a maintenance man shows up with a straw broom and a dustpan. He picks up glass pieces by hand and sweeps up what he can - from CARPET - and then takes a roll of paper towel that he gets wet in the sink and starts rubbing the floor. Proclaims it clean and leaves. Just another example of the lack of attention to detail. A vacuum cleaner was required AT LEAST, and perhaps it would have been nice to have had breakfast comped for the inconvenience of having to sit around all morning while they tried to figure out what to do about the broken glass - nope! TV reception was really bad - the living room area had a flat screen but it had a defective screen so the bottom half was much darker than the top, and the old console TV in the bedroom had lots of static and a poor picture quality. We didn't watch a whole lot of TV when in the room, too much hassle. Room Service food - give it a D. Ordered breakfast twice (kids really get a kick out of the whole Room Service indulgence) and it was only okay, certainly not worth the crazy prices - including a delivery fee, the 18% gratuity, the taxes....and then asking for an additional tip on top of this. Breakfast for 3 (eggs, bacon, toast, nothing fancy) with juice & coffee = $115 dollars after all the additional fees. That's crazy. Esp since it was mediocre food. The one time the kids ordered dinner they left most of it - the pizza seemed like it was frozen and the hamburgers was obviously premade store bought discs. If kids won't eat it you know its got to be bad. Overall this hotel sufficed for what were my two biggest needs which were space and location, but we'd not stay here again nor recommend it to anyone. It was not worth the high room prices at all. Disappointing. When we checking out the woman at the Front Desk said "Sign here" when she handed me the bill and nothing else. No "How was your stay?" or "Was everything alright". Nothing. I was prepared to list my issues with our stay if they asked but they never did. Severely lacking in Customer Service.

Reviews.Title: “great location - good hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarlou909
Reviews.Content: Very handy for Times Sq, 5th Ave etc, Staff are helpful, no issues with rooms. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, hotel good also”
Reviews.Author: sallya033
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel due to cancellation of alternate accommodation. Location is great, conveniently located near times square. Stayed in the 1-bedroom apartment with kitchen facilities which enabled us at least to have breakfast in the room. We were however, provided with very limited saucepans in which to do any detailed cooking. We were located on the 40th floor and the street noise was still clearly heard - this was blocked out though by the noise from the a/c. The sofa bed was broken when we arrived but the staff quickly provided us with confortable roll-away beds. Toilet also blocked but was fixed when we arrived back from sight-seeing. All-in-all, we would stay here again. Not sure if it is value for money as our alternate accommodation provider had to pay for us to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “5 mins from central park 5 mins from times square ! fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: anotherloulou
Reviews.Content: Was going to stay at the wardolf but now i'm really glad that they were fully booked ! Fantastic location and the rooms were spacious, clean, modern, comfortable and quiet :)

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it,”
Reviews.Author: Leo1211
Reviews.Content: I requested a non smoking room and they didn't have one available. The room stunk and they said they could move me the next day. The bathroom was clean but with the smell of stale smoke, it really didn't matter. The remote control didn't work either.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the $$”
Reviews.Author: Travel12866
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews, I thought this sounded like the best deal for the location. Completely disappointed. They did let us check in early, which was nice but the room was not what I expected. Seemed like a cheap, budget line run down room. Carpet in hallway was stained. Would give this a 'C.' Decent location but that's about it. Dim lighting. I asked for down-alternative pillows and had to wait almost an hour before I could go to bed-only arrived after I called a 2nd time. Lobby looks chic but nothing like the room or overall experience.

Reviews.Title: “Flat Decor and Services at the Flatotel”
