Reviews.Author: got2bedot
Reviews.Content: The hotel is dated and beat up and despite its great location and free internet (with an ethernet cord), I won't be back. Services, such as coffee, tea, and ice buckets, that are standard in the industry were non-existent at the Flatotel. I was completely unimpressed with the hotel and its staff including its housekeeping staff who left me questioning whether the bathroom counter and floors were cleaned regularly. The lobby tries to look cool and sleek but comes off as cold, uninviting, and loud. Elevator service is beyond lousy, taking far too long for arrival in the lobby or my floor. As to the room and its decor, outdated, outdated, outdated...from the long, impractical hallway, to the nook area with no lights, no coffee maker, and no reason to be there, to the television, to the bathroom. The bathroom was in bad shape with missing tiles and an extremely slow draining bath drain that when reported to the front desk remained slow draining throughout my stay. Water leaked everywhere from the poorly designed shower enclosure. The television was from another time...a time before flat screens and HDTV. For NYC, the hotel was a huge disappointment - especially at the rates charged.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, not so great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bernardorpington
Reviews.Content: Just got back fron our 5 night stay in new york. we arrived at the flatotel after a long flight and transfer (at 4pm) and we were told our room wasnt ready. we were left sitting in reception for 40 minutes, and as only resolved when i chased it up. Our room was located on the 21st floor (2111), the rooms at this hotel are HUGE! , however they are outdated and certainly are not deluxe as it states in the brochure and on there website. The one good thing in this hotel is the HUGE BED! it is so comfy, and we had 5 brilliant nights sleep. Some of the furniture is chipped and old. the bathroom wasnt clean enough and the tv very old!. Be aware that the hotel take your credit card details, and charge your card 50$ a day incase of incidentals (we were not told this when we checked in). if you dont use any services they refund it at the end of your stay. As for location, well what can i say FANTASTIC! this hotel is a 5 minute walk from times square/ central park south and fifth avenue. If you have a map you will easily find your way round. DO NOT EAT IN LINDYS DINER IN SEVENTH AVENUE AS ITS RIDICULOUSLY OVERPRICED. Overall i would recommend the hotel purely for location as its fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “We got this hotel cause the hotel we booked was full”
Reviews.Author: Claudie82
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night in the Flatotel cause the hotel we booked was full. The room was fine, bed was great and bathroom fine, all clean. We stayed at the 20th floor and they could do something about the elevator: the walls aren't fixed so you can see the isolation. Greatest advantage for us was the free WIFI which we didn't have in the hotel we originally booked. The staff is friendly and the lobby lookes nice. We didn't used the breakfast option as we didn't booked it. We also didn't make use of the location of the hotel, since we only stayed one night and arrived at 11PM on the day we had been in the airplane for 10 hours. We slept like babies!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, OK Hotel...”
Reviews.Author: TotalSOURCE
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is very good, its right in the middle of New York - really very convenient! Also there are plenty of eateries opposite and surrounding if you fancy a quick meal. Moda, the hotel restaurant, was closed when I was there, and no room service! Flatotel is trendy, with modern furnishings and a sleek look. The Hotel booked me into the room - however check in was slow and they did not have my room ready when I arrived. The staff seemed rude and obnoxious . I waited for about 30/40 Mins. When I got to the room it was spacious, if a little sparse, but had wonderful oversized beds - with plenty of pillows/nice sheets. Nice sized bathrooms as well, with complimentary toiletries [no hair-dryer] . All clean - but not spotless, housekeeping never disturbed me. The wardrobes are small with little hangers and there is only a microwave and fridge in room - no kettle - but tea/coffee? Windows are not soundproofed - so it can be noisy if on lower floors. Finally, the elevators [there are only 2] take forever to arrive, and are always very busy! Beware you'll be waiting ages! In all fairness there are better hotels surrounding - e.g Sheraton/Hilton which provide much more for your money - but if you do stay here its OK [and cheaper]

Reviews.Title: “"Minimalist" vs Barren, Depressing and Cheap”
Reviews.Author: IxtapaBound
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot. to NYC every week. Tried the Flatotel because of location the the promise of a "Minimalist" decor. Don't know about you - I want clean and simple when I stay on a hotel. On checking was "upgraded" to a one bedroom suite on the top floor. It turns out this was the only room on the top floor - just my room and the gym. The room was enormous and sparsely furnished. Some of the furnishings were fine - many others looked like they were storing their group function crap in the room - folding chairs, chipped tables, etc. It was pretty depressing. Sort of like a BIG dorm room with 1-2 nice pieces of furniture. Broken plugs and AC that wouldn't turn off in the living room. No minibar. Inconsistent room service (bread, no bitter) or no bread - but butter. Basically pretty half assed for hotels in this price range. I'd look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it! Service was exceptional :) we...”
Reviews.Author: Alih80
Reviews.Content: Loved it! Service was exceptional :) we arrived extremely early the day of our check in and they had a room for us five hours before out checkin time! Also it was my boyfriends birthday, so they gave us a corner room on the 25th floor with two great views! The building is a little bit older than some but the decor and cleanliness makes up for it. The staff was so helpful and generous with us. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Generally a good hotel; sometimes has issues”
Reviews.Author: bppotter
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here numerous times on business travel. Generally, the rooms are larger (by NYC standards) and clean. The location is good. I wish they had more staff to help with luggage and check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel and perfect location!”
Reviews.Author: jennyreese
Reviews.Content: all these people with complaints are prima donnas or babies. this was our first trip to nyc...my boyfriend and i stayed here, and it was great. they upgraded us as soon as we arrived (it was my bday) and were extremely helpful with everything. hotel bar was packed and cool, with great service. close to subway, times square clubs, and central park. we would definitely stay here again. it's not the freaking ritz carlton, but perfect for couples traveling wanting a nice place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: -Shedeevil- Posted by an Apollo traveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed in New York in the easter time 2010 for one week. Flatotel seemed like a good option when I searched for hotels online. I wasn't dissapointed. The hotel was centrally located on the 52nd street. Walking distance to times square and rockefeller center. Cool furniture in the reception area. A concierge available, he helped us to book a helicopter tour. Available fitness center, I didnt have the time to try it. Free WIFI in the reception and restaurant area. The rooms was BIG! Two baths. Huge bed. No minibar. A small flat screen TV. Not a great view but OK. The airconditioner was a bit old. The breakfast was OK, but not outstanding. Mostly we ate omelette. The waiter mixed up our orders a couple of times, but he was smiling and service-friendly - so it was forgiven. Good value for the price all in all!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Disappointing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chrystal1207
Reviews.Content: The Flatotel is in a great Midtown location. Within walking distance of Times Square and 5th Ave. Although, the rooms are very disappointing. The room is clean, aside from the carpets they could use a good scrubbing. The furniture is much older than shown in the pictures. The hotel only offers 2 elevators, and it is a bit of a wait to use one. The staff was very friendly and accomodating. I would not rate this as a 4 star hotel as professed. More like a 3 star. I had gotten a special and paid approximately $180 per night. Prices have now increase to $300 on most websites, I would not pay this. As a bonus.. we did get to see Americas Next Top Model filming in the lobby. So, the penthouse suites are remodeled as seen on tv.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Han-vic
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel quite late after a long flight from the uk. As we checked in, we got great news that we had been upgraded to a 2 bed suite (all other rooms were occupied). All staff were very friendly and always willing to help! The hotel is is a great location, short walk up to central park or down to times square. Really easy to get around new york due to the subway, which is $2.25 per journey. Aircon was noisy but the room was ice cold!! Room was huge and clean. Would recommend it :)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location! Huge rooms!”
Reviews.Author: fried_burger
Reviews.Content: Pros: - excellent location in the theatre district close to Central Park, Times Sqr, subway stations and bus stops - very large rooms, I had a room on the 16th floor with a small kitchen, separate toilet and showers - pretty quiet - I booked the room through Quikbook for 149 USD plus taxes etc. pretty good rate I thought Cons: - the air-con unit was extremely loud, but all's ok with ear plugs! - TV's a bit old but that's ok - gym's on the roof, can get pretty hot, it's pretty small and the machines are pretty old

Reviews.Title: “A luxurious hotel in an amazing location !”
Reviews.Author: dh33
Reviews.Content: Flatotel is an elegant boutique hotel with a chic vibe and is perfectly located on fifth avenue. The rooms are spacious and comfortable but still feel trendy and have a great city view. The resteraunt was fab but we only dined her once. We were sightseeing most of the time and we usually ate out. The staff were excellent and everything was on hand. I would reccomend this hotel as a great location for a city break as the bright lights of times square are just around the corner.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms large for NY and great location, but the staff didn't seem particularly friendly”
Reviews.Author: acass1
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights in August, and the location is fantastic for getting around - easy walking distance to Times Square and central for hopping on the subway or a bus. The rooms are large for New York, clean and well decorated. The lobby is stylish (if a little dark!). Unfortunately the staff didn't seem particularly friendly or helpful, which let the hotel down a little. Overall the Flatotel isn't hugely luxurious but does the job and is reasonably priced, and is excellently placed for access to central Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “My first hotel by myself and loved it!”
Reviews.Author: JakyD
Reviews.Content: I was surprised at how many bad comments there were about the flat hotels since I basically went there and had a blast! It was my first time in hotel by myself and it was quite lovely. I was quite satisfied with my room although it wasn't perfectly clean ( a few stains here and there.. ) But overall, maybe the fact that I was by myself lowered my expectations ? Anyway, I felt welcomed the minute I passed through the front door and it all went well from then on ! Overall, wasn't my perfect stay but satisfied enough to recommend it to my friends and family!

Reviews.Title: “best hotel stay ever !”
Reviews.Author: PAPAGRANDE911
Reviews.Content: I stay at flatotel with my friends and i must say it was the best experience I had. The staff is very courtious and helpful. The rooms are very clean and well maintained. I like that t the hotel is located in the heart of nyc near all the broadway shows,restaurants and stores.

Reviews.Title: “One Of The Best Hotel's In New York”
Reviews.Author: ttaylornyc01
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent our 1 year anniversary in New York. From the minute we stepped into to Flatotel we were treated like royalty. The room was beautiful with a private balcony. When we walked into the room there was a bottle of wine in the room as a anniversary gift. We felt very special and will definitely be staying there whenever we're in New York.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Cryskimore
Reviews.Content: This has to be one of the most luxurious hotels I have ever stayed in. The service is out of this world, and the location is great. I would recommend this hotel to â€œTHE WORLDâ€� â€¦ Enjoy your stay, because I did. Cheers, CG

Reviews.Title: “Good Value-Great Location”
Reviews.Author: virginian9
Reviews.Content: Booked a two night stay as a "secret hotel" on Quikbook for Memorial Day weekend. Great rate of $189 per night for queen size non-smoking room. Arrived at the hotel early (10:00 AM) and Jenny at reception checked us right in. The room was ready. Room was huge by NYC standards. Typical desk, chair, extra easy chair, good bed. Small closet, but we appreciated the fridge and counterspace. Bathroom is OK...nice amenities, plenty of towels. Room was clean and comfy. It did have a tired/worn feeling. Mirror standing along the hall, rather than hung on the wall, laminate missing from end tables. Tears in the carpet. Just needs a good handyman to fix things up...but for NYC, amazing location and price. Would recommend this hotel without hesitation. Didn't eat at the restaurant. Didn't have any problems with elevators as other reviewers . Hotel stored our bags prior to our departure so we could explore the City for an extra day. All in all a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Position but needs some Modernising”
Reviews.Author: OZinNYC
Reviews.Content: After staying in some quite modern Hotels in Sydney and Bangkok it came as a bit of a shock when we first walked into our room at the Flatotel. There was nothing overly wrong with the room, it just came across as being shall we say "well worn like a pair of old slippers", very clean and tidy, but nothing seemed to have been updated for a number of years. The TV was an old CRT on a pole, there was no DVD player, and the air condtioner stuck below the window was old and noisy. On the plus side the bed was king size and quite comfortable, and the bathroom very large with excellent water pressure and temperature. As I said, it was very clean and well presented, but no match for the newer Hotels seen in other cities. The best thing about this Hotel is its position, within walking distance of just about any Manhattan Icon, and very handy to the Subway. I would recommend this Hotel to a friend, but mainly for its position and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location but not family oriented”
Reviews.Author: marenaind
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our son, daughter in law and two grandsons age 7 and 9yrs old. Althought the hotel had an excellent location, it was very overpriced for what you received. First the rooms, although clean feel like a dorm room. No bells or whistlles. The boys wanted to use the pool (across the street at a hotel participating facility) but they don't allow children under the age of 14 even if accompanied by a parent. The lobby is very dark, dimly lit and feels more like a bar lounge than a hotel lobby. The staff did give us good information regarding restaurants, etc but the concierge was not equipped to deal with obtaining tickets to shows, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Huge Room & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Lifesshortliveitup
Reviews.Content: The room was exceptionally spacious with a small kitchenette and huge bathroom. The floor looked dirty but housekeeping came immediately and re-mopped the floor and it turned out to be maks that needed a scubbing brush/scourer to remove, otherwise clean and plenty of room on the vanity for toiletries. The bed was very comfortable although my husband bumped his knee on the wooden base. New curtains should be on their list of up-grades together with flat screen TV's. The area around the elevators in the lobby needs painting and they need to get rid of the ugly fake flowers. We didn't spend any time in the dark lobby and being in New York, did not spend much time in our room but when there it was comfortable and roomy. The location of Flatotel is excellent, close to subway and theatre district. I would definitely stay there again. The front desk staff were efficient and pleasant. Our room was cleaned daily and overall we had a good experience at the Flatotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Dimi77
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Flatotel started a bit rough, but our luck turned around really quick. Let me explain. When we got to the hotel they were overbooked, so we had to go to another hotel for 2 days and then return on the third day. At first I was pissed, because It took us 2 weeks to find a hotel that me and my wife were happy with (location, space etc.) So to have to go to a hotel that we have done no research on was very upsetting. But the Flatotel really helped out the situation by refunding us 2 nights, paying for our cab ride to the other hotel and back. Here is where things got really awesome for us. When we got back to the hotel on the third day they decided to upgrade us to the 44th floor tower suite for the inconvenience! This was an insane 1200 something Square foot room, with 2 bathrooms, living room, dining room, kitchen, a balcony that we had to sign a waver in order for them to unlock the door due to the fact that we were on the top floor, rooms with floor to ceiling windows all around, from our room we could see the east, west, south, and north of Manhattan, INSANE! I am sure we probably got that room because there was nothing else available when we got back, but I did not care at that point we got a sweet $600 a night room for 2 1/2 days! Thanks Flatotel, and we will be staying there again for sure, upgrades or not. Their rooms are huge for NY standards and the location cant be beat!!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Do not be fooled by their website!”
Reviews.Author: Gourmet2020
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights. We booked an oversized room. It had indeed 450SF but no furniture! No table, no chairs. Just an old sofa and a desk. Barely something to put your stuff on. We had to squeeze our toiletries on the small artificial marble shelf surrounding the sink. The sink was clogged the entire time. The bathhroom was dirty at our arrival. We complained and they really sent someone to have it cleaned. Still, there was dust everywhere. Do not go if you have allergies! The room did not have enough lighting. Do not book a room if you are depressed! An old CRT-TV was mounted to a pole in the corner. Attached was a VCR (Yes, a VCR - not a DVD player. Welcome to the 20th century). The bucket of ice we ordered at arrival was never delivered. In general: The bathroom was tiled with very cheap tiles, the upper part of the walls were painted in dark gray. The room was more like in a two star hotel in Rumania: Dark, dust everywhere, outdated! I assume they did not do any renovations in the last 30 years. New York is a great destination. Me and my wife go twice a year. But in this hotel never again!

Reviews.Title: “Matches Manhattan in everything”
Reviews.Author: jakubik
Reviews.Content: Just ok. This hotel matches Manhattan- it is a tall building, little bit tired, next to other tall buildings, smells like other in this area. If do not expect much but want to say in a standard conditions (standard as for Manhattan) in the center, but in a small street this is a good choice. Nothing luxurious, just standard. The largest disappointment was lack of free internet, and this paid available by a cable. I traveled across US and this was the only place I could not use internet- terrible.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and great value”
Reviews.Author: Marciamc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is centrally located, perfect for theatre visits and a quick walk home. Concierge is very knowledgeable and helpful, staff friendly, free internet. Room was spacious, stylish and clean. Only thing that needs improvement - slow lifts. Had a great time, and would go back rather than try anything else at this price.

Reviews.Title: “Careful”
Reviews.Author: Michael0249
Reviews.Content: I booked a suite here, and the reviews are right. The staff is terrible (Carlos the manager I dealt with was VERY helpful, professional and accommodating, but I can't say the same for his front desk staff). I had booked two rooms, a standard and suite. When I arrived at 7pm after flying cross country, they said my suite was not available and that they were going to upgrade me to a better room. Hardly. When they showed me this "upgrade" I quickly declined. The hallways once stepping off the elevator are narrow and dirty, the rooms are in poor condition, the kitchens have not been remodeled in 15-20yrs. The bedroom is partitioned from the living area with glass and curtains, and the furniture and amenities were sparse at best. For what I was paying I went over to the Waldorf Astoria and got the quality and service I wanted. (I actually got upgraded to the biggest suite at the Waldorf, but thats a whole different story).

Reviews.Title: “Not good for business travel...”
Reviews.Author: qorvis
Reviews.Content: I've been booked at the Flatotel three times, and each experience was bad. But my latest visit was the worst. The door handle didn't work, and I couldn't get in my room. I went to the front desk and asked to have a maintenance person fix it. I was told to "pull up real hard then pull down." I told the guy at the front desk a better option would be to send a maintenance person with me so that I didn't have to take the time to go downstairs again. He rolled his eyes at me, told me the problem was just normal wear and tear and asked a bellhop to accompany me. The bellhop struggled with the door, and finally opened it by pushing his body against it. He apologized profusely. The television and remote control must be 15 years old. The remote requires programming each time the TV is turned off. Not a deal breaker, but very annoying. The wood blinds in the bathroom don't close. When I arrived, a window had been left open and was stuck, requiring a maintenance worker to jimmy it shut. Don't bother ordering room service before 7 am - the chef doesn't come to work until 7. I hope my company doesn't book me here again. It's always been a frustrating experience. I travel a lot, and I've never had as frustrating an experience as I've had at Flatotel.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location”
Reviews.Author: Movingalong50
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 6 nights arranged by family member with local knowledge. The hotel is all about location to all the necessary "must see's" in NY. A short walk to 42nd St, Times Square, Rockerfeller building, 5th Ave shops, Central Park, theatres, restaurants & a cab/train/bus to the Statue & WTC memorial site. The hotel room on L39 was good but the kitchen was not provided with enough utensils to really make a decent meal. No toaster, oven trays, one saucepan but we did eat out every night anyway. The room was serviced each day without any issues, bed was very firm, heating/cooling unit was a bit old & noisy but it worked. Paid $320 AUD/night which was nearly the same as San Fran Westin St Francis, both hotels in the middle of the cities. Like: location Dislike: slow lifts, kitchen

Reviews.Title: “Great location - really good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Gunner92
Reviews.Content: Really liked this hotel and would not hesitate to stay again. The rooms are big and clean, plus you get a quiet nights sleep even though it is centrally located. Here is a list of the things that were important to me : - 15min walk to Central Park, 10min walk to Times Square, 5min walk to Rockefeller Centre, 5min walk to 5th Avenue, 20min walk to Grand Central, 20min walk to Empire State Building. Subway very nearby. - CD player and TV with a good choice of channels. - two hob cooker, with fridge. - free internet access in their 'Business Centre'. - seperate bathroom and toilet. - free (micro) copy of Time Out in the foyer. There is room service for the food, but I thought the prices were a bit high. Plenty of deli's nearby, particularly heading west past 6th Avenue (Digbys was my favourite). Despite a couple of isolated occasions, staff are generally friendly and helpful. We were on the 18th floor and the lifts could be a bit infrequent, but not a major hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: AleSPBrazil
Reviews.Content: I knew Flatotel in 2006 when I stayed with my family. I loved it. Friendly staff, near everything I need. But some years later, things got really worse and getting worse and worse each time I was there. I stayed there 3 times last year only because the location, which is great, but now I had enough. The hotel is gross. Service room poor. Air conditioner doen't works, curtains falling, things broken, dirty rooms. And the security....tragic. Only the concierge is OK. The housekeeping service is awfull, all building needs a renovation right away! The worse part happened last time: I had my notebook stolen INSIDE MY ROOM. And guess what? The management didn't do ANYTHING to make me feel better. So, my last vacations days were talking to police and going to precint. The hotel security treated me really bad, didn't help me in anything and the management didn't care about the episode. Then I realized that they don't have cameras on the floors and don't protect the guests. Some weeks ago, the concierge informed me that my computer was founded, but until now, almost 3 weeks, they didn't take any providence to send it me back. I had to hire a lawyer to help me. You better do invest in a quality hotel. With the same price or less you can get anything much better and be safe!

Reviews.Title: “Just an awful experience.”
Reviews.Author: sofien76
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what they're trying to do with this place, but it's not working. *The showers are death traps. *Good luck getting hot water to your shower *The staff cleaned my room even when I had the DO NOT DISTURB sign on my door *I put my breakfast menu on the door at 9pm one night, only to find it still hanging there at 6am the next morning. Thank goodness I checked because I had a "hunch" the staff might miss it. *The staff seems just plain unhappy to help you. Try making a simple request at the front desk and be ready for a sigh and an eye roll. One of the bellman was super sweet, but literally EVERY other staff member I encountered had attitude. *What ever work they did in the rooms to update the former apartment spaces to "luxury hotel" is just plain shoddy. Peeling paint, cheap fixtures, OLD televisions - just not what I expected when I saw pictures before arriving. *Half the equipment in the gym is broken and the lightest free weight they have is 10 lbs. A couple positives: The location is great. They also have a pretty decent bar scene happening there during happy hour, but that too can be kind of a downer if you're a business traveler just trying to get a quiet drink and a bite to eat. I will NEVER stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: ldthk
Reviews.Content: First important parameter for a hotel in NY is location. Flatotel was perfectly located. Rooms were spacy and clean. The View from the 46th floor was magnificent

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, Spacious Room, Very Crowded”
Reviews.Author: sjc90039
Reviews.Content: I booked Flatotel four nights, but only stayed one, because it was so sweaty and congested. The lobby and elevators can barely accommodate all the guests. When we checked in, the entrance was blocked by a tour bus and the lobby was overflowing with guests lounging around on suitcases. If you want an elevator up to your room, get in line. Having said that, the room was very large, as were the shower room and bathroom. Everything was in great condition, but overall, Flatotel offers a sort of a charmless experience. No wifi in the room, you have to use a cable, then share the signal -- if you're on a Mac. The hotel is located in a very busy section of midtown â€”Â especially frantic during the holidays. Tons of young Europeanguests -- probably looking for a much more aesthetically pleasing experience than they get at Flatotel, which is really bending under the weight of dealing with large volume crowd control. I wouldn't stay there again with family, but I would go for one night on business, if nothing else were available in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Slept on a bed designed in heaven”
Reviews.Author: jigsaw09
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a deluxe queen room with a bed so comfortable I nearly didn't get up to celebrate Christmas Day. Free internet. Great advice from conscierge. Great location close to Central Park, Times Square and Broadway shows. Room service very prompt. Room very spacious for one person and very clean. Bit of traffic noise from street but you expect that in New York City.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed - I will *not* stay at the Flatotel again”
Reviews.Author: TRIP123Usa
Reviews.Content: First, the good points: -- the doorman/bellhop who greeted us upon arrival was very friendly and very helpful -- a great guy who made us feel welcome -- the *second* room we stayed in (after moving from our "luxury suite") was odd, but generally nice, with a recently renovated bathroom and a decent king-sized bed -- the valet who brought our car back around when we checked out was fast and friendly, much appreciated as we were on a tight schedule Now, the bad: -- I called at 4PM the day prior to our arrival to confirm that our 1 BR suite would be ready upon our arrival the next day at 5PM, and I was assured that everything would be in order. When we arrived at 7PM the next day (2 hours later, plenty of time for the room to be ready), it was almost as if we were completely unexpected. It took the front desk clerk - a harried and clearly beleaguered fellow - about 25 minutes to figure out where we would be staying. He repeatedly and frantically radioed for "Maria" to radio back and confirm that the suite was ready, I never heard her call back... not a good sign. Poor Maria. Forty-six floors and she seemed to be the only member of the cleaning staff on duty that evening. -- After lounging in the dark and rather odd lobby for nearly half an hour, we were finally given the key to our 1BR suite. We waited ~10 minutes for an elevator (they have TWO serving forty-six stories) and finally, with great anticipation, set foot in our luxury suite. It was anything but. The carpet was old and dingy, the kitchen was dilapidated (but, admittedly, functional), and the furnishings were odd and worn. The bathrooms were quite nice -- clearly renovated more recently -- but the main living area and kitchen were a throwback to ~1985. We asked whether someone could *please* come vacuum the carpets (they looked like they hadn't been touched in weeks) and were assured that someone would be right up -- but no one ever appeared. Basically, we were given an old 1BR apartment that was about halfway through the renovation process. And the part that wasn't renovated was far, far below par given the "luxury" standing advertised in all of the hotel's marketing. -- After 30 minutes in the suite, we decided to head out for dinner, and I took the opportunity to speak with the front desk staff again on the way out. I requested another room but was told that it was unlikely that they could do anything - they said they would look into it and let me know more when we returned from dinner. Having booked the suite through American Express Travel, I called their Platinum desk and explained the situation. They called and spoke with the manager, and eventually negotiated a renovated King bed room for the second night of our two night stay. I would have preferred to move immediately, but took what I could get. -- After moving to the King room (*NOT* a fully renovated suite, by the way) things got better. The room appeared to be much cleaner, and was on a floor of the hotel that generally appeared to be in much better condition - new carpeting, better lighting, etc. Given that we were moved to a smaller (and less expensive) room, versus the original 1BR suite, I would have expected an offer of at least a partial refund. None was forthcoming, and frankly I was just too tired to argue about it. Bottom line is that I simply would not stay at the Flatotel again, nor would I recommend it. It is a very odd place, one that is clearly still making the transition from apartment building to hotel. The staff and management appear to be hit and miss in their attitude and general professionalism (or lack thereof). When I'm paying ~$1,000 for two nights, I expect more. Next time we will look elsewhere and hopefully will find something more satisfying.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed in better $30.00 Motel 6"s”
Reviews.Author: skelad01
Reviews.Content: OK, you see the pictures, wow you say that really looks beautiful, my wife will love this place... NO WAY!!! The pictures are from a handful of rooms not all!(can you do that?) We booked a Junior Suite, 1st room we had was OK, similar to the pics, but the heating did not work (Winter). 2nd room was a Premium King, very small room on the 10th floor(very noisy in the day time). 3rd room was a Junior Suite, no King bed as advertised, 10year old 20" TV, broken blinds, very old bathroom, no coffee maker but it did have the coffee!! Oh did I mention the noisy people above us! Hey you know what the Sheraton is down the road.. wait, the Hilton's across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Debs7443
Reviews.Content: Room booked with Quickbook.com, excellent location and value for money. Spacious room with all amenities including fridge, microwave, kettle and tea! and much to my partners delight live premier league football! Tip of the day ....... service lift buttons above eye level ... press them and they arrive much quicker! All in all cannot fault any aspect of our stay at the Flatotel!

Reviews.Title: “want to go back now!!!!”
Reviews.Author: loulou3110
Reviews.Content: I had read some of the previous reviews and was not sure what to expect. Flatotel exceeded any expectations!! Clean, Warm, Comfortable, with friendly helpful and VERY courteous Staff. Location is second to none - 6 blocks from Cental Park-6 blocks from Times Square - we were even able to walk to Macys on 34th Street on an energetic day!!. We were lucky enough to be upgraded to a deluxe suite on the 41st floor- the views were breathtaking!! There was always hot water in the power shower and clean fluffy towels in adundance. We had also read about the lift (elevator) issues - we certainly did not encounter ANY problems at all with the lifts (AND the hotel was full, with it being one of the busiest weekends of the year) we had rooms on the 21st, 25th & 41st floors. ALL of our 3 rooms were clean, quite, very modern and comfortable. Just a couple of downsides - on arrival we had to wait for one of our rooms (we had booked 3 in total) - but it was worth it to get an upgrade!! once we got in to our rooms we needed an extra bedsheet and extra duvet - lets face it, this is a HUGE hotel - these were brought up within minutes - excellent service. When we were leaving, we were able to leave our luggage safely in a secure room so we could enjoy our last morning in New York. Overall I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone - we certainly will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Flatotel puts lipstick on the pig”
Reviews.Author: mdwatkin
Reviews.Content: This is a former apartment building which explains the spacious rooms, but it is still under transition to becoming a hotel. They have slapped some paint on and tried to make it look pretty, but underneath its still a very old apartment building in need of lots of renovation. Terrific location also. The other reviews of Flatotel were right on even though there is a mix of good and bad. The good reviews referred to the floors that have been renovated, the bad to those that had not. When we checked in, we got 3901 which was the bad. Chipped paint, wire closet shelves from kmart, a tiny flat screen, tv in bedroom didn't work, and the air was set to cold (in NY, in December) and we couldn't get the heat to come on. Like another reviewer said, the staff was quick to fix what was out of whack. When they fixed the heater, they changed the vents which looked like they hadn't been touched since 1910, and the repair guy was a bit repulsed. After a somewhat miserable night we asked to be moved to another room and they moved us down to 2602. So here's where other reviewers positive comments come in, as this room had been fully refurbished and was in immaculate condition. It was comfortable, clean and spacious, everything was in working order and things for the rest of the stay worked out well. The front desk staff was very snobbish (though professional) for a hotel that has absolutely no reason to be - they aren't the Plaza or the Waldorf by any stretch of the imagination. Other than those folks everyone else was friendly and courteous. If you are looking for a Flat (e.g. Flatotel) then this is a good place to go, but just keep in mind that you need to ask for a newly renovated room or you'll just be stuck in some pigpen of an old apartment.

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: bailliej2
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the reviews I was really worried about what this hotel would be like but I needn't have been. The staff were helpful, the room was huge and extremely clean - there were 4 towels in the bathroom and they were changed as often as we wanted. We left our luggage in the secure room in the reception on the day we were due to depart and the staff even offered to organise a taxi for us. There is free internet access so we could check-in on line for our flight. All in all a good hotel in one of the best locations in town. Watch out for special offers, you can get a great price for this hotel

Reviews.Title: “more than adequate; less than fabulous”
Reviews.Author: get-me-out-of-IN
Reviews.Content: We purchased our room for our sister/cousin getaway on Hotwire, knowing it would be risky trying to get a room with 2 beds but we went for it anyway. Upon learning the hotel name, I called to try to reserve a room with 2 beds and we were unable to, but we were offered a rollaway (for $35/nt). The hotel seemed clean. It was in a great location! There was NO ICE available!! Go figure. But we were there to see the city and spent little time in our room. My sister had been to NYC before and felt that the room was very nice size compared to other places. The rollaway was awful-terribly lumpy, so after 2 nights we complained and asked to a new one and a credit for the first 2 nights which the front desk gladly accomodated. I would stay there again because of the location. Also-I read other reviews about the shower door. It was rather entertaining to shower with 1/2 a shower door. Not sure what is so European about that. I toured Europe a year ago and never saw a shower door like that one. Overall though, if you can get a good rate, it is worth it to stay at Flatotel.

Reviews.Title: “Ask for a corner room and you won't be disappointed”
Reviews.Author: westea103
Reviews.Content: As I was taking a shower tonight, I had a sudden pang: I missed the rainfall shower head at the Flatotel. I usually don't take long showers, but the water pressure was so good, I wanted to stay in there all night. But I didn't. When I read the reviews for this hotel, I had a lot of trepidation staying there, but I had no choice. My company had already booked my room. But I did call ahead of time to request a corner room on a higher floor (middle of 44 floors), having no problems going from a king bed to a queen. And I'm glad I did. It was a HUGE room, with plenty of drawers for storage and appealing modern decor, including a chaise sofa and oversize full-length mirror. Also at the front desk, ask for a cord to connect to the free internet (which was fast enough, definitely not as slow as some reviewers have noted). Overall, I think someone at the hotel must have read these reviews, because it seemed like they corrected nearly everything they could! I enjoyed the 3 nights I stayed there and the location, if you're from out of town or if you have meetings near Times Square, is hard to beat. I read about noise issues: no problems with that. Big room in the corner shielded from any disruptive sounds. I walked into a mini-foyer that had a recessed nook for a desk, comfortable (and adjustable) work chair, fridge (set too cold so my water froze, so adjust that before you put anything in!), mini-microwave and electric tea kettle/hotpot. I read about service issues: no problems with that either. My air conditioning was not working properly, so I called for service and they handled it promptly. And soon, it was working well. I also found the staff very professional and friendly. I read about dingy windows: pretty clear views from what I saw, and quite a panoramic view, though most of it are buildings since we are in New York, and in mid-town. I read about the half-shower door, and yes, that's correct, but if you adjust that wonderful shower head, it won't splatter everywhere. I don't know why they use this design - I hear it's not uncommon in European hotels - but it is annoying. It keeps the water from splashing onto the toilet, but again you have to stand pretty close to the wall to keep the water from getting all over the bathroom. There's a big jacuzzi tub in there, so plenty of space, but I wasn't too keen on taking a bath. Didn't have total confidence in the thoroughness of its cleaning. I just didn't get that sense of spotlessness you might get from other higher end hotels. There was also no moisturizer among the bath items, which is a first for me. But the bathroom did have some perks: great little built-in shelves in the bathroom mirror to get your toiletries out of the way and a comfy robe and slippers were hanging on that glass half-shower door. There were some things the hotel could not do much about: only 2 elevators (be prepared for waits) and furniture and walls that have seen better days. I'd advise keeping the lights on low. Better ambience that way anyhow.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Mid-Town Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: JES226
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 days in NY before a 40th anniversary cruise to New England and Canada. The location is right in the center of mid town Manhattan. Close to Time Square, 30 Rock and lots of very good restaurants. Large spacious king room that was clean and comfortable. A bit pricey but what hotel isn't in Manhattan. The hotel restaurant was only open for breakfast but the food and service were good.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: katew
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Flatotel and had a great time. We stayed in a two-bedroomed suite as there were 5 of us altogether, including my 10 month old daughter. Staff were helpful and attentive and no request seemed a problem for them. Rooms were huge for New York standards, if a little dated. I think we were definitely in one of the un-refurbished suites! But on the whole had everything we needed, not to mention one of the best showers I've ever experienced and a very comfortable bed. Location was fabulous, being just a short 5 minute walk to the centre of Times Square and even closer the Central Park, yet quiet enough to be able to get a good night's sleep. Warning - don't eat breakfast at the hotel as it is vastly overpriced ($18.99 per person not including tax and tip). There is currently no room service available at the hotel, but we found an excellent diner called the Europa Cafe a block away (cross the street and go through the covered walkway and it's on your left) that served a huge selection of breakfasts/meals for all tastes at a very reasonable cost. All in all, a nice hotel but probably will try somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!!”
Reviews.Author: Sherry52
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Flatotel September 17-21, 2009. We found the rooms spacious and clean. The bathrooms looked newly renovated but the showers were made for shorter people. We were within walking distance to many very nice restaurants and to the theater. Time Square and Central Park were a short walk away also. The restaurant was only open for breakfast. We very much enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Made our New York trip the best”
Reviews.Author: Briandd
Reviews.Content: My wife and I found this to be a great value-for-money-hotel. The staff were very good and so helpful - especially at Reception. The location is a short distance to Times Square but just far enough from the crowds. Close to Rockefeller, Central Park and subway stations. For us as tourists to New York it was wonderful base and made the trip really special. Also having a fridge and microwave was just so useful for drinks and snacks

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing, and poorly run”
Reviews.Author: sarahtfla
Reviews.Content: My stay last week at the Flatotel NYC began with me arriving at midnight after a long flight, and after calling in to confirm my room that day. I arrived and was ignored at the front desk for some time, until the front desk person got off the phone. When I told them I am checking in, he walked away and told me the manager would be with me soon. About 5 minutes later, the manager appeared and told me THEY HAD NO ROOM FOR ME! I had a confirmation number, I called to confirm that afternoon even! But they sold my room. They had a room for me at the Courtyard Marriott in Harlem (I was there for work - and our offices are in midtown, so the Flatotel was walking distance.) It was almost too late to be enraged, but I went to the other hotel - they paid for cab fare there and back, and told me that for the next night, i would have an upgraded room. I shudder to think what the regular room looks like, because the upgraded room was bare-bones basic and gross. I spent very little time at the hotel, as I was busy for work, but when I checked out after my first (what would have been second) night stay, I asked the door man to hail me a cab (mind you, I had my luggage with me that no one helped me with) and he told me that I'm better off going to 6th Ave. to find one. WTF?!? All in all, my experience was not great, and when they sent an email for an online survey to be filled out and I clicked the link, it sent me to the wrong web site. It is clear, they don't care about their guests - nor do they have to with their prime midtown location!

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: lcm435
Reviews.Content: stayed here with my wife for our birthday! we share it on the same day and month. when we checked in the staff were polite, helpful, just great! they had over booked but gave us an upgrade. they gave us a suite we had just one other room on our floor. the veiw was amazing... would stay at this hotel again when in NY.........just GREAT

Reviews.Title: “Fool me once but never again...”
Reviews.Author: reyledda
Reviews.Content: I was told that other colleagues on business to NYC stayed here. I usually stay at other boutique hotels - but thought I'd give it a try. Total trash, this hotel. Alarm clock was not working (engineer said he fixed it but it went on in mid-day while I was away and disturbed my neighbors for hours). Internet was spotty. Toilet ran ALL night (they promised to fix but did not.) Safe did not open. Clothesline was broken. You had wires for the TV hanging from the ceiling. At one point, the maid tried to come into my room after just knocking once and knocked the stopper straight into the closet door. UGH! What were my colleagues thinking????

Reviews.Title: “Big, kitchen, but poorly refurbed”
Reviews.Author: TomTN
Reviews.Content: The room was large, big windows, but the refurb was done to 3rd world standards. Misalkignments, holes, big "bumps" in the carpet. The bed was very comfy, with lots of pillows. Great location near Rockerfeller Center. It was fine and clean, but my wife would have been upset. Hotwire called it a 4 star, and that is an outrage. It is OK for a 3, not 3.5.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible!!!!”
Reviews.Author: HamiltonNiceguest
Reviews.Content: Absolute filth and rudeness. Upon check-in (the room we required should have had 2 beds) we were advised the room only had one bed and a sofa..."we should check to see if we got a pull out sofa", is what we were told?? The lobby walls and floors were filthy, the room had a horrible odour, there was grease on the furniture, holes in the ceramic bathtub, a dangling lightbulb, something smeared on the wall...it goes on and on. When we politely complained the general manager was helpful however the front desk agent was terribly rude. I will attach photos....DON'T ever stay at the Flatotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: julie10019
Reviews.Content: Upon checkin the Staff was courteous and helpful! The Concierge was amazing with acquiring our Broadway Show Tickets! The room was spacious, great views!! Excellent for a family traveling to NY!

Reviews.Title: “Not worth staying here if this is your first time visiting NY”
Reviews.Author: anonymous4Chicago
Reviews.Content: I had reserved a deluxe king room which I received accordingly. The initial impression seemed fair, however, upon arriving to the room, we noticed the rooms didn't seem clean and didn't want to even take our shoes off. We also noticed there was a black burn mark in the bathroom tub and the first hallway light didn't even work. When taking a shower, the water splattered all over the bathroom because the glass doesn't extend all the way to the side. There weren't even handtowels provided in the restroom. We also noticed there were 2 different colored tissues in the tissue box provided( beige and white). Everything else in the room seemed adequate, however, it seemed like the windows have never been washed (it was very foggy to look out the window and many stain marks all over the exterior of the window). The walls of our room were so thin we were able to hear the room next to us and their TV late at night, as well as the insulation of the room from the street was terribly ( we were on the 19th floor).

Reviews.Title: “never again!”
Reviews.Author: dkrejser
Reviews.Content: we had booked a 3 room suite which turned out to be a 2 room suite and much smaller than advertised. The bathtub/shower did not work. completely clogged and although we complained at least twice daily they NEVER managed in the 8 days to fix it. The room was dirty with old hair lying in sink, blood on toilet, crumps in kitchen and it remained dirty. We complained a lot and finally they opened up the room next door for us to use as well. However, they later billed us that is they didn't bill us but when we returned home we found out they had charged us for the extra room but as though it was a second suite. We ended up paying for 2 suites. We complained and they just ignored us. We went in to the City to talk to Manager who said they would solve it but they just ignored us. We never signed for them to charge this excess amount and we never agreed to paying for 2 suites we never got. And we certainly would rather have expected a discount for dirty rooms, not functioning bathrooms etc. Also, aircon didn't work. But then again NOTHING worked. The management was as rude and indifferent as the rest of the staff. Finally we had to involve our credit card company and make a case. Luckily, our credit card company sided with us and we got our money back after 6 months, but without interest! Flatotel is run by a bunch of dishonest crooks and the rooms are way smaller than advertised not to mention unliveable disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Big room, but poor quality and ammenities”
Reviews.Author: 1972j
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Flatotel for work in early June 2009. The hotel, while in a good spot in Midtown, needs some upgrading before it is ready for primetime. My room was huge, with a kitchen, separate bedroom, bathroom and a wonderful view. However, the furnitue and fixtures were old, the bathroom was grimy and needed to be cleaned, and a lot of the electronic equipment didn't work. For example, the iron, the phones, and the alarm clock all were broken. In addition, the room had two tvs, but the reception was so poor on both that it wasn't worth turning them on. I wouldn't recommend the Flototel to any traveller unless most of your other options were booked, or you need a lot of space. For the same amount of money in New York there are dozens and dozens of better options. One other complaint, the lobby is very dark and dingy. I should have known when checking in that the stay would be subpar, but I went ahead and tried it anyway. I won't make the same mistake again. (Although, as a caveat, the staff was all very friendly, which I very much appreciated).

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: Scotslass08
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here for 6 nights this May after the hotel was recommended to us. When we entered the lobby area of the hotel I was surprised by how small it was as on previous trips to Manhattan I have been used to more grand lobbys. It was nicely decorated though, very modern but still comfortable. The hotel has a small bar within this area which seemed fairly busy most nights. We got checked in very quick and easily and made our way to the lifts. I was concerned after reading previous reviews that we would be facing long waits during our stay for the lifts, however there was one waiting for us and we found that on most occasions throughout the week we really didn't wait long at all for one to arrive at our floor! Our room was on the 9th floor at the front of the hotel which ment we really had no view at all, unless you like office block windows! I wasn't in New York for the view from a hotel room though so that wasn't an issue to me at all! The room itself was fantastic! We had two huge beds which at the end of a long day were the most comfortable beds I have ever slept in and I loved the crisp white bed linen! It was well equipped with a large fridge, microwave and tea/coffee facilities, desk and wi-fi if you need it. The bathroom had a small tub and a powerfull shower which seemed to have hot water all day, or certainly at the different times of day we used it. The decor made the room fresh and I was so impressed with the maid service and cleanliness of the bedroom and bathroom. There was a electronic safe in the closet and the closet itself had more than enough room for all our clothes and we stored our cases and purchases in here!! I can't comment too much on the staff as we really didn't need their help much apart from at check in/out. I did require a new hairdryer brought to the room one day and it was with me within 10 minutes of my call to reception. The best thing about the hotel has to be it's superb location! Literally around the corner from Radio City and Magnolia bakeries, which bake the yummiest of cakes in the world ever and I have tasted a few!! There is a diner one block away called Lindys which have a very good menu. We ate here on a couple of occasions however it is slightly more expensive. I think this is because they play on having New York's finest cheesecake! Look out for Cosmic Diner though on 52nd @ 8th, it is well worth every penny of its well priced menu! We had our best meals here, the breakfast's are to die for ooohh and the blueberry pie is fabulous!! We booked to see Wicked at the Gershwin whilst planning our trip and luckily Flatotel is only a few blocks away! If you are going to see a show however and are not fussed about what you see I would reccommend you hold off and go to one of the tkts booths on Times Square or at Battery Park. We picked up tickets for Guys and Dolls and Chicago there for less than half the price we would have payed online!! If you are walking around Times Square and are approached by someone selling comedy club tickets, stop and have a listen, seriously! We bought some tickets off a tout for "Comic Strip Live" It's where Chris Rock was discovered and tonnes of other comics and it was one of our best nights on our trip! Well worth the money, I think we paid around $25 each, maybe less and for that we really got to see some amazingly funny acts! The hosts in between the main acts were also hillarious!! Drinks here were a little more expensive and there is a two drink minimum limit per person but you get a show which blows any comedy club in the UK out the water! I would also suggest using the Gray Line hop on hop off tour. You will come across many people as you walk around Manhattan trying to sell you bus tickets, We purchased an all loops tour from the people in the red jackets. I can't remember how much for but included in the cost was the ferry to Liberty and Ellis Island and either the Empire State Building or Top of The Rock admission, as well as a guided bus tour through Uptown, Downtown, Harlem, Brooklyn and a nightime tour also. The tours stop at specific tourist attractions across the island and have local guides who really know there stuff!! Great photo opportunities aswell!! This hotel was by far the best I have stayed in in New York and at the time, was the most reasonably priced. There really are no negative points I can make about Flathotel or the staff. In the future I will be considering this hotel before any others!

Reviews.Title: “I would recommend Flatotel with caveats.”
Reviews.Author: kantabella
Reviews.Content: My review of Flatotel is mixed: It had glorious space with 1500 square feet for a 2 BR suite and 1100 sq. ft for 1 BR suite both with kitchens. That and the great Times Square location on 52nd & 7th Avenue and views from the 37th floor (very quiet) were wonderful but the arrival lounge was dark and unattractive. However, one oven did not work & the microwave sometimes did but mostly did not work. Serviceman could not fix them. Service people did come promptly when called. We never did get the promised complimentary bottled water despite many calls. The Jacuzzi bathtub was dangerous to climb in and out of: nothing to hold onto and the bed foundations had sharp corners. Some blinds were falling down. The prepay price of $310 for 1 BR suite and $510 for 2 BR/2.5 suite was a bargain, however. We were (surprise!) switched from the pre-paid 2 bedroom suite that we had planned on-- upon arrival so it required a little juggling of multi-families but it worked out rather well! We would've appreciated being tipped off or consulted beforehand. I would recommend Flatotel with caveats. I would stay there again but my husband would not --because of appliance malfunctions etc.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary hotel, for for not-so-trendy price!”
Reviews.Author: no1likeval
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews on tripadvisor, before I even booked. I read in one, that Quikbook.com had crazy low prices. So i checked, and TA DA!! I found this fabulously located hotel for only $140/night! That was an unbeatable price, especially for Midtown/Manhattan. So we arrive in Newark, cab fare was around $70 from EWR to Flatotel...was to be expected. Bellmen were very helpful, and knowledgeable of the area. Check-in was easy, however we arrived @ 1p, and our room wouldn't be ready until 4pm. Not a prob, left baggage with bell guy, who reccommended this delicious deli down the street, "Carnegie", for lunch, and did some sightseeing till 4. Room was rrreally big! The Deluxe King had a bedroom 'area' with desk/chair, closet, huge mirror, then kitchenette area, with 2 electric cooking coils, compact fridge and microwave, THEN, separate toilet/sink room, as well as shower/sink room...with a window! I was definitely surprised with the large layout. My brother had a basic Queen room. About 1/2 the size of ours, but still cozy. Pretty much just the Queen bed, desk/chair, restroom... A few weird things i encountered. The walls are paper thin. Walking to our room, we could hear our neighbors' (3 rooms down) tv, and their conversation. Also, didn't seem to be AC in the Hallways. Everytime we walked out of the Elevator, it was really hot/stale. I couldn't wait to run in our room and turn the AC on. Another, there was only 1/2 a shower door. I wish I would have taken a pic...Imagine a normal bathtub with 3 walls, and where the door/shower curtain should be, there is a 2 foot plastic swinging door, that only covers the front half of the tub (where the shower head/faucet is). Water splashed all over the floor everytime we showered, and created a small flood under the sink each time. When room was cleaned, the housekeeper would refill our tissue box, with what seemed to be the leftovers from another almost empty box. I knew because the first few I pulled out were peach, and the rest in the box were white. That kinda grossed me out. Also, we stayed 4 days 3 nights, and didn't get washcloths until day 2. Toiletries aren't fancy...bring your own!! Shampoo, conditioner, body wash gel, and lotion all smelled like pinesol. Seriously, i TRIED to use a few of them, but they all looked like the same product (white cream) that were labeled differently...PINESOL! Other than that =) We thoroughly enjoyed our trip, and this hotel was affordable, in an excellent location, and had comfy large rooms. At least your not paying for any 'extras', when you can bring your own. I would stay here again, definitely. ps. the restaurant was closed, as was room service. but they did served complimentary bagels, tea, coffee each morning.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible security, soiled clothes and missing jewelry!!”
Reviews.Author: radahalaseh
Reviews.Content: The trip was a gift from my boyfriend. It was supposed to be hassle free and romantic. This is not the place. Our stay was fine until we came back to our room after being out all day and my clothes in my suitcase were all wet with a substance that smelled like urine. The next day we were checking out so I left my bags with the valet while I went in town to get something. I did not open my bags until I arrived back in my place and ALL my jewelry was missing. It was really not worth much money, just the sentimental value. I am not saying anyone vandalized or stole, just some odd things happening at that hotel. I called and they refunded me back one night stay and washed my clothes, but the manager denied his staff would do anything like this and did not even begin an investigation until I requested it. I travel a lot, and I like to stay at little boutique hotels. I am telling you, if you want a hassle free stay, stay at the other hotels down the street like the Sheraton. At least you know they have procedures. And by the way, you can not file a police report if you leave the state. I tried.

Reviews.Title: “Flatotel met all my requirements...”
Reviews.Author: flamomuv3
Reviews.Content: My friend & I were travelling to NYC for the More magazine 1/2 Marathon April 26. We arrived Friday evening for a 3 night stay. After reading the mixed reviews, I was on pins & needles that we'd like it because I chose for the both of us. Upon arrival, check-in was a breeze, even though we weren't the only ones arriving at that moment. Within 10 minutes, we had a key and were on our way up to the 23rd floor. One of the reasons I chose Flatotel was because they have a room with 2 double beds. The elevator was a bit slow, but nothing unreasonable. We got to our room, and were delighted. The beds looked comfy. The room was plenty large enough for 2 female friends to share without bumping into each other. The fridge and microwave were nice to have. The window opened, which we liked. Bathroom large and clean. We were directly across from the elevator, which concerned me at first. However, we were never bothered by the dinging of the bell. We heard our neighbor briefly the first night, but no more after that. Front desk staff were extremely helpful whenever we had a question. We had a 5:30 a.m. wakeup call on marathon morning, which came on time. We requested extended checkout, which they easily obliged. Gregory, the concierge, recommended a fantastic day spa for a massage after the marathon (NY Nails & Spa--ask for Tim!). We were able to use the business center to do online checkin for our flights, no fee. Complimentary bagels and coffee each morning--very adequate. The location is probably to best reason to stay there. It's on a quiet street, but only blocks from the lights of Times Square, Broadway shows, restaurants, subway stations, Rockefeller Center, Central Park. Oh my gosh, too much to name. Any cons with our stay? Of course, nothing is perfect. What's with the 1/2 glass door in the shower? It made a terrific mess with the water. However, the shower itself--awesome! No soap dish, as mentioned in another review, and really no soap for hand washing. That glycerine soap is more facial. No guide for television channels. Maid service entered our room while we were showering/dressing on our last morning? When we're due to check out, shouldn't our room be near the end for cleaning? Lighting in the room a bit dark at night, but serviceable. No one was ever at the security key check desk by the elevators. I"ve had this at other hotels, where they were fanatic about checking those keys. We're 2 women travelling alone, and that did concern us. Our overall stay was not blemished by any of the cons. Our stay was eminently enjoyable and we recomment Flatotel to anyone wanting a good location, large room, and comfy bed.

Reviews.Title: “Flatotel- a big mistake”
Reviews.Author: h2a
Reviews.Content: The hotel is old, elevatores do not work, room terrible. Never been there again

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: cas1972
Reviews.Content: Visited years ago and this visit was very different. We remembered an upbeat place with modern hip boutique atmosphere. Loved its location, decor, size, rooms. This visit the hotel felt as if the place was old and unkept while still "trying" to be that cool NYC boutique hotel but missed the mark. We are a mid-thirties couple with a child who prefers smaller boutique hotels over your big brands but this time I would have preferred the Marriott PROS...location is excellent in the midst of midtown and steps to Rockefeller Center, Times Square and Central Park. Only other pro is size of rooms...very big and they do have a modern decor (a little too much "less is more" though...there is almost nothing that it appeared to be let go, not cool). CONS...run down over the years, somewhat dirty (they were spraying Lysol everywhere when we arrived and it reaked and rooms/elevators just felt fine nothing specially attended to), no amenities (restaurant and room service are closed for some reason and we were never made aware), customer service (no one greeted us and the reception area was dark and unlit, reception had no clue of a room change, they just seemed to do their job), manager tried bait & switch (see below) So we requested early check in and was so "graciously" given it because they were able to give us a different room that was immediately open and because obviously no one else would have wanted it. Being pregnant and with a 4 year old we were very happy...until we got there. The room they so graciously gave us was, yes, huge BUT it looked like an old efficiency apartment with a new bed thrown in it. It was unkept, reaked of lysol, dirty stained rug, had an old disgusting kitchen, outdated bathroom, and the hallways to get to it looked like rent by the hour rooms. If I had never been to the hotel before and not known what the newer floors looked like I would have demanded my money back and went elsewhere. We were switched back to our original room and the room was fine but our overall experience left a lot to be desired. We got a low rate so I can't complain but would never pay full price or really even go back. Oh and on a Sunday morning when all 40something floors are trying to leave there were two small working elevators and you had to wait at least 10-15 minutes if you could even get in an elevator. My husband ended up walking down 9 flights with our suitcase because he had waited 20 minutes and still couldn't hitch an elevator ride. All the people who had gone to the lobby to get their "complimentary" breakfast were stuck waiting forever with coffee and bagels in hand trying to get back to their rooms. My expectations were so good after having been there years ago and its obvious that it has been let go. It was fine for one night but if you appreciate the hotel experience this one is lacking. We felt like we rented a decent room somewhere not that we had stayed at a comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious but ill-kept”
Reviews.Author: libraryellen
Reviews.Content: On first glance, I thought Flatotel was going to be my sweetheart hotel in NYC.The front desk staff was efficient and helpful, the location was unbeatable and the rooms were spacious. There was even a jacuzzi! However, the jets don't appear to have worked for many a year and have unpleasant black mildew stains surrounding them. The rooms are dusty, the bed is hard and they do not have wi-fi. The large (six feet high?) mirror is merely leaning against the wall and presenting a hazard to anyone with clumsy tendencies as my stubbed toes can attest. The mini-fridge is a plus but all in all, the Flatotel leaves me flat.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasent surprise”
Reviews.Author: arrobo
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very good location, close to the park, times sq. and 5th ave. The staff is very helpful and friendly. The bar has good music and our corner room was very trendy, comfortable and clean. We had continental breakfast which was OK and actually had dinner at their restaurant once and enjoyed the food. We loved Flatotel and would love to stay there again for our next time in town.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent. Value for Money. Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: SweetEmma
Reviews.Content: We took their Wicked Package. Fantastic deal. Our seats were center orchestra. Free Parking. Room was comfortable. Great location. Staff very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “I will definitely return for the true NY experience!”
Reviews.Author: AlbertLongIsland
Reviews.Content: great location to theater, restaurants and great shopping, not to mention the excitement of Rockefeller Center. Staff was friendly and helpful for all our needs and whims. will definitely return for business with some fun added to our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment for the money, I have to say...”
Reviews.Author: sdeterman
Reviews.Content: We planned Christmas and New Year's in New York City with our family, what could be better? Wanting to be near shopping, Rockefeller Center and Times Square on New Year's, we also had the challenge of finding a bigger space for a family of four. After some research, Flatotel arrived at the top of our list for location and that they had a larger suite with a kitchen that could accomodate us. We booked our trip, eventhough the price seemed rather high-but hoped it'd be worth it. Let me say that the lobby is great, although small...however the elevators seem to have trouble accomodating the number of people that use them. The room was fair in appearance and cleanliness, but there were several days that we requested maid service more than once, and never got it. On one particular occasion, we had not left the room as of about 11 am, my daughter was still alseep and I was in the bathroom getting dressed, when there was a knock at the bathroom door. I assumed it was my daughter waking up and opened it only to find the maid staring at me. I must've looked rather shocked by her appearance in our room as she insisted that I tell her when I would be out so she could clean! I was infuriated! I didn't know maids can enter a room and see people there, only to knock on the door when they're in the bathroom getting dressed! There was another incident with another one of the staff that I will not go into detail, but they actually threw a pen when they got upset with our conversation. Not professional, to say the least. While I will say it is centally located, and the larger room with a kitchen is not easy to find, unless we were desperate, we would not return to this hotel. Our experience in New York is that good service is easy to find...just not here, I'm sorry to say.

Reviews.Title: “Bedbugs, doctor verified, bad customer service.”
Reviews.Author: janels
Reviews.Content: It was a "do it yourself" hotel (not expected in busy downtown Manhattan), in that you had to find a cart and bring up your own luggage. We were with a tradeshow, and this was difficult. Also, we had things delivered to the hotel, tracked them to ensure they arrived, and they couldn't find them for days. Then, the next morning my husband had dozens of bites on his abdomen. We were astonished, and demanded to be put in another room. They would not do so until a doctor verified they were bed bug bites. At our inconvenience, we had to wait for the doctor, who immediately diagnosed them as bedbugs, and then we were allowed to take all the time and trouble to move to another room. This room had problems as well, such as the TV not working properly, but no more bugs. They DID NOT comp the stay! My husband was uncomfortable the entire stay from the dozens of awful bites. DO NOT stay there; the customer service is appalling.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location, excellent service, spotless room”
Reviews.Author: GayTwosome
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week, Jan 17 - 24/09. Booked a Deluxe King on Quick Book for an embarrassingly low rate for mid-town NYC. Arrived at the hotel at 8AM from a red eye flight from Seattle. (Jet Blue great as always..new terminal is fantastic.)Room was ready when we arrived and the front desk was extremely professional and friendly. Likewise with the bellman, very helpful and courteous. There is no grand lobby, just a small reception and concierge area in a space that flows into the hotel bar. There is an office center on the 2nd floor where we printed our return boarding passes for free. Room was roughly 400 sq. ft. Furnishings are stark and modern which is our style. Nothing overstuffed or cluttered. Heat worked fine which was great as it was 06 degrees out and the windows opened if it got too warm. The wired internet was very fast and we had no connection problems for the week with the notebook. The wireless worked fine on our iPhones. The bathroom was huge and spotless. (Note to person who couldn't find a bathroom outlet for a hairdryer. It is inside the built-in shelf in the mirror wall where the complimentary toiletries are stored.Very convenient.) We were close to the elevators so there was a some noise, but nothing unexpected as it is a hotel. Entire stay was great and the service was consistently top notch. The small fridge in the room was very handy. Shopped at the local liquor store for supplies. Several times we ordered ice (no ice machines) and cocktail/wine glasses from room service and they were delivered promptly at no charge and with a smile. Houskeeping somehow managed to clean our room within an hour of the time we hung the tag on the door requesting service yet we never actually saw a housekeeper. Each time we went out and returned the bellmen greeted us like friends and were very efficient the few times we needed a taxi to go to SOHO or the West Village. When we checked out the bellman picked up our bags and stored them quickly and with a smile. I don't recall if there was a charge so if there was it was minimal. The hotel is the perfect location for seeing NYC in any season. Times Square and the theaters and Restaurant Row are just a few blocks to the right. Carnegie Hall is a couple blocks North. Radio City and Rockefeller Center are two blocks East and MOMA just another block of so East. There is a 24hr gourmet cafeteria with an overwhelming selection of quality prepared and cooked to order food on 51st. one block away and reachable though the passageway in the building across the street by Bobby Flay's Bar Americain. Excellent for a quick bite in the morning or a snack to take back to the room late night. We were fortunate enough to be in the city during Restaurant Week which goes for two weeks each winter and summer. Awesome and expensive spots for $25 lunch and $35 dinners. Some favorites were B. Smith (huge portions and fantastic Southern-inspired food and the best service ever), Vong, Asiate, and Murals on 54th. in the Warwick Hotel. Our best tourist experience was the Radio City Music Hall Tour. It was fascinating to see all of the massive Art Deco work up close and behind the scenes. And you meet a costumed Rockette for a chat! The bottom line is The Flatoel deserves at least 3 stars for the quality, location and value. We will definitely stay there again on our next visit to New York.

Reviews.Title: “A+ It's al Business”
Reviews.Author: rbc101
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ideally situated in midtown within walking distance to the east side, Rockefeller Center, Time Square, Central Park and more. I love being able to walk to most of my appointments. The subway is easily accessible at 50th & Broadway or 6th & 57th. The Business Center and WiFi in the room are FREE - virtually unheard of for business travelers at most hotels. Sometimes I get a room with a kitchen and on longer stays I just bring food and beverages in from the market making this a really great value overall. Yes, the elevator can be a bit slow but the location, price and business friendly aspects of the hotel trump elevator speed as far as I'm concerend.

Reviews.Title: “Wosrt hotel! Horrible service!”
Reviews.Author: brighteyesxoox
Reviews.Content: First off we got to the room and the lights didn't work. Then the heat broke twice and the front desk was very rude about it and showed us how to " fix it ourselves". Then we walked walked into the bathroom and the toilet was leaking and the bathroom still had hair and dirt everywhere. Do not stay here we regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: AnnaRioDeJaneiro
Reviews.Content: I spent a week in this hotel and I just loved my stay there. The staff is very kind. The location is great. The room very spacious. I will come back.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Bag!”
Reviews.Author: slugstron
Reviews.Content: As with previous reviews, this hotel is a mixed bag. We went for our honeymoon and couldn't have found a hotel with a better location which was a big plus for us as we spend much of our time on foot finding our own way around. The rooms, like most have said, are large and ours was kept spotless during the 6 days there. We both liked the decor, which is pretty minilimist but wouldn't suit all; the shower above the bath was powerful. The bed was huge and very comfortable. There was a flat screen TV, small fridge, microwave, tea / coffee and iron / board so not much amiss there.
