The only grumbles are you can hear the adjoining rooms more than what you would expect, the lack of sockets near mirrors for hairdriers which Caroline picked up on (females take note!) and the lighting in the room is a bit poor. There are signs of a need for an update but overall no real issues. The hotel let itself down slightly when I rang the day before, explained we were on our honeymoon and asked for a room on a high floor. We were given one on the 19th (out of 48 I think it is) so not great (could have been worse I suppose!) but then my mum rang and left a message at reception for us to say enjoy ourselves etc and it was never passed on which was disappointing. Overall then, a decent choice for location and rooms were decent but not special (Oh lifts were fine too!) but could improve on the personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Average For the Price”
Reviews.Author: jdldore
Reviews.Content: I read the reviews of this hotel after I got back and I think the disconnect is expectations. The hotel has a great location, friendly staff, nice bar, free coffee in the morning, and big rooms, but it also has a slow elevator, uncomfortable bed, fuzzy television reception, thin walls, and minimal decor. The upside is hard to ignore, but so is the downside. If you are paying more than $200 per night (even in New York City), then can probably stay in a nicer room with a similar location. If you pay in the $100-$150 range, however, the positives outweigh the negatives. In any event, just don't expect frills because there really aren't any. One more thing: ignore the photos on the various travel websites and in the magazines. My wife and I had a good laugh over pointing out the many differences between the advertised hotel decoration and the decorations we actually got (one large mirror in the hallway).

Reviews.Title: “Great location to explore New York”
Reviews.Author: Owls1Uk
Reviews.Content: We arrived on Christmas eve and stayed for 4 nights. The staff were friendly and very helpful. We stayed on the 46th floor in a 1 bedroom suite. There was plenty of room for the 4 of us (2 adults and 2 teenagers). The room was very clean and spacious although the fixtures and fittings were a little tired and are ready for some tlc. The only problem we had with the room was that the sink in one of the bathrooms was very slow to drain but this didn't cause us a problem as our room had 2 bathrooms so we just used the other one. We never had a problem waiting for the elevator, on most occasions the elevator was there waiting for us, the longest we had to wait was approx 2 mins. The lobby and bar area was clean although I cant comment on the restaurant or room service as we didn't use these services. The hotel is in a great location, only a 5 min walk to times square, 5th avenue and central park. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and family and would have no problems staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Flatotel - A Flat, and a Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JMC79
Reviews.Content: I also read reviews from people on this hotel before I went and I wasn't worried about the delay for the lifts, but the reports really stuck in my head. I remember thinking the first time I pressed the call buttton 'Ok, let's see how long it takes!' and it was literally seconds - we never waited longer than a normal wait 1-20 seconds for a lift either on the ground floor or the 11th floor. I can't imagine what must have been going on when the other people stayed here for them to comment. Lifts sometimes need repairing which may have been the case thus delaying the lifts slightly but we even rode the service lift when someone who was taking some food up to a guest invited us in. It was quite busy the hotel too... Anyway, my only reservation about this hotel, from a personal point of view, is that everyone is quite rude and not very friendly. Perhaps not rude, but certainly not friendly. The girl in the shop, the porters, the reception desk. Not one hello or good morning which I think is really bad. The location was ideal. Two blocks from 5th Avenue and Times Square and a couple of blocks from Central Park. Though you are in a main touristy area so expect to pay high amounts for food in nearby restaurants/diners. Our room on the 11th floor was fine and large enough with a good easy to use safe, a microwave (did not use) and tea and coffee making facilities. We didn't get robes as advertised but we didn't feel the need to raise this with anyone. In all, it was a successful stay with good sleep and tv worked fine. At the end of the day, we didn't see it too important to have a very, very nice hotel as we were seldom in there.

Reviews.Title: “Dont listen to the bad reviews!”
Reviews.Author: busterg92
Reviews.Content: Ok, firstly this was my first time in NYC, and after reading reviews on this website, my family and I was VERY hesitant about staying here, to the point of wanting to change. However we obviously stayed and we would go back within a heartbeat. Ok, fair enough, it's not as grand and palace like as that of the Marriott hotel in Times Square but it does offer two things, value and space! We had a 1 bedroom apartment, which was big enough for the 4 adults (one was classed a child since he was 16), which is why we could get this â€œfamily apartmentâ€� at a good price. It had a good sized kitchen (which shamefully wasnâ€™t used much due to its prime locations to restaurants and times square), a large living room, which two bed were sent up, since it was only a 1 bedroom, yet there was still plenty of space for watching TV on the flat screen. And the bedroomâ€¦ amazing! The lobby was very sleek and modern, bar was quite expensive so I would try and avoid it where possible. The restaurant was lovely, we had breakfast there, was very nice! And for anyone whoâ€™s first time in New York, go to the Marriot hotelâ€™s â€œthe view restaurantâ€�, you can have a buffet which is very good value or a formal â€œsit-down mealâ€�, which will require reservations. It was an amazing evening, check the website out! Dont hessitate to contact me, if you want to know anything else :)

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & friendly flatotel”
Reviews.Author: RUN42
Reviews.Content: My second stay at the Flatotel [previously Nov 05 - excellent]. I am a regular ING New York City Marathon runner. The accommodations were excellent and exactly as promised. The staff were friendly, courteous & professional in all respects. The Flatotel is convenient to all the excitement of Manhatten. A good value. I plan to stay at the Flatotel on my next visit and I refer my friends & colleagues to stay at the Flatotel.

Reviews.Title: “Flatotel -- bottom of barrel”
Reviews.Author: hylkman56
Reviews.Content: Came in for a two day conference and decided, for convenience, that I would stay there as well. Well, I don't know where to begin. The hotel hallways smell like a cheap motel. NO attention is paid to details -- walls, wood trim are dirty and banged up, elevators are dirty, dented and worn; restrooms are filthy -- toilet paper draped over seat, garbages full, walls are dented and dirty, paper towels are scattered throughout -- and this was at 7:15a before anyone got to use it that day. CHEAP Ironing board was broken and CHEAP Iron ruined my shirt by depositing a red substance on it. There certainly is no money spent on maintenance and upkeep at the Flatotel. I wish I took photos. These same comments were sent to the Flatotel via their feedback form.

Reviews.Title: “Lots of Space”
Reviews.Author: uksunLV
Reviews.Content: We booked the Flatotel for a 5 night stay in a Queen Room and were pleasantly surprised to find that we were allocated an apartment. There was a Lounge, Kitchen, Dining Area, Bedroom, Bathroom, 2nd WC and plenty of wardrobe space. We were on the 38th floor and had no problems with the elevators. Ok, so maybe the rooms could do with a little TLC - nothing major just a facelift and certainly not enough to discourage us, for what we paid and the space we got I am sure it can't be beaten in NYC. Staff were always courteous and the location was excellent particularly for first time visitors.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ladytubedriver
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Flatotel for 4 nights in October 2008. We had a large room on the 22nd floor (there are 46 floors) with a superkingsize bed, a separate toilet and bathroom and even a small kitchen area, with a 2 ring stove, a fridge freezer, a microwave and a kettle. Our room was cleaned daily, towels and toiletries replaced every day, and we had a free copy of USA Today newspaper delivered to our room daily. It's true there are only 2 lifts, but this didn't affect us at all. I guess if you're there on business and everyone is trying to get downstairs all at once, it might be a problem. The staff were all very pleasant, the concierge helped us out when our debit cards were blocked and we were unable to use American ATM's (tip: tell your bank you are going to the USA before you go!), and also searched the web for us for particular shops and sights we wanted to visit. In short, this was a lovely, spacious, clean hotel that we would certainly return to.

Reviews.Title: “It'll do but don't believe everything they say...”
Reviews.Author: Franklioni
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a five night stay at the Flatotel and overall it was satisfactory. We had a 1 bedroom suite on the 44th of 46 floors which was very spacious and had a nice view, especially at night. I must also point out that we had absolutely no wait for the elevators of more than about 1 or 2 minutes during our entire stay at any time of the day or night. However, the claim that the rooms were all newly refurbished is slightly wide of the mark as a lick of paint is not refurbished in my book. As you will see from my pics there were some "issues" with the state of the room which were more of a an annoyance and didn't really detract too much from our stay...even the whirpool bath that was about as powerful as stirring the water with a teaspoon. In summary, certainly no luxury apartment but then again its a prime location for us tourists and enought space to kick back and relax however scruffy, old and damaged the decor!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: sjl115
Reviews.Content: Great location, just away from the noise and madness of Times Sq, but handy for everything else. The hotel staff were friendly and efficient. The rooms were spacious and clean and quiet. Never heard any noise from other rooms. Never had to wait long for the lift and the view from the top floor was amazing. Highly recommended!!!

Reviews.Title: “loved everything about it”
Reviews.Author: MARYINTHEROYALCOUNTY
Reviews.Content: just back three days ago from the big apple and stayed in the flatotel for 6 nights. not a bad thing to say about it except that one of the staff (a guy) tried to screw us to get a taxi to jersey gadens he wanted 300dollars for 6 of us. we went by bus and it cost something like 20dollars for two. Of course that is not the hotels fault he prob thought he wud make a quick buck from the gullable irish (but he was wrong). As for new york Oh my God it was fantastic. Deffo recommend the top of the rock (magic), Ellis island(an eye opener),Jersey gardens(Shopping),empire at night(breath taking), and ground Zero(a stillness and peaceful) and last but not least a horse and carriage in central park(romantic) 6 nights were brilliant would highly recommend that many nights if you cud. so much to see and do. bring plenty of bucks not as cheap as we thought but worth it all the same

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: BabaIfa
Reviews.Content: Security was a joke.... elevators took forever and during my stay had to deal with constant issues with guest getting stuck. Package was lost, by guess who???? Security!!!! Word of advice, get rid of your entire security staff, starting with the security manager and director... and maybe you would have a respectable hotel. Will never return and would advise anyone I know never to stay at the FLATOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “A flat is an apartment”
Reviews.Author: Docski
Reviews.Content: The hotel brochure has to explain, presumably for the sake of Americans, that a flat is what we Europeans (well the English) call an apartment; which is true. We stayed on the 42nd floor of the hotel in a 1 bedroom flat. Good big rooms, nice kitchen - good for coffee and cookies but not for cooking - I suspect all visitors use the deli or eat out; good bed. Daughter slept on sofabed which was fine. One problem - even though we were booked in from the start as 3 people the maids persistently removed and did not replace the bed linen for the sofabed. They very willingly brought more on request, but it was irritating. Insufficient lifts too (elevators!) Good views, and on 42nd floor at least quiet. Good location. We greatly enjoyed our visit.

Reviews.Title: “DUMP! Horrible - do not stay here! You can get better for price!”
Reviews.Author: DinMiami
Reviews.Content: Can you say DUMP? At $280+ a night, you would expect at least the quality and service of a Holiday Inn. I booked 4 nights through American Express for a Deluxe room with a King bed- nonsmoking. One of reasons was the alleged free wifi (which did not exist). I get to the hotel and after checking in, I get to the room which was a Standard Queen Room which smelled like an ashtray and had blood (no joke!) On the bedsheets, among being in disrepair. I call the front desk - they can switch me tomorrow to a king smoking room - and will not give me any credit for the cheaper room.?!? The lobby and public areas were also gross and the walls were paper thin. I call Amex and to make a long story short, Amex finally cancelled my reservation and booked me at the nearest available hotel (The Parker Meridian, which btw was great). Pictures attached. DO NOT STAY HERE!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Great Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: HOUBONN
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Flatotel for a four-day anniversary getaway in August '08. The location was wonderful, an easy walk from all the theaters, times square, Rockerfeller Center, tour bus stops and subway entrances within one block. The staff was very cordial and helpful, and they have the best apples in the Big Apple in a big basket in the lobby for the guests! The rooms are some of the largest rooms we have ever stayed in, the king size bed was wonderful, and the desk chair was a great ergonomic chair that was so comfortable I want one for my desk at home. Overall, we thought it was a great place to stay, and would consider it again as first choice for a return trip.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Room Service”
Reviews.Author: wolfsburg2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Flatotel for 7 nights and 8 days while in NYC on business. Flatotel's location couldn't be better, the heart of midtown Manhatten. 2 blocks from 5th avenue shopping, Radio City, Rockefeller Plaza. Less than 10 blocks from Time Square. This hotel is all abotu location. Central Park, Bryant Park, Broadway theatres, it's all within 5 minutes walk. The hotel itself is nice. Not blow you away RItz Carlton or Bellagio nice, but nice. I was stuck with room service for the trip because fo the way my company was dealign with the trip expenses. This was inconvenient for me, but not through any fault of the hotel. The room service overall is terrific. The menu is very good, response time is fantastic, I don't think I waited over 30 minutes the entire trip. It was of course pricey, but it's room service right? The Bathroom is on the small side but clean. Decorative tilework and all the supplies you need are provided. The room was cleaned and tidied up each day. No complaints about the cleaning staff. The room itself provides a fridge, microwave, coffee pot, tv, internet access, closet etc. All the essentials are there and it's a decent sized space. From what I hear it's huge for NYC, I can't speak to that. The front desk could be a little more professional, they aren't as polished as you'd expect for a $400 a night hotel. They met any requests I had but they didn't have that exceptional customer service attitude you recieve at top tier hotels. More than once I was witness to them custoem rbashing, either on the phone or behind a customers back. No one wants to see that kind of thing. Overall the hotel is rated pretty fairly on the site, 3.5-4* is right on. Anyone who rates it less is probably seriously picky or had a bad experience with a staff member or two.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Flatotel”
Reviews.Author: MBrack
Reviews.Content: Booked a deluxe-King room for three nights through Quikbook.com for $221/night. The Flatotel is elegant and sleekly decorated in a modern way that wouldnâ€™t be exactly my style at home, but thought it looked cool in their hotel. The room was huge by NY standards (easily twice the size of my prior room at the Algonquin). Included was a king-size bed, nice furniture, comfortable bed with good linens, Jacuzzi tub in the bathroom, refrigerator, microwave and electric kettle. The staff were very professional and helpful, even the waiters in the restaurant! (we had some surly servers around town). We asked for a room on the non-street side of the building, so had no view at all but it was absolutely silent. I loved that they served delicious free morning coffee in the lobby and that they actually had half & half for it unlike every other place I went to in NYC. Milk in my coffee makes me grumpy. We had breakfast in the restaurant (Moda) one morning and it was by far the best breakfast we had during our trip. Would have liked to try other meals there but never managed it. My only complaints are regarding the lack of free wireless internet, and some issues with housekeeping (couldnâ€™t get a TV remote that worked, bath towels were torn and the bathrobe we were given was â€œsoiledâ€�. Eeeww.) Also the first night we could get no cold water in the shower or sink. It was too hot to take a shower or bath and we really didnâ€™t want to drink hot water. Improved over the next two days, however that shower was still really too hot. Also worth mentioning is the bathroom door which is made from opaque glass. You can't exactly see through it, but you definitely make out outlines and colors. This didn't matter for my husband and I, but I could see that if it might not be private enough for people traveling with a less "intimate" companion. I highly recommend the Flatotel. The rooms are great, the staff is great and the location is really great.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel, unfriendly staff”
Reviews.Author: traveladvice78
Reviews.Content: Great location. Lovely lobby. Fine rooms. DEEPLY unfriendly staff -- adversarial towards customers without an ounce of friendliness. Beware: internet is "free" but only with a cable -- for which they charge $10! In general, not a gracious place...

Reviews.Title: “Great place bet. Times Sq and Radio City”
Reviews.Author: artsyam
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to stay on 52nd St. Great place but on a quiet street. Near Times Sq. and Radio City. Rooms were large and held 4 adults comfortably. Beds were great and had very nice bed linens. Rooms/hotel were clean. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families with a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: caesargirls
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from staying at the Flatotel in New York. I rated the hotel a 3 due to the need for updates. If it were rated on size and convenience it would have received a 4. We are a family of 5 and always have a difficult time finding hotels that work for us. I would like to preface my great experience with a reality check. While we were very happy with the hotel it is in definite need of an update. Objectively speaking the rooms need an overhaul, ie.) new paint, tile work, cabinets. That being said I have not found anywhere that gave us this room size. We were booked into a 2 bedroom suite, (this was actually a basic room attached to a 1 bedroom suite with full kitchen and 2 bathrooms. The kitchen was handy for keeping snacks, milk, waters on hand for the kids. It was pure pleasure to have two bathrooms. Our nightly rate for the 2 bedroom suite was $500.00 per night. In my opinion it was a good price for the accomodations. I found the staff to be very pleasurable and polite. I had read other reviews so really expected the worst but was pleasantly surprised. I also was worried about the elevators considering reviews I had read but did not find the waiting unbearable. I found the room to be quiet, a/c worked well and shower was hot with good water pressure. Housekeeping also did a great job freshening up our room daily with new towels, shampoo etc. Location was wonderful for midtown Manhattan. Easy walk to Times Square, Central Park and very convenient to subway to go further uptown or downtown. I would definitely stay here again with my family.

Reviews.Title: “flatotel is fabulous”
Reviews.Author: dorisguis
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have just returned from our first visit to New York, it was a holiday to remember and it was made even more so because we stopped at the Flatotel in a Deluxe King room. It was worth every penny to upgrade for a larger room with bath/shower/air con/microwave/fridge....We stopped on the 14th floor and it was quiet and no bother with the elevators. The hotel was ideally located and very central to all the attractions. We booked it through ebookers and I will be using this website again. We paid Â£1500 for 5 nights flying from manchester, what a bargain.....and what alot of shopping bargains we bagged in New York.! (the only little niggle was that we asked for a non-smoking room, which it was, but some of the other guests were smoking in their rooms and you could smell it down the corridor).

Reviews.Title: “Room is Roomy but Service is Lacking”
Reviews.Author: FQIAGM
Reviews.Content: I reserved this hotel for the price and the location, not expecting to be wowed, but at least expecting truth in advertising and relatively pleasant people. Upon arrival I was pleasantly surprised by the GREAT location, well decorated lobby, and courteous front desk agent. The room was spacious although seriously lacking artwork. The bathroom was also a good size, however, the layout underutilized the space. What was rather shocking was the shower curtain or should I say half shower glass door. I have never been in a hotel bathroom that you could not close a shower curtain or shower door to prevent water from spilling all over the floor. Very unusual. What ruined this stay for me, was the rude concierge and a serious issue with false advertisement and the lack of concern expressed by the management. Now I must admit, I do hold hotel personnel to a very high standard, as I am an Assistant General Manager of a four diamond property with a staff that is continuously praised for their customer service efforts, but I never expected to be ignored or to be treated as if asking a concierge a question was an annoyance. On our last evening my husband and I ordered a bottle of wine, the wine special of the month was advertised in the room with a picture of a white wine bottle with short description and a red wine bottle with a short description. Under the description was listed $9 plus an offering of complimentary tastings on Wednesday Nights. Well we ordered the special, 45 minutes later, and after 4 phone calls to inform us they could not find the bottle, wasn't sure what bottle we were talking about, and what the price was, a server knocks with the bottle. We questioned the $9 price on the advertisement and were quickly told, I don't know and handed the bill, which was for $90.12. Because it was almost 2:30 in the morning, we thought we would figure it out at check out. Upon check out, I questioned the cost, showing the agent the advertisement and asking for an adjustment. After about 4, obviously not sincere, apologies she approached the manager to inquire about the bottle. When she returned I was told, "Well that's the way it is, its $9 per glass." Even though the advertisement didn't state that. So I want to know, how do you get 10 glasses of wine out of a bottle to equal a $90 charge? Needless to say, no adjustment was made (except for our extra $10 tip we had added) and we left. As a manager, I find this type of attitude appalling and simply shocking. It was an obvious mistake in printing that they should have adjusted. Other than that, New York was great, the bell staff was wonderful, and I know not to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms for NYC”
Reviews.Author: farulg
Reviews.Content: This hotel was in our corporate hotels list so I stayed there during my last trip to NYC. The location was great, right in midtown within walking distance of pretty much everything. I got in during the week when most of the hotels in midtown were booked solid due to the NY Auto Show and I was happy that the staff were polite and service was good even by New York standards. As people have mentioned already, the rooms are large, almost as large as a typical 1-bedroom apartment in Manhattan. I had no problems with the bed and I had a great view of 6th Ave from the corner room. Only one minor complaint, the elevator seemed overworked during the time I was there. The hotels goes up 40-something floors and the 3 elevators available were not enough.

Reviews.Title: “great location...excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimeyBelfast
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this Hotel from the 23rd to the 28th April 2008.The room was very spacious and the staff were very pleasant and helpful eg:it rained one day and the staff gave us golf umbrellas to use for the day...cool or what? The hotel is pole position on the grid in terms of proximity to the amazing Time Square...10 minutes dander and you are there..a whole new world awaits!eg:a "toys r us"store with a full size ferris wheel in the shop and a full size T/rex?Where else would you get it? If you make a right(I have even picked up the local lingo!)when leaving the Hotel and walk to the end of the block..directly beside Rosy o,Gradys is a fantastic breakfast deli/diner that does breakfast the New York way.."eggs over easy and home fries"..I can still taste it yet.mmmhhhmm! The Hotel was excellent and New York was "awesome"..We are busting to go back and this Hotel will be our base.

Reviews.Title: “Never staying here again”
Reviews.Author: w0rldtraveler2000
Reviews.Content: Absolutely not staying here ever again! The staff at the front desk was rude and didn't care. The girl who checked me in told me not a single room was ready in the entire hotel, but my colleague checked in a minute after me (same room type) and the guy who checked him in, found a room. That lady was so rude and cold. One day-only one elevator worked. It took literally 20 minutes to go from the 17th floor to the 1st-because it stopped at every floor and the elevator was packed. At one point, I decided to walk down 17 flights of stairs with luggage and all. Horrible! For business travelers-The wireless internet is a joke. Way too slow. There are many choices in NYC....don't pick the FLATOTEL!!!

Reviews.Title: “generally positive, but those elevators!”
Reviews.Author: actempe
Reviews.Content: My business contact in NYC chose the hotel for me. The positives have been mentioned before: convenient midtown location, spacious room and bathroom. Other pluses: I found the staff friendly (by NY standards) and helpful. I appreciated the free internet in the business center; the quiet refrigerator and the microwave in my room; the closet safe; and the extremely comfortable desk chair. Others have mentioned the European-style platform beds and found them hard, but my bed was just the right degree of firmness. Problems: The bed has sheets and a heavy comforter, and nothing in between. The comforter was too hot, the sheets alone not enough. I used the bathrobe (which was supposed to be provided, but I had to request it) as a light blanket. The "easy" chair was remarkably uncomfortable. The beautiful full-length mirror hadn't been hung, just leaned against the wall. It was inconvenient having no drawers at the desk or in the bedside tables. The door connecting to the next room let through some loud conversations, but ear plugs kept this from being a problem. Though my room faced 52nd street, I was not bothered by street noise. Worst of all, there are only two functioning elevators in this 45-story building, making it very difficult/time consuming to go down at checkout time. Solution: ride up to the top, then back down. (For comparison, the building I work in has only 6 floors, but 4 elevators.) All in all, it was a satisfactory stay, but I'll stay elsewhere next time I'm in NYC, if the choice is up to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and great room size for Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Eleanor M
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a "girls" shopping trip to New York. This was my fourth visit in 4 years and the Flatotel is a hidden gem right in the heart of the Times Square area. It's on 52nd street and no more than a 10 minute walk to Central Park, 5th Avenue, Broadway Theatres, Rockefeller Plaza and Times Square itself. The hotel describes itself as apartment style and the rooms are modernly furnished (think boutique or upmarket Ikea) and have a kettle, fridge and microwave. The showers are superb, fantastic pressure even on the 27th floor. The bed linen was crisp and the beds were firm and comfortable. The room was serviced daily, with towels changed and coffee supplies topped up. The reception staff were very helpful and there was always someone on the door to open it as we walked in. The reception area is large with designer seating and the bar was always crowded in the evening. Will certainly use this hotel again and recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location”
Reviews.Author: laurencharlotte
Reviews.Content: Located on West 52nd Street between 6th and 7th Avenue, 5 minute walk maybe less to Times Square. It's like your own Manhattan apartment with all kitchen facilities, dining room with table overlooking tall skyscrapers and great view. Holiday was amazing in general but the location is brilliant, Americas Next Top Model contestants stay here when doing shoots. want to know more get in touch

Reviews.Title: “Would definately recommend”
Reviews.Author: Clio30
Reviews.Content: My husband and i stayed in this hotel for a week in December. It was our first time in NYC and we wanted a hotel in a good location with a bit of space to store our purchases. This hotel met those criteria. The hotel has its good and bad points The good - excellent location, clean rooms, free internet access in the business centre, helpful staff - when we arrived we couldn't get the safe to work. I rang reception and someone was with us within 5 minutes to sort it out. The bad - really hard bed and very uncomfortable pillows, not very much natural light - although i'm sure this would be a problem in most high rise hotels in NYC. Another pet hate of mine - interconnecting rooms! Most of the time this didn't bother us but a couple of nights we had very noisy neighbours and we could make out nearly every word of their conversations! In spite of the bad points i would definately recommend this hotel and would stay here again if i'm lucky enough to return to New York.

Reviews.Title: “luxurious”
Reviews.Author: livvys4us
Reviews.Content: Stayed for three nights in what only can be described as a luxurious room. the bed was huge the bathroom was lovely, a very contemporary feel. It has a great restaurant and bar. A very friendly and relaxed feel. It is located perfectly for all the attractions, Times Square, Rockefeller centre, the diamond district! Will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: LessWorkMoreTravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Flaotel for 1 night during the week. The location is prime for midtown, a little over a block to 5th Ave, not far from theatres, about 10 blocks from Grand Central. We chose this hotel for the location and the price. Got a rate of $229 through Hotels.com for a Deluxe Queen, which was the best rate by far that we found for something that wasn't a 1 or 2-star. The room was large for New York and very clean. The bed was hard, as a previous reviewer noted. It's a platform bed. Bath amenities are nice and the bathroom also is a good size. The tub is deep, but there is only 1 door for the shower, so if you are tall or toward the back of the tub, you will get water all over the bathroom. It wasn't broken, that is the way it is designed. Staff were very polite. I think the best thing was that at night, it was very quiet. For the right price and a short stay, it's worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Mumofone1
Reviews.Content: Booked a Queen deluxe and found on arrival that we had been upgraded to King Deluxe - must be the picture on the website. The room was huge and very comfortable - I really wish I could have got the huge bed in my luggage to bring home it was so comfortable. Comp mineral water, biscuits, robes and slippers a real sense of arrival. Great location, great staff happy to provide assistance. I was a bit grumpy about having to pay extra for fries and veg with the meal, but the meal was very good. Would highly recommend you stay at Flatotel, I stayed at The Wellington last year which was good but this is better. VERY VERY GOOD.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay”
Reviews.Author: Adienna
Reviews.Content: Ok, I've never really been bothered to write a review for a hotel before, but I had such an enjoyable experience with this hotel that I just couldn't let the one-star review be the first review that people see for any longer! I'm not discounting that review, nor the reviewer's experience of the hotel - this is just mine. Firstly my other half and I stayed in a renovated double room on the 16th floor which was the biggest room that we have ever stayed in (and especially large for New York, I hear). It was very tidy and had a very clean bathroom with large oval shaped bath. The cleaning staff were very good at keeping it tidy (especially as we generally like to 'spread out' the contents of our suit cases when we arrive anywhere). The hotel staff were polite and courteous with a special nod going to the two concierges who were very knowledgeable and gave us some great tips of how to work New York to our benefit. There was a speedy free internet connection in the business centre that came in very useful for us too. We also ate in the restaurant on Christmas Day which was delicious and plentiful - if not a tad expensive. The only bad points I can really make about the hotel are, firstly, the lifts - it takes ages for one to arrive that is not full! Secondly, there is not much natural light in the room we had. There was adequate lighting in the rooms but no central switchboard so we had to turn on/off seven different lights at a time. Oh, and the reception on the TV was a bit ropey on some channels. I really do consider these three things to be negligible however. The best part about staying at this hotel? Besides the generous space in the rooms, it is the location. You are three blocks north of Times Square and 7 blocks south of Central Park. Plus, there is a subway station about 100 metres away on 53rd st. We have already recommended this hotel to friends and are likely to return should we make it back to New York in the future. I actually started to miss it when looking through other people's candid photos! I hope this review has been helpful.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay in new yorik”
Reviews.Author: tmu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Flatotel from m16 - 18th Dec 2007. The location is fantastic, on 52nd between 6th and 7th. We walked to: Rockerfeller center, Central Park, Grand Central Station, Times square and everything in-between. The room was large, not just by New York standards. Our room was clean and neat. For a stay in New York I thought the location was excellent. The hotel is in very good shape and gives one the feeling of being in a typical European style hotel. Would recommend it. tmuinc@yahoo.com

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else”
Reviews.Content: I travel to NYC each year for Christmas and each time, I try to stay in a different neighborhood. This year was midtown, and the Flatotel is ideally situated for theater, museums, and the park. That's the nicest thing I can think to say about my stay. Here's the rest: 1. When we arrived, the room was not yet ready so we wandered the city, but not before noticing the other four sets of travelers who were in stranded in the lobby waiting for their not-yet-ready rooms. Eventually, the room was readied (two hours after check-in time), but we were so happy to be in NYC, it was no big deal. 2. I pre-paid for a 5-night stay in a queen non-smoking room. As soon as the elevator doors opened on our floor, we were hit with a solid wall of smoke and I knew that we had been given a smoking room. This was further confirmed when we walked into the room and saw the big ashtray on the desk. Duh. I called downstairs and asked to be moved to a non-smoking room (I had a copy of the receipt specifying non-smoking) and was told that there were no non-smoking rooms available for the duration of my stay. I told the employee I would really like them to figure something out and to their credit they called back and offered to move us to an "unrenovated" non-smoking room on a higher floor. They also did kindly let us see the room before we decided whether to move. The new room was as big as an apartment, and did not smell like smoke. We took it. 3. Turns out that the reason the new room did not smell like smoke was that it smelled like cheese. Funky, funky cheese. The smell of fontina cheese was charging up from the kitchen through the elevator shaft. As we rode down elevator from the 32nd floor, we realized that each floor smelled either like smoke or like cheese. Glad we chose cheese. 4. Next day, card key does not work. Go down 32 floors to have it reprogrammed, go back up 32 floors to try again. Card key does not work. Go back down 32 flights, they had programmed it for the old room. Back up. . . etc. 5. Slow elevators. 6. Bizarrely hard bed. Really, really hard. Actually woke up during the night because my arms had fallen asleep at the shoulders. Sore, sore, sore. 7. Weird housekeeping service. They made the bed, but no vacuuming or cleaning the sink, no replacing shampoo, soap, or conditioner. Since two of us were staying there for 5 nights, we ran out. I left a note on day 3 for replacements. 8. Next day, card key does not work. (No, I wasn't keeping it next to my phone or other cards). Go downstairs to have it reprogrammed, am told that the "subway demagnetizes the cardkeys" Okay. Never happened to me in any of my other trips to NYC, but whatever. 9. Next day, card key does not work. Have to remind the desk clerk to program it for more than just that day. Card key works for the duration of the trip, despite many, many trips on subway. 10. The last night at the Flatotel: the mirror that is affixed to the ancient, rotting bathroom door with mini screws from the 1960's finally gives up and crashes onto the bathroom floor, shattering into a billion pieces. Front desk is apologetic and concerned for everyone's well-being, maintenence does a great job with the shop vac of getting everything vacuumed up, manager drops by and offers to move us to a different room (and trade cheese for smoke? no thanks!). 11. Finally make it out of Flatotel. So disastrous that it's comical. Bright spot: some of the staff try really, really hard, especially the young men who deal with the bags. Problem is, they're always trying to play catch-up. Management needs to be more proactive. Great midtown location and new bedspreads may get them in the door, but lack of attention to detail and letting problems slide by won't get anyone to come back. p.s. Whoever did this hotel's website should get some kind of award for special effects or maybe lighting. What's the equivalent of an Academy Award for websites? The Webby? This guy should get one. There was some serious mood lighting and photo retouching going on!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dehbolton
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Flatotel for Christmas, the location and hotel were both excellent. The rooms were large by NY standards and recently refurbished. It is close to all major shopping areas and close to Central Par, Fifth Ave and Times Square. If you want a great restaurant try Rue57 on the corner 57th St and 6th Avenue about 10 minutes from hotel. For the best burger in town try PJ Morans at 48th Street E and 5th

Reviews.Title: “It's a large apartment, not a hotel room!”
Reviews.Author: WKHouston
Reviews.Content: I just stayed in the Flatotel while in NYC for a conference. It was the only hotel that was reviewed "above average" by TripAdvisor members that was under $400. It's on 52st, between 6th and 7th Ave. Great location...near subways and only a few short blocks from Times Square and the Theatre District. The rooms seem like converted apartments. They are large, really large. I would estimate that they are around 1000-1100 square feet of space split between a bedroom, 1 1/2 baths, full kitchen, den/living room, and walk in closet. The room (3402) had some paint chips, dings here and there, the carpet was a little worn, but not too badly. The room could have used some sprucing, however, if you are going to be in NYC for more than a few days, want some extra space to spread out, or have others on the trip with you, this makes a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Hotel in a Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: Stuh01
Reviews.Content: We booked this Hotel Via Ebookers and it was nothing short of excellent. The staff were extremely helpful and the rooms were spacious and had all facilities that you would expect plus much more. We travelled with a 6 month old baby and the in room microwave, fridge and kettle were brilliant for warming food and keeping it fresh. We stayed in a deluxe room and the bed was the most comfortable I have ever stayed in. The Hotel is in a great location and within 5 minuites of Times Square

Reviews.Title: “Great location, big rooms”
Reviews.Author: traveler99SoCal
Reviews.Content: The Flatotel is in a great location below Central Park and between 7 and 5 Avenue. The rooms are large for NY hotels, and nice, but could use some general touching-up. The bathrooms are also large, but could use some more shelves and clothes hooks. We had a room on the 20 floor and had a great view, between the business highrises, of the Time Square tower from which the new years ball drops. The exercise room on the 46 floor has a view of the city that matches any other hotels in the area. But, remember, the Flatotel is a boutique hotel and does not have the amenities you would find at the Sheraton around the corner. For a quick bite in the morning or lunch check out Dukes on the next street below. Also, for a good steak at a reasonable price with a NY atmosphere try Ted's Montana on 52 St. For great NY cheesecake go to Jr's near the Schubert Theater. Overall, we had a great time in NY and loved the convenience and location of the Flatotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fantastic value and comfortable rooms”
Reviews.Author: DraigcochUK
Reviews.Content: As always, I tend to go by the average ratings on Tripadvisor, which means that anything that scores 3 is a good hotel. For everyone who scores it a 4 or higher, there is going to be someone who complains about the bathroom scales not working and scores it a 1. So we chose Flatotel because it currently gets a 3 (which is fine by us) and had a great location at a decent price for the heart of the city. We were not disappointed. On arrival from our Virgin Upper Class flight from UK and a taxi ride from JFK, we were greeted by attentive staff and had room on the 10th floor. It was large for a mid-city room, clean, and had nice furnishings, a fridge, microwave and kettle. The bed was advertised as queen size but actually felt more like a king and we also had a CD player and TV which we didn't watch much of, but it worked fine. The bathroom was spacious and clean, and the shower was great. Maid service was perfect. Absolutely above average in all aspects. During the stay (7 nights) we had no problems with the hotel and used the gym every day (great view on 46th floor) and on one occasion when the heavens opened we paid the $20 each to use the wonderful health club across the street. Some have complained that it was too noisy but we had no problems with that either, so we must have been lucky. The main reason for us to come to New York was not to stay in our room, and the location of Flatotel could not be any better, a few blocks south from Central Park, between 6th and 7th. Walking distance to some great restaurants (including Gordon Ramsay, which is at the London, one block north). After an exhausting but fantastic trip to New York, I would recommend Flatotel for great value, good rooms and location. We didn't see the apartment rooms but I hear they are great for families. To put Flatotel into perspective, think of your average room in a Holiday Inn next to an airport (clean, functional). It's a lot better than that. Then think of 5 star luxury of the Connaught or Claridges in London. Flatotel is not quite as nice. Therefore I'm going to go for a 4 out of 5 (location helps).

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, Large Rooms!”
Reviews.Author: ipolani
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Flatotel several times and will continue to do so, it's one of the greatest hotels in Midtown and definitely my favorite. The rooms are large, not just to NYC standards but in general. Although there is a modern feel to the decor, it still feels "homey" and comfortable. Great for business travelers, generous-sized desk and proper desk chair. The bathrooms are wonderful although different (once I had a large soaking tub and another time, just a shower). I've been in the suites and they are fantastic. Definitely worth the splurge if you need extra space. The restaurant and room service are wonderful. The lobby can get crowded during happy hour since the bar is located there. The only cons I can think of is that the elevators are extremely slow and sometimes customer service (i.e. front desk, housekeeping, etc) can be slow. Still, I highly recommend and I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Dump”
Reviews.Author: Mike_N_Atlanta
Reviews.Content: I don't normally slam a hotel, but this place is a dump. Travelocity has it rated as a 4 star, but its nowhere close to that, and I think that gives alot of false impressions that this might be something of a hidden gem - a nice, comfortable boutique hotel in upper Midtown. That's just wrong. A standard queen bed room here is just above something you might find in a youth hostel. The hotel is in a good location, and the room was a decent size for NYC, with some closet space and even a few drawers, and there were no bed bugs, but the positives end there. First, the room was non smoking but still wreaked of cigarette smoke, which came in through the vent in the bathroom, along with other assorted noises. It was noisy - we could hear everything in the hallway, including normal conversations. The room's door was metallic and didn't shut very well, it rattled every time someone else opened or closed their door. There was a huge gap between the bottom of the door and the floor. The dark, dingy industrial carpet didn't help deaden any sound either. The platform bed/headboard furniture piece was something straight out of the early 80s. The mattress sat directly on top of a large wooden platform, no box spring. At first, I thought the wooden platform might make the mattress feel too firm, but after lying in it for an hour or so, it felt just like a hammock, no support whatsoever. We had very sore backs the next morning. Although the room was a decent size, the huge, old CRT TV took up about 1/4 of the space, and there's no Video On-Demand system. Instead, they have a VCR hooked up to the TV, just in case you brought some video tapes with you I guess. They do have satellite though. Finally, the bathroom was ok, but dark with noise and cigarette odors coming in through the vent. Its easy to disregard the peeling caulk and mold in the corners of a hotel bathroom, but the cigarette stench was hard to get past since the towels stank. But at least it was roomy with hot water. In my opinion, its not worth the $200/night or so they ask for a room, and certainly not a 4-star quality hotel. If you are offered a deal at less than $150 and don't mind an uncomfortable bed for a couple nights, this place will do.

Reviews.Title: “Style over content”
Reviews.Author: Traveller_Ned
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 6 day stay. This hotel has had the designer touch. It looks good in all the promotional material but lacks soul or any sense of excitement. All drab greys and browns. As others have mentioned clearly rooms recently refurbished but treatment is very superficially they havenâ€™t bothered to upgrade or move electrical sockets. So wires for the TV were trailed across the wall. The only way of switching the lights was at the light fitting there was no wall switch this became annoying after a while. The reading light over the bed where too high. Iâ€™m 6â€™3â€� and could only just reach it when sitting in bed. The quality of finish to the refurbished decorations was very poor (Paint splattered where it shouldnâ€™t be, tiles poorly grouted and hinges packed out with clearly visible blocks of plywood and wardrobe doors which were difficult to close). A framed picture or two on the walls would have improved the feel of the room which while adequately sized did no feel particular cosy. There was a couch but it was hard and uncomfortable and you would not have bean able to sit on it and see the TV. Worst of all however was the bed. A rock hard mattress on an unsprung bed base, which despite days of hard core sight seeing to tire us out and the odd relaxing cocktail of the evening still manage to interrupt the sleep of both me and my wife during our stay. We found the lifts slow. Three lifts did not appear adequate for a building of this size I have not reason to fault the service the hotel offered. When we asked for more coat hangers these where promptly provided but we tend to keep out selves to our selves and not demand much of the hotels facilities other than the room. We would however commend the doorman who went to great efforts to find us a cab to JFK during Friday rush hour. Had we not booked the hotel through Expedia and got a good price and the 6th day for free we would have been much more disappointed that we were. This hotel is not worth its rack rate and I would urge anyone to be cautious of it at any price. We will not be booking here again at any price mostly because of the bed.

Reviews.Title: “Location Location Location!”
Reviews.Author: Thefishers
Reviews.Content: Lets start by saying that this is not a totally fair review as the lovely girl on our arrival upgraded us to what can only be described as a mini apartment! We were on a floor that made your ears pop with a view overlooking the back of the Sheraton. The room was Fabulous! Living room, kitchen, hugh fride - with an ice dispenser, 2 bathrooms and we think there was a jacuzzi but we didn't know how it worked! Usual american style e n o r m o u s bed and a couple of tellys. Some really nice little touches, chocolates on the pillow at night, dressing gowns, slippers and lovely toiletries! Most of all it's the location that counts and you'd be hard pressed to find a better one in Manhattan if you want the full Broadway/ Times square experience. Don't bother with the restaurant, not if you're hungry as it's style over substance with a menu you could write on the back of a postage stamp. But why would you bother.....when you're seconds away from the hub of the city. This is a stylish hotel with the trump card of having a location that some of the 5* hotels will be charging double the price for. It was great!

Reviews.Title: “great value unbeatable location”
Reviews.Author: napervilletraveler
Reviews.Content: Booked through quikbook at a rate of 199/249 sept 2-4 labor day... It was a last minute bday getaway for my husband. This location is phenomenal.(two blocks from rockefeller center, 3 block from saks fifth ave, two blocks from times square, 8 blocks from central park) If you don't have a lot of time on your visit, stay here. The rooms are clean and have a contemporary feel. Room service was quick and pretty reasonable in price(10 dollars for a pizza). Concierge was very helpful. The front desk could use a little more improvement. At check in, the young woman seemed a bit annoyed since we arrived at 900am even though we told here we would come back at three or four. Another person was more helpful and preregistered us and gave us our key so we could go straight to our room after 300pm. I would not hesitate to stay here again on our next trip to NYC. Make sure you are booking a new and remodeled room...

Reviews.Title: “Give it a miss”
Reviews.Author: Debzuk2
Reviews.Content: Great location , wonderful staff but room terrible !!! dirty old and run down . we had a 1 bed apartment with kitchen and living area , one bedroon etc , we checked in and then went out to tea and didn't want to return to the hotel it was that bad . give it a miss if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Foonchy
Reviews.Content: Stayed three nights and found it to be a fantastic location. Room was new (ish). Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for NYC”
Reviews.Author: CDOSRUN
Reviews.Content: Pros: Unremodeled suites are enormous compared to most of other NYC hotel rooms and included kitchen, dining area and a balcony. Prices are very competitive. Great location; near central park and Times Square. Staff extremely helpful and responsive. Great for families that need more space. Cons: Unremodeled suite very dated in its looks. Room had some issues (stove, TV, phone) but the staff quickly resolved these. Review: We stayed in an unremodeled room. First, I really appreciate the hotel stating up front which rooms are remodeled and which ones are not. And they also explained to me in advance that the rooms were clean but had a dated look. This proved true. As mentioned above the room was older and had a few issues but I was impressed with the quick response of the hotel staff when we called to report the issues. The hotel staff were all extremely friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is Flat all right”
Reviews.Author: Dusty61
Reviews.Content: I choose flatotel after a extensive seach on the internet. I booked directly with the hotel. I booked a king unremodled room for the tune of $418.00 a night plus tax for two adults. We stayed 3 nights On arrival we received a Queen bed. Furnishing were in poor taste. The bed sat on the floor with no type of headboard. The sofa was uncomfortable, no additional pillows or blankets to use on the couch while watching TV.The hair dryer was broken, it worked but cold air and no buttons to adjust the speed or temp. We did get our room changed the next day with out any problems. The second room also had run down furniture. We got the king bed and another bed in the L.R.Which we didn't need or ask for. Forget watching TV, both TV 's had so much fuzz that you could only listen to it ! We never receied a paper, water was in the refg. only in the first room but not any in the second room. We had to buy any additonal water. The BR would be hot at night unless you had it turned down which would make the LR ice cold. We were only issued two wash clothes for each day per room. Our first room had a robe and house slippers but the second didn't I travel several times a year and this is the first time I never took pictures of the room.We traveled with friends on this trip that stayed in a different hotel. I am so glad they didn't want to come by and look at our place. I was embarrassed for the price we payed for that quality . The hotel sent me a survey once I got home and I explained my dissopointement but I never heard back from them in any way. I dont usually compainl I just never use that service again and I tell my friends. The room was clean . Bad view of the city.The plus was a bath and 1/2, with a great locatin but overall it was FLAT and I will not stay there again. I

Reviews.Title: “Completely Average in Every Way”
Reviews.Author: mollybutterfingers
Reviews.Content: Had a very disappointing stay. Dry cleaning barged in my room in the middle of the day and it wasn't even my dry cleaning. Carpet in the rooms is beat up and old and service was just very inconsistent (my friend received a newspaper in the morning and chocolates at night while I received neither).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location and hotel”
Reviews.Author: logcolb
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms for three nights. Have stayed in probably 20 other hotels in New York and this was the nicest. Rooms were extremely large by New York standards and very nicely furnished, with excellent bedding. Hotel is fairly new and is in excellent condition. The hotel is on 52nd between 6th and 7th, a great location for 5th Avenue, Times Square and Central Park. Staff was excellent to deal with. By all means consider this hotel if you are staying in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Functional, with service problems”
Reviews.Author: mrjerry
Reviews.Content: Selected this hotel because of its proximity to the theater district. Checkd in around 11 p.m. after a tiring 4-hour car ride. The room was stifling because the air conditioner wasn't working. The front desk sent an engineer who was unable to fix it. In addition, the pull-out sofa bed was not made up (as we had ordered), and didn't even have sheets or blankets. Also, the desk lamp didn't work. We requested another room, which they gave us. Much better - at least it was cool. But it wasn't until 1 a.m. that we could go to sleep.The furnishings of both rooms were functional, but minimalist. Do not expect high class decor. For a little more money a traveler could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, poor security”
Reviews.Author: Travelgirl079
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Flatotel for a long weekend visit to NYC at the beginning of June. We arrived Saturday morning, June 9th and planned on leaving our luggage with the front desk until we could check in later in the day, however the person at the front desk said he would check and see if a room was available for us to check in early. We were pleasantly surprised that an early check-in would be accommodated and we went straight to our room. Late Saturday afternoon we arrived in our room after walking around the city to get ready for dinner that evening. There was a letter addressed to a different guest with a box of cookies from Moda. We assumed that since we checked in early the paperwork wasn't checked and we just received another guest's letter and cookies and left it on the table. We went to dinner for the evening and returned around 12:45am. As we approached our room we thought it was strange that we could hear such loud voices that seemed to be coming from our room, but we assumed that maybe the walls were thin and that we were hearing our neighbors. We tried to open the door, but it was latched shut. Strange since neither myself or my friend were in the room. Someone inside our room opened the door and we asked why were they in our room. There were six people in our room sitting on our beds, eating the box of cookies the hotel had left as well as our snacks. They said they thought they were in their room; that they had forgotten their room keys and that the security guard had let them into the room. And they said, "Isn't this room xxx?" and we replied, "No, this is room xxy." They quickly left our room and apologized. I believe it was an honest error on their part, but I don't understand why the security guard who let them in the room didn't check the guest names before letting them into our hotel room. Sunday morning I reported the incident to the front desk and asked the gentleman at the front desk to check that room service or phone calls weren't made since we were not in the room. The gentleman working tried to get the manager so we could let her know what had happened to us but said she had stepped out and he said he would relay the incident to her and that she would contact us. We never received any response from management during or even after our stay. Upon checkout Monday I let the gentleman who we spoke with on Sunday know that the manager had never contacted us and he said the manager was out but asked that we share the incident with his supervisor. She took down my contact details, name, phone number and email address and again told us the manager would be in contact with us. Once I returned home I waited a week for any response from management and then followed up with a phone call and an email. Nearly a month later management has still not contacted us.

Reviews.Title: “Huge and Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: TexasTandE
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay in NYC! I booked this hotel directly for a girls' weekend (3 women) in a 2 bedroom suite. The suite was 1800 square feet, 2 full baths and 1 half bath, a full kitchen, dining room, living room and two large bedrooms each with a comfy king bed. The lobby is small, but very efficient and we liked the staff very much. Everyone was super friendly. When we arrived, our suite did not have a safe. The front desk immediately sent someone to us who installed a safe! Housekeeping was excellent - very clean. Room service was quick and good. We walked to shows (and if you have not seen Spring Awakening - GO!! It was the BEST SHOW EVER!) and restaurants. Perfect location and what a bargain! Our 1800 square feet unrenovated suite was $635 a night!

Reviews.Title: “Not for the disabled”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel18
Reviews.Content: After calling to make sure my room was ready, I arrived with my small working service dog and was greeted at checkin with "no dogs allowed here." I explained that I had informed the hotel that I had a service dog when booking the reservation and offered to show the animals credentials, the front desk person called the manager on duty and security. They refused to look at the papers and the manager said, "you're not blind." I politely explained the nature of my disability paperwork in hand. He would not look at it and said that "this hotel does not permit service dogs." They turned me away and would not listen to reason and would not read my paperwork.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: kellylovesmiami
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip and I must say, I had a wonderful experience. The rooms are very well decorated, very modern, nice toiletries. The staff was very helpful, room service was excellent! It's a in a great location just a walking distance to 5th ave. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the space”
Reviews.Author: alicekLondon
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the large room sizes and was not too worried by the reviews as we had got a very good deal, nearly half of what Expedia were asking for. I had booked a 1 bed apartment for 4 people and was expecting an unrenovated room, I got a partially renovated room and was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The sofabed was not bigger enough for two, but within 10 minutes they brought up a roll away bed. The deco was fine, new carpet and furnishings, bar the curtains and the kitchen, but everything else was great. We were quite demanding asking for additional items for the room and got them promptly without complaint. I didn't find anyone rude or offhand and didn't expereince (which I have in other hotels) long queues of complaining people. My only minor complaint was the shower was a bit low. I would go back in a hearbeat for the price I got - we got the 1 bed for Â£900 - I defy anyone to find a 1 bed apartment in central NY for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: Maracol
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews I was a bit unsure what to expect when I got to New York for the New Year celebrations (I know I'm a little late postng the review!) Got into our room, oh how surprised I was, it was massive, having previously stayed in another hotel 3 years ago this was like a palace - massive lounge, massive bedroom, loads of cupboards space and the bathroom was really nice even had a jacuzzi bath, must of had about 8 towels in the room for 2 of us and a dressing gown, fridge/ freezer . The location was excellent very close to Central Park and Time Square, 5th Avenue, most things really, a very central location. I would definatly stay hear again, the hotel is generally good, you have to bear in mind (which most people don't) that your in New York city and the cost of staying hear is going to be higher than most other European/American city. If you want a 3 star hotel book into here. You get what you pay for. Well worth recommending and a visit!

Reviews.Title: “Big Mistake”
Reviews.Author: richard36
Reviews.Content: The hotel has partially been renovated. They put us in an unrenovated room probably because we booked through Expedia. It was horrible. I cant believe they would put anyone in there. It was late so we didnt change until the next day. Room was much better but the overall service was very mediocre.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but a few problems”
Reviews.Author: ScooterRed71
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights and had a good experience. The location is great and it was easy to get to attractions like MoMA and Fifth Avenue. The hotel is very nice and has a very modern look and feel to it. The staff is helpful but seem to not have the same "can do" attitude you find at larger hotel chains. However behind this pretty "window dressing" were a few problems. The shower made a horrible shaking sound any time you turned the water pressure up. I notified the front desk of this problem and they said engineering would look at it but nothing was fixed. I heard the same noise from surrounding rooms several times during our stay. The elevators were incredibly slow and one even broke down for several hours on Saturday night. And I would not recommend eating at Moda, the restaurant in the lobby. While it may look nice, you would get a much better meal at any of the restaurants located within walking distance of the hotel. Overall, it was a nice hotel but they really need to work on making it a "complete" establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3 Star!!!”
Reviews.Author: RalphyBear
Reviews.Content: After reading mixed reviews I was a bit unsure what to expect when I got to New York. We arrived just after 2:20pm and when we pulled up outside I was very impressed, went inside to be meet by a very nice entrance/sitting area/bar area. There where 2 people on the door, neither of which even offered there service's to open the door or help us with our luggage!! Started checking in, and my first impressions of the staff was that you where putting them out by being there, the woman on the desk was trying to check us in whilst answering numerous phone calls. After checking in we went up to our room, yet again nobody offered a hand with our luggage. Got into our room, oh how surprised I was, it was massive, having previously stayed in another hotel 3 years ago this was like a palace - massive lounge, massive bedroom, loads of cupboards space and the bathroom was really nice even had a jacuzzi bath, must of had about 8 towels in the room for 2 of us and a dressing gown. Fully equiped kitchen with fridge, freezer, washing machine, cooker. One thing we found was that the electrics where a bit dodgy, we used the hair dryer and it tripped the electric out, but when reported on our way out an engineer was sent up straight away to fix it, but generally the plug sockets looked suspect, some switch's weren't much better!!! Location was excellent very close to Central Park and Time Square, 5th Avenue, most things really I would definatly stay hear again, the hotel is generally good, you have to bear in mind(which most people don't) that your in New York city and the cost of staying hear is going to be higher than most other European/American city. If you want a 3 star hotel book into here, if you want a 5 star hotel then book into a 5 star hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel For NYC”
Reviews.Author: JulieMeyer
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for a business trip last October. After having stayed at the Hilton round the corner half a year earlier, I must say that the Flatotel is much better. My room was spacious and clean, although the furniture was a bit dated. Bathroom was big, clean and newly renovated and provided lots of towels and toiletries. Plenty of hot water. The elevators were definitely a bit slow, and the staff lost my luggage when I was checking out and it took them quite a while to find it - although the storage room is really small. They were very apologetic, but couldn't offer me some room were I could open my suitcase to pack all my shopping bags. I had to do it in the (crowded) lobby which I found quite embarrassing. Location is absolutely great, but don't expect any nice views - too many high rises around. I would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great Midtown location.”
Reviews.Author: TMan61
Reviews.Content: Classy and contemporary decor, very clean and an attentive staff. Prices are a bit steep, but not out line for a midtown location. My only complaints are that they don't use fitted bottom sheets on the bed, and the clock radio is very difficult to set alarm time to. I couldn't even figure out how to turn on the radio! Overall, I would return, and would reccomend others to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Always a surprise”
Reviews.Author: Katerina_CA
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel twice in the past 12 months. First in April of 2006 and then again in January of 2007. Here is what happened in April. My assistant booked me into a junior suite. When I checked into my room it looked very small for a suite, however i attributed it to the "New York factor". Upon my return home i checked the hotel's website and realized that they gave me a "superior room" instead. That was really annoying. On the plus side was the convenient location to my meetings, very quick and efficient check in and check out service and great in-room dining. So in January i gave it another try. This time I booked myself into a superior room and made sure that i pointed that out at the check in. Well, this time I received a two bedroom two bath suite (!). I guess the conclusion here is that you never know what you are going to get when you book into Flatotel. So be nice to the front desk person and hope for the best.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: zProsperity
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here on a weekend with friends and I must say for the price we paid, NOT IMPRESSED. The rooms are small (which is the norm for NYC) and dated. I eventually checked out and got a room at the Hilton on 42nd and was pleased with a room with a comparable rate with much more room & service!!! We had to ask for towels & blankets repeatedly. The remote on the TV did not work and it took a few visits from the staff to assist. Pros: - Excellent location in NYC - Conceirge service was excellent Cons: - Slow service from staff - DATED room - overpriced for what you get - staff lost our luggage as we were checking out and it took 30 minutes to find it.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: ehrenseim
Reviews.Content: We liked it. Being from MN, 300+ bucks a night is heavy, but everywhere is at least that out there. The room was big, sheets were clean and comfortable, staff was friendly and helpful. Very modern, sleek look. It really didn't blow our socks off, but that's the only place we've stayed in NY so far. The location really was fantastic though.

Reviews.Title: “Big rooms, convenient location, it works!”
Reviews.Author: roadwarrior30
Reviews.Content: Recommended. This convenient mid-town location is an easy shot to Times Square and 5th Avenue mainstream areas. Check-in was swift and uneventful. The lobby area is smallish and clearly not a hangout. Rooms appeared to be generally large, floors are small with only ~ 10 rooms per floor. My corner room was exceptional in size. Bedding was comfortable and bath area in modern condition and OK illuminated. Considering mid-town location, rooms were fairly quiet (I was on 17), always ask for higher! Nice amentities. Each floor had only a handful of rooms and with 39 floors serviced by only 2 elevators, the wait time to go up/down can be lengthy. General condition of the property was only OK. Some signs of disrepair and various shades of gray in the dÃ©cor didnâ€™t help the atmosphere. Food for our conference and in the restaurants was very good as was the service. All in all â€“ nothing not to recommend, depending upon your lodging price â€“ either an exceptional value or over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, overall a great trip, BUT--a few things you should know.”
Reviews.Author: Tricia6744
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 days in April of 2006 at the Flatotel NY. There were 4 adults and 2 young children in a 2 bedroom suite. As promised (via many phone calls to confirm) I booked, and received a "renovated" 2 bedroom suite in the Flatotel. As I understand, about half of the hotel's suites are renovated, and the other half are what I assume to be the original suites which, if you read all the reviews on this site, are allegedly terrible! Whew! Check in went very smoothly, although they expect FULL payment upon checking in. This was something that I found extremely odd and was a bit apprehensive about, but paid anyway. The initial impression of our suite was not very dramatic. HOWEVER, upon further exploration, it is a great unit. You have to remind yourself that you are in Manhattan. If you want a luxurious, large, flawless suite with a full kitchen--be prepared to pay thousands per night elsewhere. Our suite was a corner unit, facing southwest. The views were great, especially for the kids. The windows were extremely large and run along each wall. The coolest thing about this hotel, was that it was CLEARLY a condominium building that was converted to a hotel/suite hotel. Our suite still had a doorbell! (fun for our toddler). The suite had 1 and a half baths, which was fantastic. The bathrooms are in terrific condition and were very clean. The living room was a bit small, and the furniture was a bit uncomfortable. There was, however, a large flat screen TV on the wall as promised. The beds were great and clean, although it is true that they are modern platform beds which have a base that is bigger than the mattress, so lookout to save your ankles! One of the bedrooms had all glass walls, but, could be completely covered with heavy dark drapes to make the room very private. The kitchen was fully stocked, even with cooking utensils, and came in extremely handy! We ate dinner in our suite each night. I recommend using the Ernst Klein market about 1 block north on 6th ave for food. The rumors about the elevators are true. Sometimes you need to wait a bit for an elevator, but, as someone who lived in a highrise for years, if you pretend you're simply waiting for your elevator in an apartment building it's not bad at all. The hotel is in a FABULOUS location. Very close to Times Square, ten minute walk to Toys R Us and Build A Bear. 5-10 min walk to Central Park and enormous playground. The location and price for a suite was what drew me to the hotel. It's a Manhattan hotel that serves it's purpose with cost for a full suite, service, and location. Don't stay here if you expect or want your hotel to be a central focal point of your vacation (ex: Loews, Hilton Times Square). It provides a peaceful retreat from the city (as if you are returning to your own condo in NY) at the end of the day, and the staff is efficient and curteous but stays out of your way. I will end this lengthy (but I hope helpful review) by saying that the concierge, Gregory, is absolutely wonderful! He made our stay so terrific. Anything you need to know, want, etc, Gregory knows the answer, or knows where to get it. Overall--a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect NY hotel? Not so trendy and rather rude”
Reviews.Author: CobyCat
Reviews.Content: When we walked it the small reception/bar area it looked like a happening and trendy boutique hotel until we realized it was full of guests waiting for their rooms. We arrived early in the day and didn't get our room until 4pm. Oh did I say our room....no it was some other horrible room, not the room we booked months earlier!!!! From the time we arrived and repeatedly checked back, we were told that they "would put a rush on our room" ....some rush...the excuse they had is that the deluxe king rooms are few in number and that the people who are in the rooms already can pay to check out late. Well, it seems they paid to keep our room an extra night. Or (more likely) the rooms were double booked. When I complained, because it was our honeymoon, they offered to stick us in a smoking room. Having severe asthma, this wouldn't have made for a great scenerio. So we got a room that we didn't want, with a small bed and an dreadful view of the delapitated building next door. Also, we could hear everything in the room next to us...and I mean everything. The supposed trendiness or hipness of the hotel left as soon as you got on the evelators, which are very small . The hotel is generally very dark and the hallways are very narrow. The rooms are supposedly bigger than the average NY hotel, but the reservation system is so horrible the larger rooms don't make up for the stress of getting there. And what is with the bathroom/showers? I assume they were attempting a spa look and feel with the open concept showers, but they are a bit aged and entire room looks more like something out of the YMCA. There is no tub so the water goes everywhere which is dangerous. The staff are nothing but rude...and not just to us....we heard them tell one person who was complaining about their room "This is New York, haven't you ever stayed in New York before." The next day they moved our bags in the afternoon without telling us to the room we reserved. Nice, but we were soured by then and the staff were still incredibly rude. They gave no explanation for this. It appears that everyone has to check out by early morning, they clean the rooms, then those who are already checked in get moved aroung to the rooms you had originally reserved, and then at 4pm the newly arrived guest fight over rooms. Horrible system. It just set the tone so nicely for our New York honeymoon and my first time to New York....to the point where I don't feel the need to visit the city or hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Be Persistent!”
Reviews.Author: BrentLoch
Reviews.Content: Booked a room months in advance, the one they showed us was small, dark and one bank of windows faced another building not two feet away. We would have had to have those drapes closed day and night making the room even darker. Bathroom was dirty.
