Called down to the front desk and requested another room, this was the only one available which had two beds they said. I left my friend with our luggage and went down in person to speak to the manager who did find another room with two beds. I demanded to view it which I did and it was far better than the one we were in. The maid was still cleaning it so they said to stay in the first room and they would call. After about a half hour (how long does it take?) I went to the lobby again to check on our new room which happend to be done and they were "just going to call". The new one was ten times better than the one they showed us at first but if I hadn't been persistent in not accepting the crummy one that's where we would have spent four nights. I would not stay here again as there are better hotels in the area with better customer service. I have visited NYC at least 20 times so I am not a newbie.

Reviews.Title: “good experience at Flatotel”
Reviews.Author: WMasstravlers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Flatotel from July 15-19th, a family of five with 3 boys ages 7-16. Yes we were there during the heatwave.We had been planning the trip for NY for a few months but had a difficult time finding a hotel that would allow 3 children in the room with 2 adults, we could not even get connecting rooms anywhere, no one could guarantee they would be connecting until arrival. Well with 3 kids we could not take that chance and of course want to be in same room or connecting, we were willing to spend $$$ but still no luck. Finally I saw the size of rooms(apartments) at Flatotel, and called, as online I could not book for 5 people. They let us book one of their unrenovated suites no problem and rollaway bed at no extra charge.. I had booked Doubletree in Times Square, thank goodness we switched, it was a mob scene in that area.The room was huge!!! With 3 boys, we needed the space to spread out, even tho we were not there alot since we did all of the tourist attractions.First we arrived on Saturday and the place was dead...got into room and ac didnt work, called down to front desk, within 5 minutes someone came up and adjusted..then it was fine for that night. Following 2 nights air didnt seem as cool but hard to tell since weather was 100 degrees out. Yes furniture and curtains etc were outdated, we knew that in advance, but the place was clean...altho no carpet, it had been torn up and had "parquet" floors which made funny sound when walking on it, but it was clean and better for middle son with allergies Our queen size bed was not very comfortable as we are used to staying at a strwood hotel that uses veryyy comfy down featherbeds and pillows..Requested more towels and pillows...all no problem...didnt use room service or restaurant so can not say how that was, altho restaurant never was busy. Area was ok..nothing much around but easy to walk places...On the weekend the bellhops or doorpeople didnt really say much to us, place seems to cater to mon-fri travelers since we were greeted and asked how our stay was on mon and tues. But that kind of thing was really not too important to us...our 2 younger boys kept going into restaurant to grab a couple candies, so one nice lady there got a cup FULL for them to take...that was a very nice touch for the kids. other than that I dont think anyone ever spoke to them, definitely caters more towards business or foreign travelers from what I could see. We did go up to workout "space"...nice view but way too hot in there, at least during that heatwave. All in all it was a good experience, could not get a bigger space in NYC! We later found a better deal online and got the better price thru CSR at $269 per night!not bad for about 1000 sqaure feet! My husband and I are used to paying a much higher price in Nyc for just the 2 of us at one of the W"s, so this was a great deal for us. We were willing to pay at least twice that if a hotel would just guarantee connecting rooms...c'est la vie! We would stay there again , if we have the kids with us....

Reviews.Title: “Dont go there”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: No A/C Holes on my sheets, asked to change them told me they didnthave any more available For the price you expect more. I suggest Holiday Inn Chinatown, small but nice and Hudson very chic!

Reviews.Title: “Giant Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cruck
Reviews.Content: Over the Memorial Day weekend my wife and I took a trip to the City. It was her first trip there and my first time staying in Midtown! The location was great, the rooms were HUGE. We had a kitchen area. My friend who lives in the city said our room was bigger than his two bedroom apartment. However our room was not the most modern. However, they were very clean and the workers were very pleasant. We were located within a two minute walk to the shops on fifth avenue. This was great, because when I was too tired to continue shopping I headed back to the hotel. Within 5-10 minute walk to Times Square, Broadway, Empire State Building, Central Park. We took cabs from the hotel on several occasions and it was never too expensive. To and from Laguardia-$35. To and from Battery Park/ Ground Zero- $11. To and from Greenwich Village $8. Overall i was very impressed with this hotel and look forward to staying their in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Complete Disappointment!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I spent my weekend there and to be honest it was a complete disappointment. The air conditioner was not working, the water is the bathroom was boiling hot it was just a bad experience all together. Not to mention the the white curtains that were yellow with stains and stuff. The lobby is so gloomy as well. Think twice before going there.

Reviews.Title: “Biggest Rooms I have Ever Had in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: FiStew
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at so many NYC hotels now to know that if I see the word "Boutique" in the description I steer well clear as the rooms will be tiny (eg. the Shoreham, the Paramount, the Hudson and so on). The Flatotel is, however, completely different. The rooms are spacious, handy if you are in town for more than a couple of nights. They are nicely decorated, clean and all have a fridge and tea and coffee making facilities. The showers are fantastic, powerful and hot, and if you can get a plug the bath is great too. I was disappointed to see that this time around the toiletries had been changed from Molton Brown, but the new stuff is amazing! Big TV in the room and very importantly they have HBO (for all Brits that means watching movies with no ad breaks!!). I did have a suite once and they are in need of a make over (they need to lose the pale pink leather sofa!!), but the regular rooms are nicely done. The bar is friendly and a place a lone traveller can sit and not be pestered!! As with most NY hotels, breakfast is expensive - head out to a deli or Starbucks its cheaper! Avoid Lindy's for breakfast though, its expensive and not very good, there are better places on 6th if you fancy pancakes or eggs etc. The touristy stuff is all within easy reach on foot, by cab or if you are brave enough the subway! I would stay here every time if budget allowed.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice hotel in the heart of New York”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights in mid June. The staff was very attentive to all our requests. The room was very clean and modern. Lighting in the room could have been a little brighter, but that would be our only gripe. The location was wonderful. We could walk almost everywhere. The open-air bar next to the hotel was very nice on a hot summer day. The staff was well trained and went out of their way to make our visit enjoyable. We were suprised on how quiet our room was. We could not hear any traffic or hall noise while we were in the room. The bed was extremely comfortable. Elevators were clean and very fast. We would stay here again when we visit New York

Reviews.Title: “Cool, modern and a bit aloof-but easy to stay here”
Reviews.Author: Detailsimportant
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for several days in March. Hotel is on a side street, nice and discreet, and lobby is dark and modern with a cool little bar to hang out in. My renovated room was very large and modern, unlike most NYC tiny hotel rooms. That was a big plus. I was on 12th floor and my room did not get a lot of daylight - so it was a bit dark, but no big deal. Bathroom was a good size with counter space to hold make up bath items. Shower was hot, and bath amenities were high end. Plenty of closet space. Concierge - Sergio - easily made a reservation for me at trendy restaurant in town. Hotel is in a great location, and there are coffee shops, delis and nice restaurants all around. Workout room is borderline passing, 1 bike, 2 treads, and weight equip., but you can go for extra $$ to a place down the street if you are athletic purist. Bar downstairs has easygoing crowd, best bar snack mix you have ever had. This place almost has the feel of an apartment residence, you just come and go without much fanfare or attention - people are not falling over themselves to help you but if you need something they will assist. My laundry came a day late, I complained, no one really sorry about it, but that is life in big city. Could easily go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Flatotel”
Reviews.Author: GATravels08
Reviews.Content: I read and re-read the reviews on this site before traveling to New York and they are for the most part, pretty on key. The location is the absolute best part of the Flatotel. Situated between Times Square and Rockefeller, you can't find a better spot. Great bars and restaraunts on the same street. This hotel is very modern, very cold and not quite the 'homey' feel. The reservation clerks were helpful but borderline rude at the same time. Like our party was 'putting them out' to ask a question or suggestion. I did not feel like an appreciated customer at any time. After leaving the Four Seasons the night before, man, what a difference their staff makes. We had four rooms at the Flatotel. Our room was a two bedroom suite with a balcony. Probably the best part of this trip. The balcony, only one of about 3 in the hotel, was a great touch. The beds in each room were stone hard, linens were comfy. Our living area had two of the most uncomfortable chairs, no sofa. For two families, this was painfully inconvenient. The bathrooms were nice and plenty of closet space. The other room was a one BR suite and had much more sofas in a huge great room and accommadted two adults and three kids nicely. The third room we had was in the unrenovated part and was so bad, they had to switch rooms to be more like the fourth room, a deluxe BR which accomodated one adult and two kids. Point is, renovated rooms are the only way to go. I had read on here about the elevators being slow, we didn't experience any too terribly long waits for these. The bar is great, bartenders are pretty friendly and knowlegable, fun to have some drinks before dinner. We all decided that if we go back to NYC, we would definitely consider staying at the flatotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cozy!”
Reviews.Author: GordonPrincess
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel- we checked in hours early and were given a room. We asked to check out later and did so without penalty. The staff were all very nice and it was blocks from Times Square. We had a large room with the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. We used the frigde because it was so hot! There was a free paper outside out door some days which was nice and the front desk was quite accomodating for movie theatre request locations etc. I woul dstay there again- also, we took the limo liner from Boston and it dropped us off a street over and we were able to walk to the hotel. The fitness room is small but enough for a couple people to get a workout in with a great view. The only strange thing was in the shower: it was a half plate of glass 9see pic) you could not only see through completely, but water sprayed out of when you took a shower.

Reviews.Title: “very classy hotel”
Reviews.Author: fltcrew
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Flatotel with 2 other ladies ( one room) Oct 2-6 2005. From the moment we arrived, we knew this was going to be a classy hotel. The lobby is quiet and tastefully decorated and the front desk staff were always welcoming, helpful and polite. The room was a remodelled double on the 24 floor. We had two full size very comfy beds with cozy duvets and pillows. The bathroom was very large, modern and immaculate. There was ample drawer and closet space for 3 ladies. Our room had all the amenities required such as a kettle with coffee and tea, microwave, fridge, hairdryer, and safe. The location on 52 St between 6th and 7th avenues was wonderfully central and within walking distance of many major attractions. It was far enough away from Times Square that you felt away from all the hubub. There is a Starbucks across the street which was great to get a good coffee in the morning. If you want to take in a great view of the city, you can take the elevator to the 46th floor health club and gaze away . There are large windows on three sides. This hotel was originally an apartment block turned into a hotel thus the name:"flat"otel. I booked it through skyauction and got it for $US 220 per night incl all taxes. You pay a premium in New York Sep-Dec so you could get it cheaper in the summer or after Christmas. A room with a king bed is a bit cheaper as well. I have stayed in many hotels all over the world as I travel for a living. This was extremely comfortable, very classy and uncrowded. Not a touristy hotel at all. I'd go back to skyauction to book again as it could cost as much as $350/night in high season to book directly with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “good stay, but....”
Reviews.Author: RY18
Reviews.Content: We visit NYC 4-6 times a year, and generally stay at different hotels depending on what our plans are, and price. The Flatotel is well located for most mid-town activities, and my wife and I enjoyed our stay, for the most part. We were on the 18th floor across from the elevators, and were pleased with how quiet our room was. Other reviewers have mentioned noise, but it wasn't a problem for us, even though there was plenty of activity going on on 52nd Street. The room was nicely sized and comfortable. There was plenty of drawer space, something not always the case in many hotels. The bathroom could have had more hooks, particularly near the shower, but was quite large and well fixtured. Our room contained a microwave oven, a fridge that we could have used, and a nice desk area. We missed not having a coffee brewer in the room, although a hot water heater and single serve coffee bags were provided. Fresh coffee is available in the downstairs lobby. Why does a 40+ floor hotel only have two elevators available for guests? A few times we had to wait over five minutes for one to arrive, and they were packed on more than one occasion. We were fortunate to have very fine weather during our stay, but I can certainly understand how not having air conditioning in the hallways, bathroom and elevators would be unacceptable during the hot and humid season.
